story:
#WEATNU is "We are the New Underground."

Hello, my name is Almark, I'm an electronic musician. I started with creating experimental/abstract music during 1998. Later in 2010 I released my music to the net. Then I noticed that it was very hard to share your music with a group of people who enjoy what you create. The niche audience, those who create experimental music, electronic, avant-garde, synthpop, etc. So I formed #WEATNU in Aug of 2014.
#WEATNU is a collective effort to help the indie underground artist. We give them the power to be heard, and promote their music through our 3 forms of promotion, including  net-radio, label and online magazine. 
#WEATNU is bridging the gap for the indie electronic artist to find their audience, and of course the fans are finding their artists. #WEATNU is changing things for the better. We are creating a real impact on the web, and this of course is all free.
But we need help financially per month, using indiegogo will help us overcome any loss of donations that we already have going via paypal. Your donations will help fund this great effort + movement to help the underground artist. It will help pay for server fees, maintenance and new features that we hope to implement in time. 

We continue to grow.

Since 2014 we have been creating waves on the Internet and building up steam slowly, many artists come to us who want a little extra presence. Thanks to an entire year of pushing WEATNU we are now where we are. The artists that come to us are from all parts of the world. Electronic music outside the realm of the mainstream is eclectic in nature, but these artists need fans, they need people to appreciate them. Without WEATNU they would not have found new listeners.


#WEATNU wants to do more in 2016.

WEATNU Records: our online label has been selling digital music since Dec 2014. We want to begin offering CD's and Vinyl to our fans.  It takes a good deal of money to do this. WEATNU wants to grow and without funds, we cannot move forward. If you can give 10 - 20 dollars or more the rewards are. 
  • Free music, MP3s and special collection albums on digital and CD or special releases on vinyl, USB, etc.
  • Special edition copies, that you can only get through donation on indiegogo if we reach our goal.
  • Lower prices on T-shirts and merchandise through weatnu.com.
    [Having the funds to purchase in bulk allows us to offer t-shirts for a lesser price.]
  • Oh yeah and free t-shirts. Check our website 
How you can help #WEATNU
A donation of 5 to 10 dollars or more from those who really want to see this effort stay alive is all it takes. Remember, you are helping the indie artist in a collective manner. Our movement is helping the hidden scene of great electronic musicians be heard. We have helped well over 400 artists since the beginning. Not to mention over 80 on our label WEATNU RECORDS.
Are you an electronic musician yourself, and having trouble finding your niche audience? Then we help people like yourself.

Our goal

To change how people receive electronic music and provide a career for the independent artist through self-promo and auto-promotion, including web presence. While the music industry takes in mainstream styles, we mirror this and take in underground styles, thus creating our very own virtual music community, but simply we are a massive movement of change world-wide. There is nothing else like #WEATNU. Also since 2014 we would like WEATNU to be more well known, so it can serve future styles of Electronic music, and the artists themselves. A staple of the Internet for indie artists to rely on, always for free. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations per month sustain us, as we need funds monthly to pay for servers we use and other expensive that may come about. It takes about 200 or more dollars to run #WEATNU. Various services that help the machine called #WEATNU, net-radio, auto-tweet service, mixlr pro, web host, and even domain fees per year. (Other things may include in the future, extra promo such as Soundcloud pro, Bandcamp for labels and even streaming websites.) 
These prices to do all this are very low we feel. To donate to our paypal, please click here. To contact us for all questions, comments, please follow us on twitter. https://twitter.com/weatnu 
follow us on Tumblr, weatnu.com and Facebook

We are the New Underground is the wave of the future, we are all one!

story:
*** Thanks to all those who contributed to our first campaign***

My name is Benny Oke and I am a Nigeria-born and Los Angeles based Worship Leader & Musicianary.

Following the release of my first album, "A Heart For The Nations", I am blessed and excited to have the opportunity of recording my first LIVE WORSHIP ALBUM!

I have already begun writing and arranging songs with an awesome team of producers, musicians and songwriters and we will be recording the album, LIVE on Friday, July 24th 2015 at Hope Chapel in Hermosa Beach.

I am asking for your contribution of any amount that will help me reach the goal of producing a professional-quality worship album.

To say thank you, I have come up with some awesome PERKS just for you!

Your support would mean the world to me and would go a long way in helping me make this awesome live worship project!

We CANNOT do this without YOUR help!

Look out for updates here as we go TOGETHER on this incredible journey!

What We Need & What You Get


*** Our first Indiegogo campaign raised $3,145.  Since we were unable to to meet our initial fund-raising goal, our planning committee met and restructured our recording budget to meet our basic recording needs and go from there. ***

Here is how the budget breaks down and the COOL perks you get for your contribution:

Recording (Producer, Singers, Musicians, Recording Truck, Engineers, Gear rental, techs, etc.): $15,000

Mixing & Mastering: $2,000

Perk Fulfillment & Fees (Estimate): $3,000

Perks:



***Please note that T-shirt designs may not be final product***

Soon as we finish recording, we will be in the studio working on overdubs (smoothing out all the rough edges). Then we will start the process of Mixing and Mastering the album. I anticipate that the album will be ready to ship to you (before release, of course) sometime in October, 2015. As with projects of this kind, we may run into unforeseen delays that could push that date back! I promise to keep you in the loop!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, don't worry. You can still make your mark on this campaign by helping us get the word out. Please share this campaign with your family, friends or anyone you think might be interested in participating.
Please share on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and beyond! Just click the links on the top right corner to share, please.

story:
Hey guy's,

                   We are Outside the Shadows & we are a Christian hard rock/Metal band from Shawnee Oklahoma. We are creating this campaign to fund our brand new sophmore album "Ignite" which we feel is a huge step up from our debut album "Forgiveness" both lyrically & musically. This campaign is important to us to achieve because we are blessed & have been givin an amazing opportunity to bring hope & to let the world know that Jesus lives. We also talk about struggles we face & also touch on bullying such as our song "Take a stand" will refer to. This album takes you on a ride musically with some heavy industrial type metal/hard rock as well as some 80's rock with some solid breakdowns, to us what we love to hear in songs. If you are not able to contribute money wise please just send people our way, That would be a huge blessing in so many ways.  With your help we can bring this album to life & continue to spread the love of Christ to people all over! Thank you for your support for not only us, but the ministry as well.
                                                                  God bless you,
                                                                                  Rock on~

story:
Come out and enjoy a night of great barbershop harmony with the Right Mix Quartet! Tickets are $20.00 each (or included in your donation to this campaign).  All funds collected from this concert will help to support Rght Mix’s mission on continuing this amazing art form. Contact Zach Dunn (Lead, Right Mix Quartet) zach.dunn@mail.com for details or to reserve tickets.

Who are these guys?

We are the Right Mix Quartet, a barbershop quartet based north of Boston, Massachusetts. We offer a wide repertoire including Broadway, Pop, Barbershop Standards, Doo-Wop, and so much more! We dedicate ourselves to the preservation and sharing of barbershop harmony.

We are looking to expand our reach and share the awesome beauty of barbershop harmony with a broader community. We would like to continue to offer, low and no cost educational performances. We also hope to participate in the district convention.   That's why we need your help! Every donation counts towards the preservation of the Right Mix Quartet and barbershop harmony in our region. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute at this time, you can still help us! Here's how: 

  • Please share this campaign with your friends.
  • Join us for our concert on August 28th at  the First Church in Boston, 66 Marlborough St. Boston, MA 02116

story:
A Little About Drum & Drummer

Here at Drum & Drummer School of Music we have spent the last four years focusing on providing the best experience possible. Our students have dedicated themselves to learning a variety of instruments including: drums, piano, guitar, bass, and even the banjo. We pride ourselves on our high musical standards and our sense of community. Thanks to our outstanding instructors, our students learn amazing musical skills in a fun environment.

Drum & Drummer is also the only music school in the world to offer Erik Truelove's unique Colored Stick Program. Much like the martial arts, this curriculum is designed to allow the student to progress at their own pace, but in a very structured and rewarding setting.

We are now looking to expand our services. The audio and video recording studio will enable us to provide excellent recording quality for people who couldn't otherwise afford a top notch recording session. Whether it's a solo musician performing a cover song, or an entire band playing original music; we will be able to produce a high quality digital recording of their music as well as a multi-angled video of the recording session. 

In addition to our recording services, we will be providing online music lessons. This will allow us to reach a wider audience of developing musicians and help us grow as a school.

We already have the space, now we just need the equipment.

What We Need

In order to get this project off of the ground we will need $4,246 for equipment and supplies, such as:

  • JamHub 7-Section System: For recording entire bands.
  • Music Production Software: Cubase software provides a great range of features to help mix the music track.
  • Video Production Software: Both the GoPro Software and PowerDirector will allow us to mix the video footage giving a personalized video recording.
  • Four GoPro Cameras: This will give a variety of angles with great video quality.
  • Camera Mounts: What good is a camera without a mount.
  • A Desktop Computer: This will allow us to mix the audio and video recordings here at Drum & Drummer.

The Impact

This equipment will not only allow for us to make the audio and video recording studio, but will give us the opportunity to expand the Drum & Drummer reach by offering online lessons.

We will be able to provide one-on-one video conference lessons. Like the private lessons we offer here in Tucson, we will be able to take a personal hands-on approach to students all over the country.

This will also give us the chance to offer prerecorded online lessons and memberships; empowering students all over the world to learn the Colored Stick Program at their own pace anytime and anywhere.

The Perks

So what do you get for your contribution?

  • $5 gets you a personal hand-written thank you card from everyone here at Drum & Drummer.

  • $6 gets you a Drum & Drummer key chain. 

  • $25 will get you one of our swag packs that will include a Drum & Drummer key chain, water bottle, and T-shirt. 

  • $26 gets you a one-on-one Skype style lesson from one of our outstanding drum instructors once the campaign has ended. *Email if you have any questions about scheduling.

  • $50 gets you Studio Recording Time, this includes up to 45 minutes of recording and 45 minutes of editing.              *Image above is not our actual studio.

  • $250 or $350, depending on the area, will get you a DJ Drum House Party. *Email if you have any questions about scheduling.

Risks & Challenges

So what happens if we don't reach our goal?

We still intend to build this studio. It has been an idea that we have wanted to move forward with for some time. However, If we are unable to purchase all of the items we want for our perfect recording studio, we will still budget to get the items we need to make a great studio. And don't worry, anyone who does contribute will still receive their perk items once the studio is up and running.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not all who are reading this have money to donate, but fret not - there are other ways that you can help!

If you have any recording equipment that you are not using and would like to donate we will graciously accept it. 

Please share this page around with your friends and family, we have a lot of money to raise to make this dream a reality, so the more people that hear about it the better.

You can also share our Facebook Page around to let people know more about us and the events we have coming up so that they too can get involved in the project.

Finally, if you know musicians who would be interested in getting their music recorded then please send them our way.

Thank you for your time and help.

***If we manage to make more than our target, then we will spend the extra money on expanding our school.

Click here to enter to win our Indiegogo Campaign Giveaway.

story:
#brfmovement - a movement created to help give unsigned, unknown, underground rock / metal bands a voice and support they deserve.

I am just a girl with a big dream and a heart full of desire to help give unsigned, unknown, underground bands a chance to be heard worldwide. I want to create a supportive network where money is no object for a band to get their recorded work on a retail shelf.
In January 2015 I started Beauty Rock Fusion where I write music reviews. My reviews are always postive and always from the heart. I listen to the album of the artist and find the track of that album that either takes my heart, my soul or sends my brain into overdrive. 
It's time for me to now take my passion to the next level and make my dream a reality!
The Reality Check of the dream:
    • I wish to create a website / retail space to sell CD's, Vinyl & Band Merchandise for any and every Rock through to all Metal genres worldwide.
    • My store will be able to produce Band Merchandise with NO OUTLAY to the band, they will need to provide artwork or can pay for artwork if desired. The band will take a percentage of all Merchandise sold.
    • Crowdfunding - My store will actively champion crowdfunding campaigns to help bands with cost of tours, production, equipment and any other costs.
    • Active Newsletters to let my amazing customers know about all new albums instore and any upcoming gigs.
    • This is just a start, so much more to come!
Why Fund me?
I would like to raise up to $10000.00. I have set my goal at $1000.00 because that is enough to get my website up and running and I can also use this money to purchase albums from bands as stock for my retail space. 
Music is such a valuable part of nearly everyone's life, even if your just a person who listens to the radio on the way to work, music is in your life.
Worldwide there are so many artists who never have the chance to be heard, I want to give them a voice and create a destination for my passion and that of many others to be explored.
I will have many challenges on this journey and I am ready to tackle each challenge as it comes. I will open this store, I will have a website and Rock & Metal will live forever.
If your unable to donate money towards my campaign I completely understand but can I please request that you share my campaign across all your social networks to help get the word out that the #brfmovement is coming for you!
Follow my social media
www.instagram.com/beautyrockfusion
www.facebook.com/beautyrckfusion
www.beautyrockfusion.com
With love Natalie (#queenofrock)
P.S Horns up Crew \m/

I will open this store, I will have a website and Rock & Metal will live forever.If your unable to donate money towards my campaign I completely understand but can I please request that you share my campaign across all your social networks to help get the word out that the #brfmovement is coming for you!Follow my social mediawww.instagram.com/beautyrockfusionwww.facebook.com/beautyrckfusionwww.beautyrockfusion.comWith love Natalie (#queenofrock)
P.S Horns up Crew \m/

story:
Short Summary

We are The Band Droidz, Harlem's Original Avant Gard Punk Band!

We are three members:

Monk - Harlem native, lead vocals, sound freedom fighter


Q Maxx 420 - Lower East Side native, bass player, soldier of sound wave

Wolf - Bronx native, drums, brother darkness, fighting for the side of the light


We have recently finished a north-east U.S. tour and the response from our fans was overwhelming.  We are humbled by the love and support that we received. But more importantly, we are inspired and energized to go back out on tour to continue to spread our message of enlightened, aggressive peace.  Nothing is more effective at spreading the message of peace and love than face to face interaction with you, our fans.

Our newly assembled support team has brought together some amazing tour opportunities all across the U.S. , and soon, the rest of the world.  We stand before you, as humble servants, graciously asking for your help in continuing  our journey. 

Wether you are a seasoned veteran of this fight we call punk rock, or you are new to the side of awareness, we know that you can understand the importance of spreading PEACE and LOVE to all the people of the world.  Like so many greats that have come before us, we are here to awaken the people and join them together in lightness and consciousness. 


What will your donations go to?

Vehicle for touring - $16,000 (15 passenger van will allow us to travel to all of our shows as well as carry our own equipment for mobile shows as well)


Equipment - $3,000 

       Pedals

       $500

       Amps

       $2,500

Merchandise - $1,000

        T-Shirts, Stickers, Pins, CD's

Tour Support Staff - $5,000

         Booking Agent, Road Manager, Roadie


What perks will you receive for your donations?

Most of our perks are self explanatory and outlined on the right side of this screen.  Here are some of the more interesting ones:

$250

Dinner & the Show *Receipt +1, T-Shirt, CD

(In Tour Route or in NY)*

While we are touring, you can meet the band, break bread with us while we feast before the show, and then head backstage with us while we prepare and then perform.


$500

Day Out

(In Tour Route or in NY)*

Hang with the Band Droidz for a day while we do our usual pre show rituals and kick it in and around the city before our performance


$1,000

Private Lessons/Jam Session with the Band

4 Lessons and a Jam Session with Monk and Wolf with your choice of Drum Lessons or Guitar Lessons with the members of the Band Droidz


$10,000

Weekend with The Band Droidz

(International)**

Do you want experience the busking scene of New York, Visit the Cloisters of Dyckman, Eat at a Cuchifrito in the Bronx and live like a real millennial Punk Rocker for a weekend in New York


$25,000

A Week with the Band Droidz in NYC

(International)**

Music Lessons, Tea Lounges, Punk Rock and Incense   

IF WE DONT REACH OUR GOAL:


 If we don’t reach our Goal we must do our best to be a Band With a Van and Spread  our Music across the states and beyond with what we have. 

Our first purchase would be a van to allow us to continue to be able to travel to our shows.

Our next priority is Road-ready amps and cases. This will ensure that we never have a problem with any of the equipment being provided as we perform at different venues across the country.

Following the purchase of our vehicle and our performance equipment, we will invest in band merchandise such as t-shirts, posters, stickers etc. The merchandise will not only give fans something to remember the show and experience by, but will be a sustainable revenue stream for us to invest in extending our tour from city to city.

Once we have purchased all of the items we need to make this tour possible, any left over funds will go to maintenance of the vehicle, feeding the band (Band Droidz have to eat too!), paying our various support team members (booking agent, manager, roadies etc), gas money


The Impact

While we have played many local shows in NYC and understood the impact our music had on our community here, we had no idea how our message would reach as many people as it did on our recent tour with the  Desaparecidos and The So So Glos. Our fans left our shows energized and ready to take on the powers of oppression. 

Risks & Challenges

So far, we have overcome so many challenges that we are confident that we can conquer anything. 

Not having our own vehicle and equipment has led to us having to adapt to some extreme situations at times.

We have had a borrowed vehicle break down in the middle of a tour. We have slept in a van at a rest stop between shows.  We have driven long distances in between gigs to show up and find that the venue had been double booked.  But through all of this, we persevered.  We are serious about this mission that we are on and we are willing to put up with less than desirable situations in order to continue the fight. 

Other Ways You Can Help


If you don't have the means to contribute financially, you can still help us achieve our goal! Please share or campaign on YouTube and social media. Tell your friends, and even your enemies.  Just help us spread the word!

story:
Driving drumbeats, gritty guitars, soaring violin, chopping mandolin, thumping bass, and honest songs.


These are the key ingredients of Coyote Union.

    

Originating in 2012 in the small town of Mountain Home, AR, Jordan Finley (bass, vocals), Jake Sunnerville (guitar, vocals), Randy Merriam (guitar, vocals), and Wes Dorethy (guitar, mandolin, keys, violin, vocals) make up our small town band with big time dreams that have one goal; to make the best music we can make and travel the world playing it.  We're passionate about our music, and hope that the songs we write connect with all rock 'n roll fans out there. 


     Coyote Union has been writing and touring for the better part of 3 years.  We've had the chance with these songs to make a 6 track self-titled E.P. and play the music we love to people across the country and the world.  And now, we have the opportunity to record our debut full-length record at Trout Recording Studio in Brooklyn, NY.  We want to keep our music genuine and not influenced by any major label, so we've chosen to go out on a limb and make the record ourselves, but we can't do it alone. 

    

     A full-length record takes a lot of time and resources to put together.  Recording, mixing, mastering, and national distribution are a few of the things required for a band to put an album together.  We've chosen to go the road less traveled and do this independently.  Everything mentioned beforehand together costs around $25,000. When lots of like-minded people come together we can make big accomplishments, and this is where we need your support.  Any contribution you make - whether it's $1 or $1,000 - brings us closer to our dreams of providing you with music you can enjoy for a lifetime.  No amount will go unnoticed or unappreciated.  Even if you're not able to contribute, tell your friends and family about our goal and you will have our full gratitude.  Even if we don't reach our goal, every dollar of your contributions will go straight to funding our record (we're going to get these songs to you guys, no matter what it takes).


     Your contributions will not go unrewarded, we set up loads of perks for any amount you choose to donate.  From handwritten notes and lyrics to signed albums to even playing a part in naming the album.  We've got lots of rewards to choose from so be sure to browse through and pick the one that best suits you! 

    

We thank you sincerely for your love and support, and we hope to see you down the road or in your CD player!

~ Coyote Union

story:
Hello 

Thank you for finding my Campaign...i will confess i'm new to Crowdfunding-VERY new...in fact only began today...but i am very interested in how it works...please forgive any errors i make if you are used to this method of Communication...!

Well this post...and thanks if you have read this far...is to let you know my story...I tell people I am between 50 and 60...somewhere!...and i did all the expected things-went to a good school and University,,,did post graduate studies...became a trained secondary school teacher then a professional Careers Adviser...about 25 years in all...then the UNEXPECTED happened...I got sick.....IT came as a shock to me as I was VERY good at my job and had no history of illness...

Well time passed by ....so AFTER LONG DELIBERATION with Doctors and Managers decided i must put either my job or my health first...thankfully i chose the latter...to the disappointment of my bank manager....but my doctor was pleased...

After a period of time-several years-out of the Education environment,a light came on finally in my head...I wanted to GIVE to people again...the hunger for life began to return...however i knew i must NOT return to my former career....it was a risk i was not prepared to take with my general health...

But the light came on...and i picked up my guitar again-having not played for several years...I WROTE A SONG,,,its called "Now I Know"...and my wife tania and my close family liked it...but most importantly I LIKED IT!...I now had the inspiration to write more songs....I simply had pen and paper,an acoustic guitar,and an iphone with built in microphone ...I recorded my demos onto an iphone...then i had to WISE UP...to TECHNOLOGY...How to record more professional music at home on a shoestring budget......and now i was MOTORING....

So i had woken up to the joys of songwriting...it is great therapy for me and other people actually enjoy the music...I am clearly when you hear my songs influenced by THE BEATLES BOB DYLAN THE BYRDS NICK DRAKE ALL ACOUSTIC GUITAR POP FOLK BLUES MUSIC...A wide spectrum i admit...

So i joined several music platforms...REVERBNATION;SOUNDCLOUD;YOUTUBE;FACEBOOK;TWITTER...and now i am starting to BLOG my music too!

How do i move forward? ...i am in a position where i have 14 very good songs ...recorded using a simple iphone...but now i want more...i want to go into a recording studio and make a professional CD.....If you contribute to my indiegogo  appeal then you will in November 2015 receive a CD from me of my best tracks and it will be signed and numbered individually....... if you go to my page you can contribute as little as £5....and YOU get a quality CD in the bargain too...and believe me the feedback on my songs is very good...but i need YOUR help to push on to realise my full potential and to give the best quality music it is possible for me to make...

THANK YOU FROM MY HEART


Sincerely Yours,

Bill Bront

story:
The first time I had a microphone in my hand I was just under 2 years old, without knowing that Music would be my LIFE. My dedication, my passion, my time, my laughter, my sweat, my tears. My Happy Place, My Sad place, the builder of my bank balance and the taker of my bank balance, the filler and killer of my soul, the warmer and  breaker of my heart!

I started playing in a band well before I left High School, I left my home, my family, my friends to pursue a career in the Music Industry, I missed out on seeing my younger sisters grow up. I missed my Parents and friends continuously.

My Journey as a singer/songwriter has been amazing, I have had the pleasure of meeting so many wonderful people, I have had such fantastic support from people who have shared so many shows with me, who have purchased albums and merchandise upon all releases, people who have been there for so many moments in my life. People who have appreciated my passion for what I do. I am COMPLETELY GRATEFUL for this support!

In the time I have spent making music, I have been lucky enough to get a little financial support from generous friends and I have funded my career independently, I have released albums and film clips. My last Album "YES" was released in 2011, I absolutely loved making the album and the sound was something I had strived for and I felt like I had accomplished something that I had always wanted, I am now being asked continuously when the next release will be, the truth is, I had hoped it would be 2 YEARS AGO, but my living is made ENTIRELY from Music and has been since I was 15. The time has come for me to release and perform some new music, I have written some really heart felt new tunes and I don't just want them sitting on a piece of paper in the office! But like everyone else, I have the general cost of living. I would also like to record some live in the studio covers for the people who have been requesting them.

THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN :) 

By paying for the Album before it is made, you are helping to cover the costs of a new release, therefore making it POSSIBLE. I am offering a few different ways to get the Music. Networking is not something I excel at, I HATE asking people for help, I HATE asking people for their hard earned cash, but at the same time I don't want to be letting people down by NOT bringing out fresh product, I am therefore asking for your support in exchange for ME, for my music, my heart and soul! Whether it be just the album, other merchandise, a USB with ALL of my Music on it, special sentiments and even YOUR OWN SONG. I want to make sure the product is Great Quality therefore I am needing to raise a decent amount to make it happen.

If you head on over to the Perks/Pledge part of this campaign you will see the options :) 

THANK YOU so much for taking time out of your busy lives to read my story. The smallest amount will help, I know there are SO MANY artists using the same tools with the SAME fanbase. If you are unable to help financially, even sharing this campaign on your social networks could really help!

Sending you a big hug and a Smile.

Luella 

xoxox

story:
{version française ci-dessous}

Our Project

Founded in 2013, Pronto Musica is a non-profit organization which provides professional-quality performance opportunities to promising classical musicians who are transitioning between post-secondary education and the professional world. Our mission is to create a full-time professional training orchestra in Canada.

The need for an orchestral training program in Canada is dire.  Similar programs have existed for almost 30 years in the United States and Europe with impressive audition success rates for their fellows.  Aside from summer training programs, there is no environment for musicians in Canada that enables them to continue their orchestral development upon finishing their studies.  Many musicians have to turn to work in unrelated fields to support themselves financially, usually at the expense of their practice time.  We feel strongly that this initiative would not only help the emerging musicians of today, but that it would also contribute greatly to the future of classical music in Canada.

The Impact of Your Donation

Our initiative is one that we want to grow to a full-time, national scale, something which would be fully realized in the next 3 to 4 years.  In the short term, the campaign funds will go to financing our current season (details below!) and stipends for musicians, which means the immediate creation of, and accessibility to, orchestral training for these players.  The campaign funds will also go towards a marketing budget that will be used to pitch Pronto Musica to major financial and musical organizations who can give us the stable, large-scale funding required to fulfill our mission.  Not to mention, the contributions of people like you across the country will show them the enthusiasm and need for an orchestral training program in Canada!

Key Facts for Our 2015-2016 Season

  • Our 2015/2016 season consists of 2 orchestra concerts featuring professional soloists, including Axel Strauss (violin), Matt Haimovitz (cello) and Philip Chiu (piano) in the Beethoven Triple Concerto in March 2016
  • An additional surprise event will be announced shortly, featuring the Montreal Symphony's Principal Trumpet, Paul Merkelo, as soloist!
  • Repertoire is selected by our Artistic Director, Maestro Alexis Hauser, based on ensemble size, relevance to orchestral training and promotion of Canadian composers.  This season's highlights are the Fauré Requiem,  Stravinsky's Pulcinella Suite and Beethoven's 8th Symphony.  Click here for full details!
  • Musicians are expected to attend four 3-hour rehearsals in preparation for each concert
  • Chamber music concerts are planned throughout the season depending on availability and initiative of musicians in the program

Who are these young musicians you're supporting?

The musicians in Pronto Musica are a group of Canada's most promising classical music talent.  Presently, they are primarily graduates of McGill University, the University of Montreal and the Montreal Conservatory, though several members also hold degrees from international music schools, including the Yale School of Music, The New England Conservatory, the Manhattan School of Music and the San Francisco Conservatory.  Our orchestra is also home to many winners of major national competitions, including the Montreal Symphony Orchestra Standard Life Competition, McGill's Golden Violin Competition, and the Canada Council Instrument Bank Auditions, to name a few.   These young musicians are incredibly talented and at the top of their game.   We want to help them keep their momentum after graduation so that they are able to transition into the professional world and begin their careers in orchestras around the world. 


Short-Term Goals (2016-2017 Season)

  • Increase the number of concerts in our annual concert series (6-8 per year)
  • Increase the size of the orchestra to include full brass and percussion sections
  • Offer masterclasses and coachings with professional orchestral musicians
  • Upgrade to a larger concert venue with more seating and built-in box office
  • Create fund for percussion instrument rental and transport
  • Create fund for paid advertising/marketing

    Long-Term Goals (2017 onwards)

    • Establish infrastructure for a full-time training program (30 concerts per year)
    • Recruit musicians at a national level
    • Offer housing and living stipends to musicians
    • Offer a salary to the members of the administrative team
    • Provide travel stipends to Pronto musicians for competitions and auditions

    Budget

    The more we raise, the better and more accessible we can make this program for musicians.  We want to be able to provide them with a stipend that makes it financially possible for them to devote the time to their training, but this amount will vary depending on funding.  We also have to deal with logistical costs — for example, logistics of one concert alone can cost $10,000 when considering the following:

    • Venue rental and insurance: $3,500
    • Rehearsal space rental: $2,000
    • Library rental: $1,000
    • Audio and Video Recording: $500
    • Printing (programs, posters) and Translation: $500
    • Advertising: $500
    • Reception costs: $300
    • Percussion rental and transportation: $500

    Every dollar contributes to the success of these talented young musicians.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please spread the word! Share our campaign via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Google+, word of mouth — every little mention helps us get closer to our goal of making our training program a reality.   Thank you!


    ------------------------------------------------------

    Notre Project

    Fondé en 2013, Pronto Musica est une organisation à but non-lucratif qui a comme but de fournir des opportunités de performance au niveau professionnel aux jeunes musiciens émergeants qui font transition du monde postsecondaire au monde professionnel. Notre but est de créer un orchestre de formation professionnelle (à temps plein) au Canada.

    Le besoin d’un tel programme d’orchestre au Canada est d’une dure nécessité. Des projets similaires existent déjà depuis une trentaine d'années aux États-Unis et en Europe et les jeunes musiciens qui y participent connaissent un grand succès lors de leurs auditions.  Par contre, à part les programmes d’été, la possibilité de continuer leur développement orchestral n’existe pas pour la plupart des musiciens canadiens qui doivent prendre n’importe quel travail pour gagner leur vie au détriment de leurs poursuites musicales.  Nous croyons que notre programme aurait non seulement un impact immédiat pour nos musiciens, mais qu’il contribuerait aussi à l’avenir de la musique classique au Canada.


    L’impacte qu’auront vos dons

    Nous voulons que notre initiative s’agrandisse dans les prochaines trois à quatre années pour atteindre un niveau national à temps plein. Pour l’instant, vos dons serviront à financer notre saison 2015-2016 et à fournir un revenu à nos musiciens, donc créant une opportunité de formation immédiate pour eux. Nous voulons aussi créer un budget de marketing qui nous permettra de lancer nos idées aux institutions financières et aux organisations musicales. Il va sans dire que vos dons montreraient non seulement l’enthousiasme des gens à travers le Canada envers ce programme mais aussi le besoin!


    Les points saillants de notre saison 2015-2016

    • Cette saison consistera de deux concerts d’orchestre mettant en vedette des solistes professionnels, dont Axel Strauss (violon), Matt Haimovitz (violoncelle) et Philip Chiu (piano), qui joueront ensemble dans le Concerto Triple de Beethoven en mars 2016
    • Nous avons un évènement spécial qui sera annoncé sous peu qui mettra en vedette le trompettiste solo de l’Orchestre symphonique de Montréal, Paul Merkelo!
    • Le répertoire est sélectionné par notre directeur artistique, Maestro Alexis Hauser, dépendant de la grandeur de l’orchestre, de la pertinence aux études orchestrales et de la promotion des compositeur(e)s canadien(ne)s. Cette année nous présenterons de grandes œuvres, telles que le Requiem de Fauré, la Suite Pulcinella de Stravinsky et la 8e symphonie de Beethoven. Pour plus de détails, vous pouvez cliquer ici.
    • Nos musiciens doivent participer à quatre répétitions de trois heures en préparation pour chaque concert
    • Les concerts de musique de chambre sont organisés au cours de l’année selon la disponibilité et l’initiative de nos musiciens

    Qui sont les jeunes musiciens que vous soutenez?

    Pronto Musica consiste d’un groupe de musiciens classiques qui sont parmi les plus talentueux au Canada. En ce moment, Pronto Musica est composé surtout des diplômés de l’Université McGill, l’Université de Montréal et le Conservatoire de musique de Montréal. De plus, plusieurs de ces musiciens sont aussi diplômés de grandes écoles internationales, telles que l’École de musique de Yale, le Conservatoire de New England, l’École de musique de Manhattan et le Conservatoire de San Francisco. Notre orchestre consiste aussi de nombreux lauréats des grands concours, comme le Concours Standard Life de l’Orchestre symphonique de Montréal, le Concours du violon d’or de McGill et les auditions de la Banque d’instruments du Conseil des arts du Canada. Nos jeunes musiciens sont extrêmement doués et ils sont parvenus au faîte des honneurs.  Nous voulons les aider à garder ce niveau supérieur lorsqu’ils terminent leurs études pour qu’ils puissent poursuivre des carrières dans le monde professionnel des orchestres à travers du monde.


    Buts : À court-terme

    • Augmenter le nombre de concerts dans notre saison annuelle (de six à huit concerts par année)
    • Augmenter la grandeur de l’orchestre pour y inclure une section complète de cuivres et de percussions
    • Offrir des classes de maître avec de grands musiciens reconnus mondialement
    • Présenter nos concerts dans de meilleures salles, avec une plus haute capacité et comprenant une billetterie
    • Créer un fonds pour la location et la transportation des percussions
    • Créer un fonds pour la publicité et le marketing


    Buts : À long-terme

    • Établir l’infrastructure pour un programme d’instruction à temps plein (30 concerts par année)
    • Recrutement de musiciens au niveau national
    • Offrir du logement et des honoraires à nos musiciens
    • Offrir un salaire aux membres de l’équipe d’administration
    • Fournir des bourses aux musiciens qui voyagent pour les concours et les auditions


    Budget

    Nous voulons pouvoir fournir des honoraires à nos musiciens pour qu’ils puissent se dédier à leur art, mais ce montant dépend du niveau des fonds que nous pouvons monter. Nous devons aussi nous occuper des coûts logistiques ― par exemple, le coût d’un seul concert peut facilement atteindre 10,000$:

    • Location d’une salle de concert et l’assurance : 3,500$
    • Location de salle de répétition : 2,000$
    • Location de matériaux de la bibliothèque : 1,000$
    • Enregistrements audio et vidéo : 500$
    • Imprimerie (programmes, affiches, etc.) et traduction : 500$
    • Promotion et publicité : 500$
    • Coûts de réception : 300$
    • Location d’instruments de percussion et leur transport : 500$

    Chaque dollar contribuera au succès de ces jeunes musiciens doués.


    D’autres façons de faire une contribution

    S’il vous plaît, passez le mot! Partagez notre campagne par courriel, Facebook, Twitter, Google+, par la bouche à oreille — tout ceci nous aidera à atteindre notre but de rendre ce programme une réalité. Merci!
story_txt:
{version française ci-dessous}
Our Project
 
Founded in 2013, Pronto Musica is
a non-profit organization which provides professional-quality performance
opportunities to promising classical musicians who are transitioning between
post-secondary education and the professional world. Our mission is to create a full-time professional training orchestra in Canada. 
The need for an orchestral training program in Canada is
dire.  Similar programs have existed
for almost 30 years in the United States and Europe with impressive audition success rates for
their fellows.  Aside from summer
training programs, there is no environment for musicians in Canada that enables
them to continue their orchestral development upon finishing their studies.  Many musicians have to turn to work in unrelated
fields to support themselves financially, usually at the expense of their
practice time.  We feel strongly that this initiative would
not only help the emerging musicians of today, but that it would also
contribute greatly to the future of classical music in Canada. 




The Impact of Your Donation

Our initiative is one that we want to grow to a full-time, national scale, something which would be fully realized in the next 3 to 4 years.  In the short term, the campaign funds will go to financing our current season (details below!) and stipends for musicians, which means the immediate creation of, and accessibility to, orchestral training for these players.  The campaign funds will also go towards a marketing budget that will be used to pitch Pronto Musica to major financial and musical organizations who can give us the stable, large-scale funding required to fulfill our mission.  Not to mention, the contributions of people like you across the country will show them the enthusiasm and need for an orchestral training program in Canada!

Key Facts for Our 2015-2016 Season


Our 2015/2016 season
consists of 2 orchestra concerts featuring professional soloists,
including Axel Strauss (violin), Matt Haimovitz (cello) and Philip Chiu (piano) in the Beethoven Triple Concerto in March 2016
An additional surprise event will be announced shortly, featuring the Montreal Symphony's Principal Trumpet, Paul Merkelo, as soloist! 

Repertoire is selected by
our Artistic Director, Maestro Alexis Hauser, based on ensemble size, relevance
to orchestral training and promotion of Canadian composers.  This season's highlights are the Fauré

Requiem,  Stravinsky's Pulcinella Suite and Beethoven's 8th Symphony.  Click here for full details!

Musicians are expected to
attend four 3-hour rehearsals in preparation for each concert
Chamber music concerts are
planned throughout the season depending on availability and initiative of
musicians in the program


Who are these young musicians you're supporting? 

The musicians in Pronto Musica are a group of Canada's most promising classical music talent.  Presently, they are primarily graduates of McGill University, the University of Montreal and the Montreal Conservatory, though several members also hold degrees from international music schools, including the Yale School of Music, The New England Conservatory, the Manhattan School of Music and the San Francisco Conservatory.  Our orchestra is also home to many winners of major national competitions, including the Montreal Symphony Orchestra Standard Life Competition, McGill's Golden Violin Competition, and the Canada Council Instrument Bank Auditions, to name a few.   These young musicians are incredibly talented and at the top of their game.   We want to help them keep their momentum after graduation so that they are able to transition into the professional world and begin their careers in orchestras around the world.  

Short-Term Goals (2016-2017 Season) 
 


Increase the number of
concerts in our annual concert series (6-8 per year)

Increase the size of the
orchestra to include full brass and percussion sections
Offer masterclasses and coachings with professional orchestral musicians
Upgrade to a larger concert
venue with more seating and built-in box office
Create fund for percussion
instrument rental and transport
Create fund for paid
advertising/marketing 


   
Long-Term Goals (2017 onwards)





Establish infrastructure
for a full-time training program (30 concerts per year)
Recruit musicians at a
national level


Offer housing and living
stipends to musicians 

Offer a salary to the
members of the administrative team
Provide travel stipends to
Pronto musicians for competitions and auditions
  BudgetThe more we raise, the better and more accessible we can make this program for musicians.  We want to be able to provide them with a stipend that makes it financially possible for them to devote the time to their training, but this amount will vary depending on funding.  We also have to deal with logistical costs —

 for example, logistics of one concert alone can cost $10,000 when considering the following: 
Venue rental and insurance: $3,500
Rehearsal space rental: $2,000
Library rental: $1,000
Audio and Video Recording: $500
Printing (programs, posters) and Translation: $500
Advertising: $500
Reception costs: $300
Percussion rental and transportation: $500 

 Every dollar contributes to the success of these talented young musicians.

Other Ways You Can HelpPlease spread the word! Share our campaign via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Google+, word of mouth — every little mention helps us get closer to our goal of making our training program a reality.   Thank you! ------------------------------------------------------

story:
Vaudou Montréal- La websérie 

Vaudou Montréal, c'est un habile croisement entre humour et horreur. Une série documentaire en huit épisodes qui dresse le portrait de l'énigmatique Sorcier Vaudou.
Ce mécréant nous partage sa passion de la sorcellerie en jetant des sorts au grand public.  Le but premier de ces capsules est d’informer et divertir le grand public sur la pratique de la vraie magie, la télépathie, la télékinésie et la création de talismans, en somme, utilisation des forces cosmiques.
En suivant ses pas, vous apprendrez à créer des zombies, à construire une lampe magique et à démystifier le jargon de la magie.
Le corps de Richardson Zéphir a été pris en otage par le sorcier maléfique. Aidez-nous à amasser les fonds nécessaires pour terminer la série et DÉLIVRER le pauvre humoriste Richardson Zéphir des forces de la magie noire.

Notre sociofinancement : comme par magie!

Pour réussir à faire la websérie Vaudou Montréal, la recette est simple:

  • 1 licence de diffusion de Musique Plus
  • 4 personnes dévouées ( 1 réalisateur/monteur, 1 scénariste, 1 productrice et 1 directeur photo)
  • 1 gars de son
  • 30 acteurs
  • 1-2 caméras
  • 2 500$ en sociofinancement (minimum)
Mélangez le tout, visitez le http://www.musiqueplus.com/ et visionnez les 8 épisodes de Vaudou Montréal à partir de janvier 2016.

Les premiers ingrédients sont déjà tous prêts sur notre table! Il ne manque que VOTRE SUPPORT afin d'obtenir le dernier ingrédient. Pour se faire, choisissez l'une des contreparties suivantes:

1. Le tatouage d'amour

2. La paire de billets pour le show d'humour: Les héros du dimanche! (Show en octobre)


3. L'élixir rajeunissant


4. T-Shirt Poches & Fils à l'effigie de Vaudou Montréal: devenez invisible! ***Nous vous contacterons pour la grandeur et le genre de t-shirt! (XS-S-M-L-XL/ Homme ou femme).


5. Devenez figurant lors de l'épisode qui sera tourner dans un avion! (Valide pour 2 personnes)

6. L'ensemble magique: Tatouages, Élixir, T-Shirt Poches & Fils et expérience de figuration. Tout cela pour un prix MAGIQUE!

7. La pièce de résistance : LE MAUVAIS COUP! On te propose de donner un rendez vous dans un lieu public à  quelqu'un que tu connais bien. Le Mage Vaudou et son équipe de tournage sera au rendez-vous à votre place... et tentera de faire un tour de magie devant votre connaissance. Attention! Le malaise sera au rendez-vous puisqu'avant de le rencontrer, vous nous donnerez plusieurs informations personnelles sur cette personne. Heureusement, l'équipe de tournage sera là pour immortaliser le moment. Un petit vidéo vous sera envoyé par courriel!

L'importance de votre contribution

Non seulement, votre aide permettra à Richardson Zéphir de se libérer des forces de l'occulte, mais vos dons permettront de réaliser une websérie de qualité qui sera diffusée sur musiqueplus.com.
Les huit épisodes que vous verrez sur la plateforme Musique Plus seront divertissants, hors du commun et surtout... vous y verrez votre nom au générique final et ce, pour n'importe quelle contrepartie.

Notre objectif

Ce genre de série est habituellement financé avec des dizaines de milliers de dollars. Nous désirons relever le défi de faire une websérie de qualité malgré notre sous-financement. Bref, votre support est important. 

D'autres façons d'aider

Visitez notre page Facebook! Partagez-la!

https://www.facebook.com/VaudouMontreal

D'autres façons d'aider
Visitez notre page Facebook! Partagez-la!
https://www.facebook.com/VaudouMontreal

story:
Bang Tango was often lumped in with the whole 80's glam metal movement (perhaps due to their pretty-boy looks and the fact that they hailed from Los Angeles), the hard-rockin' quintet was one a few L.A. glam groups to incorporate funk into its sound - around the same time as the Red Hot Chili Peppers and Faith No More made it acceptable to do so. Their line up consisted of Joe Leste' (Vocals), Kyle Stevens (Guitar),

Mark Knight (Guitar), Kyle Kyle (Bass), and Tigg Ketler (Drums), and piqued the interest of Mechanic/MCA shortly after the quintet issued their first in-concert recordings, 1987's "Live Injection".

Their major-label debut, Psycho Cafe, was issued in 1989. MTV's Headbangers Ball gave significant air time to their single "Someone Like You", and eventually it became a mainstay on the dial MTV charts. The group continued to issue albums throughout the early 1990's including "Dancin' On Coals", "Ain't No Jive...Live!" and the critically acclaimed "Love After Death".

In 2000, Leste' formed a more modern-sounding alt-metal outfit, Beautiful Creatures, issuing a self-titled debut the same year on Warner Brothers. Beautiful Creatures toured as part of the 2001 Ozzfest as well as supporting KISS on a number of dates.

Bang Tango has since produced three studio albums this decade. "Ready To Go" (2004), "From The Hip" (2006), and the latest release “Pistol Whipped in the Bible Belt” (2011).

Bang Tango - "Pistol Whipped In The Bible Belt"

01. Dick In The System
02. Suck It Up
03. Our Way
04. Bring On The World
05. Have You Seen Her
06. Live Life
07. I Like It
08. Boom Box Seance
09. Drivin
10. Pistol Whipped In The Bible Belt

Band:
Joe LeSte - vocals
Scott LaFlamme - guitars
Lance Eric - bass, guitar and backing vocals
Trent Anderson - drums

Additional Musicians:
Alex Grossi - guitar
Drew Fortier - guitar and backing vocals
Darryl Coutts - keyboards, piano and Hammond B3
Lisa Beery - backing vocals
Kevin Rodgers - backing vocals
Max Lewis - backing vocals
Nick Beery - backing vocals

Production:
Produced by Daniel Salcido and Kevin Rodgers. Mastered by Anthony Focx. Executive producer Travis Anschutz.

This is the first time Bang Tango - "Pistol Whipped In The Bible Belt" has been released on vinyl. We have kept the original recordings of 10 songs. We have changed the cover for the vinyl version of this great record by Joe and the guys. There will only be 500 copies available on mixed color vinyl. If you buy more then one copy you are guaranteed different colors of vinyl.

For more information on this release or any future releases please contact Blastzone Entertainment at blastzoneentertainment@yahoo.com

(Vocals), Kyle Stevens (Guitar),
        Mark Knight (Guitar), Kyle 
Kyle (Bass), and Tigg Ketler (Drums), and piqued the interest of 
Mechanic/MCA shortly after the quintet issued their first in-concert recordings, 1987's "Live Injection".
Their major-label 
debut, Psycho Cafe, was issued in 1989. MTV's Headbangers Ball gave 
significant air time to their single "Someone Like You", and eventually 
it became a mainstay on the dial MTV charts. The group continued to 
issue albums throughout the early 1990's including "Dancin' On Coals", 
"Ain't No Jive...Live!" and the critically acclaimed "Love After Death".
In 2000, Leste' formed a more modern-sounding alt-metal outfit, Beautiful Creatures, issuing a self-titled
 debut the same year on Warner Brothers. Beautiful Creatures toured as 
part of the 2001 Ozzfest as well as supporting KISS on a number of 
dates.
Bang Tango has since 
produced three studio albums this decade. "Ready To Go" (2004), "From 
The Hip" (2006), and the latest release “Pistol Whipped in the Bible 
Belt” (2011).Bang Tango - "Pistol Whipped In The Bible Belt"01. Dick In The System
02. Suck It Up
03. Our Way
04. Bring On The World
05. Have You Seen Her
06. Live Life
07. I Like It
08. Boom Box Seance
09. Drivin
10. Pistol Whipped In The Bible Belt

Band:
Joe LeSte - vocals
Scott LaFlamme - guitars
Lance Eric - bass, guitar and backing vocals
Trent Anderson - drums
Additional Musicians:
Alex Grossi - guitar
Drew Fortier - guitar and backing vocals
Darryl Coutts - keyboards, piano and Hammond B3
Lisa Beery - backing vocals
Kevin Rodgers - backing vocals
Max Lewis - backing vocals
Nick Beery - backing vocals
Production:
Produced by Daniel Salcido and Kevin Rodgers. Mastered by Anthony Focx. Executive producer Travis Anschutz.This is the first time Bang Tango - "Pistol Whipped In The Bible Belt" has been released on vinyl. We have kept the original recordings of 10 songs. We have changed the cover for the vinyl version of this great record by Joe and the guys. There will only be 500 copies available on mixed color vinyl. If you buy more then one copy you are guaranteed different colors of vinyl. For more information on this release or any future releases please 
contact Blastzone Entertainment at blastzoneentertainment@yahoo.com

story:
VERSES

This project started in the most unfamiliar of places for us, New York City. We are just three Aussies from the Australian coastal town of Newcastle.

But it was in this big city, we got a big dream.
We wanted to write music that was just as good or even better then that on the radio, but we wanted it to have word for word scripture in it. Kind of like a modern day memory verse.

We believe God when He says that His Word will not return void, so as we send out His Word through music, we believe it will touch hearts and change lives, just as His Word says it would.

What We Need 

We have purchased enough musical equipment and instruments to be able to create the music ourselves, we just need funds to get the Mixing and Mastering done so the music is at the highest calibre.

The Impact

We believe that God's word does not come back void so as we send His word out through music we truly believe that a generation can have their hearts turned to Jesus.

Risks & Challenges

The Challenges we are facing is not being about to do this full time. In order to support the project we need to work day jobs and then work on the project after hours. So the funding will be incredibly helpful in lifting this burden a little.

A risk we have taken is not charging for our first release and we hope to continue to do this. We really want the word of God to be accessible to every person so we didn't want cost to be a hurdle to that. This is why our music is legally available for free download and also available on iTunes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can spread the word on any social media outlets

Share the lyric video or free links to the songs that would be amazing too!

story:
Summary

We are Aire Alistair (pronounced air alice-stair) - an alt-pop-indie-rock band from Cincinnati made up of three musicians who love their craft.  For those of you who know either Brent, Nate, or Abbie you're probably well aware of our affinity for music and you might have heard us talk about our newest musical adventure.  Combined we've been making music for a long time and Aire Alistair blends the sensibilities of Brent's melodic writing and production work with Nate's solid drumming and Abbie's unique violin sound.  Brent's been writing songs for this album for a year and a half and we're currently working very hard on rebranding, rehearsing, and recording.  This is where you come in!

We not only need your help but we want to bring you along for the journey of remixing, and re-recording some parts on a full length album that we'll release in January of 2016.  We've given away 13 songs over the course of a year or so to you lovely people and now we're boiling those tracks down to the top 10 to breathe some new life in and add some general professional polish.  Then we'll replicate them on CD and do a celebratory album release concert at the Southgate House Revival in Newport, KY on January 16th of 2016.  Even though that seems far away, we actually need your help right now.

You are essential to making this record happen!  Aire Alistair needs more than just fans, we need some passionate friends, family, and fans to create momentum and carry this unique music into the new year.  The songs are already written (you've probably heard them on the free EPs) and are being arranged and we've loved sharing the demo-quality tunes with you this past year but it's time to make something a bit more epic and we want you to join us on the journey.

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $5,300 for this Indiegogo campaign.  Some approximate costs are listed below.  You'll get some phenomenal perks to join us in the process too that you can see outlined in the "Perks" section on the right.  We've tried to consider both budget-aware and overly-beneficent giving.  We'd love for many of you to look at this as a wonderful way to pre-order the full-length CD.  If you can do more - awesome!  We need several generous people to go above and beyond.  We're doing this record on a shoestring budget compared to even other independent bands who'll spend 40-50k on one album.  Keep in mind our costs aren't even factoring in a full knowledge of perks like T-shirts, stickers, etc. We're not even budgeting for much in the area of marketing or advertising to launch.  

The Impact

In a world of digital streaming and online guerilla marketing it's important that we go "old-school" by making a physical CD.  By making a tangible album it gives you - the fans and family - who want a tactile experience something to literally hold on to.  It will also give Aire Alistair something to differentiate us from other bands when we give albums out to industry people in "high places".  Nothing can replicate the feeling of an actual CD in your hand with compelling artwork and imagery to go along with it.  (We would go even more "old-school" with a vinyl pressing too if we could.)

Inviting all of you to a massive album release party will be such a great way to celebrate the music and our friendship and bring these songs into a live, high-energy environment.  This will give us the opportunity to play more live concert dates in 2016. 

Risks & Challenges

Without additional funds we'll keep moving forward with the vision of Aire Alistair but it'll be significantly harder.  The challenge is this - this should happen now because the timing is right, the band is in place, the songs are written, and  the stars are aligned.

  • Despite decent songwriting and arranging, without professionally mixed and mastered songs we won't be taken seriously outside of family and friends when trying to gain a broader audience.
  • If we don't have music ready for streaming, or licensing it's more difficult to get song placements for TV and film.
  • If we don't raise the amount of money we're asking for we will press on!  We'll probably eliminate some of the marketing and brand building costs and rely heavily on word-of-mouth and friend to friend sharing and build our brand slowly over the next year.  This will be especially difficult but we'll press through.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  Here are some ways you can dive in and be part of the Aire Alistair family...

  • Listen to what we've already done online and get excited.  www.airealistair.com
  • Follow us on FB, Twitter, and Instagram - like, share, and repost.
  • Make some noise about our campaign by sharing a link to this Indiegogo page by using the super simple Indiegogo share tools listed above.
  • The digital world on social streams can be a bit sterile.  Tell friends about us in person and maybe even share with us face-to-face that you're excited for this project.  

Let's do this together.  Thanks everybody! - Brent, Nate, & Abbie - "Aire Alistair"

Photography by & designed in partnership with our friends at Fieldhouse Collective

P.S.  Check out this latest "Field Sessions" video by our friends at Fieldhouse Collective.  They've been huge advocates and a big help in dreaming up our Indiegogo campaign and adding some phenomenal content.

story: We are super excited to partner with you to record our first full-length album of original songs. We have been invited to record at the Upper Room Studios in Hollywood, CA. The studios are located at the Hollywood House of Prayer on the Sunset Strip. We are planning to spend 2 weeks recording the album and releasing it worldwide in early 2016! We hope that you would consider partnering with us and help us realize a dream. We have been writing for this album for months now and we can't wait for you to hear the songs and the sound that is being released. God bless you!

story:
ENGLISH

Story

I'm dilover, pianist and composer. I've been pursuit the way to life for music for more than 10 years. Today I have the chance to do a big step; A record label offers me to play in NYC.

I planned a trip to NY in december, saving money in september, october and november. I listed in musician classfields and a record label called to me for playing in a band.

They expected I live in the US, but they didn't care about I live in Chile. I have the flight ticket date september 30th wow, so fast!

So, I have the flight ticket, the authorization from my boss, the visa and passport, but I haven't enough money for basic needs and emergencies. That's why I'm here asking to you for support to become my dream true and share my music with the world.

Budget

I need the help of all the fans for falling on one's feet inside NY. My goal is US$3.000 equal to a month of cheap living in Brooklyn. I calculated the amount in the following way:

  • US$1.800 | Room. This is the monthly cost of a cheaper, but safe, room.
  • US$600 | Food. This is the monthly cost of a daily lunch.
  • US$600 | Marketing. New York is full of dreamers,so I must stress from head to toe. I never traveled so far, so I must buy everything. Also, this amount will be used to elaborate rewards.

The room and food costs are based in those websites: Expatistan, Numbeo, Airbnb y Trip Advisor.

¿Why should I help?

I feel this is the big chance to open wide my diffusion horizons of my music and change these years of bread, noodles and coin salary, for playing for first time outside of my country.

The support and vision of my family, friends, work mates, and the beautiful people of Valparaiso, make me feel committed to fulfill my aims.

“chances appear once in a lifetime” and “Nothing ventured, nothing gained.”. There is just one way to proof I'm right: tripping.

Finally, who helps to me will be part of a huge story, count on that!

Who am I helping?

I'm a secretary and carpenter son. At 13 I play the piano for the very first time, and I fell in love. At age of 16 I have my first keyboard I learned by myself.

At age of 14 I was sick of Guillaín Barré Syndrome.

I said to myself I will live for music. But, first I must to prepare the scene. for that I entered to study computer science at 17yo. At 20 I left home.

I paid my career and my home, working in the same time as night watchman, butcher, programmer. In parallel I went to university and improved my technique at piano.

At 23 my father received a piano (click to see video) from a client, and gave it to me. I done big steps in my technique with this jewel.

Then I met to Hernán Cruz, affiliated RCM's teacher, disciple of Karl Richter and Julio Pérceval, and Claudio Arrau's friend.

Hernán listened my music and decided to help me to improve my technique for a year. At the end of the season, he gave directions for walking in my path as musician.

So today I work in Café con Grácià as pianist, I've invited to several national musician concerts, highlighting Chinoy.

SO, DO YOU WANT TO HELP ME ;) ?

ESPAÑOL

Historia

Soy Dilover, pianista y compositor. Desde más de 10 años he estado buscando la manera de vivir de la música. Hoy tengo la chance de dar un gran paso; me han ofrecido tocar en Nueva York.

Planeaba un viaje a NY en diciembre, plazo suficiente para ahorrar dinero. En eso, me alisté en los clasificados de músicos y un sello musical me llama para tocar con una banda.

Ellos esperaban que viviera en los Estados Unidos, pero no les importó que fuera Chileno, y me han dado el boleto para el 30 de septiembre ¡no esperaba que me llamaran tan rápido!

Tengo el boleto, el permiso en mi empleo, la visa y el pasaporte, pero no he ahorrado lo suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades básicas y emergencias que puedan presentarse.

Es por eso que estoy aquí, para pedirles ayuda para concretar mi sueño de vivir de la música y compartirla con el mundo.

Campaña & presupuesto

Necesito la ayuda de todos los fans para poder caer de pie en NY. La meta es juntar USD$3.000 que equivale a un mes viviendo sin lujos en Brooklyn. He calculado el monto de la siguiente manera:

  • US$1.800 | Hospedaje. Este es costo mensual de la habitación más barata, pero segura.
  • US$600 | Comida. Este es el costo mensual de un almuerzo diario barato.
  • US$600 | Difusión. Nueva York está lleno de gente que busca hacer realidad sus sueños; así que debo destacar desde la cabeza a los pies. Además como nunca he viajado tan lejos necesito comprar todo. Este monto será usado también para elaborar las recompensas.

Los costos de habitación y comida están basados en los sitios Expatistan, Numbeo, Airbnb y Trip Advisor.

¿Por qué debo ayudar?

Siento que esta es la gran oportunidad de ampliar los horizontes de difusión de mi música y cambiar estos años de panes, fideos y monedas por tocar por primera vez fuera de mi país.

El apoyo y visión de mi familia, amigos, compañeros de trabajo y la gente de mi querido puerto de Valparaíso, me hace responsable de luchar por mis sueños.

“las oportunidades se dan una sola vez en la vida” y “el que no se arriesga, no cruza el río”. Hay una sola forma de comprobar si estoy dando un buen paso: haciendo el viaje.

En definitiva, quien me ayude será parte de una gran historia, ¡se los aseguro!

¿A quien estoy ayudando?

Soy hijo de una secretaria y un carpintero. A los 13 conocí el piano y me enamoré. A los 16 tuve mi primer teclado, el cual aprendí a tocarlo en forma autodidacta.

Entre medio a los 14 me enfermé del Síndrome de Guillaín Barré.

Dije a mi mismo que viviría de la música. Pero primero tenía que preparar todo para aquello. a los 17 me puse a estudiar informática. A los 20 años decidí irme de casa.

Para costear los estudios y el costo de la vida trabajé de nochero, carnicero, programador al mismo tiempo, y también mejoraba mis destrezas en el piano e iba a la universidad.

A los 23, mi padre me entrega un piano (clic para ver video) que le había sido regalado por uno de sus empleadores. pude mejorar mucho mi técnica usando mi tiempo libre para practicar ya que vivía solo.

Poco después del regalo de mi padre, conozco a Hernán Cruz, profesor afiliado del RCM, discípulo de Karl Richter y Julio Pérceval, además de haber sido amigo de Claudio Arrau.

Hernán escucha mis composiciones y decide ayudar a mejorar mi técnica durante un año. Al final de la temporada, me entrega instrucciones para seguir mi camino como músico.

Desde ese momento me he puesto a trabajar en Café con Grácià como pianista, y he sido invitado a distintos conciertos, compartiendo escena con artistas nacionales, destacando a Chinoy.

ASÍ QUE, ¿QUIERES AYUDARME? ;) ?

Síndrome de Guillaín Barré.


Dije a mi mismo que viviría de la música. Pero primero tenía que preparar todo para aquello. a los 17 me puse a estudiar informática. A los 20 años decidí irme de casa.


Para costear los estudios y el costo de la vida trabajé de nochero, carnicero, programador al mismo tiempo, y también mejoraba mis destrezas en el piano e iba a la universidad.


A los 23, mi padre me entrega un piano (clic para ver video) que le había sido regalado por uno de sus empleadores. pude mejorar mucho mi técnica usando mi tiempo libre para practicar ya que vivía solo.


Poco después del regalo de mi padre, conozco a Hernán Cruz, profesor afiliado del RCM, 
discípulo de Karl Richter y Julio Pérceval, además de haber sido amigo de Claudio Arrau.


Hernán escucha mis composiciones y decide ayudar a mejorar mi técnica durante un año. Al final de la temporada, me entrega instrucciones para seguir mi camino como músico. 


Desde ese momento me he puesto a trabajar en 
Café con Grácià como pianista, y he sido invitado a distintos conciertos, compartiendo escena con artistas nacionales, destacando a Chinoy.

ASÍ QUE, ¿QUIERES AYUDARME? ;) ?

story:
The Project- "A Desert Journey"

We are a crew based out of Santa Cruz, CA and Los Angeles, CA including Pablo Orozco-Castro and Sashi Peterson that would like to make a music video for the Muzik Genesis's project titled "Desert Journey" which was released on the debut album "Retrospection" on Sept 29th, 2015. We would like to make a music video to bring awareness on the issues in our immigration system, particularly militarization across the US-México boarder and how its affecting communities on both sides of the boarder. 

With success from our first music video, which can be seen here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uz8efOFYj9c

We would like this video to send out a strong message to stop the abuse at the US-Mexico boarder. 

We need contributions to make this project possible. You can donate and receive additional perks for donating to our project including CD's, posters, skype sessions and more. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We will need $5,000 to make this happen. Costs associated with this project will go to music video production costs, buying camera equipment to film, post productions equipment, stock footage, paying potential actors and promotional costs. 
  • We have some amazing perks! From CD's, T-Shirts, even get a chance to write a song with Pablo and own the copyrights to your very own song, as well as a night on the town with Pablo including a free meal and a free concert to go to together!
  • If we are unable to reach our goal, your proceeds will go as far as to pay for the production costs, and any additional resources we will be able use the funds for including promotion, new camera equipment, promotion as far as we are able to go essentially.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

Your contribution will make a great statement, that you are willing to support independent artists such as ourselves, as well as to make a political statement down at the US-México border that we do not want to fund US militarism contributing to the war on drugs, and devastating communities on both side of the US-México Border. 

  • You're contribution is valuable to the world cause of immigration to bring attention to what is now currently happening between the United States and Mexico.
  • We have been very successful in produce and promoting our first music video "Retrospection" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uz8efOFYj9c, which has been featured on media platforms across the United States including: The Sound Chamber, The In Crowd & Rebel Access. 
  • We would like to make this process as transparent as possible to all funders, including updates on social media and Indie GoGo and pictures to see the hard work that we are putting into this project.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the 

Some of the challenges, risks and obstacles on the way to achieving our goal include: receiving enough outreach to get our voices heard, and we only have 60 days to run a campaign for this project. Please please please, spread the word and share this project with your family and friends via social media and email.

  • We think we can overcome these challenges because: we are deeply passionate about this issue happening at the US-Mexico border, we have a good network of people that would love to see this project succeed, and by keeping this project as open and transparent as possible, we believe we can provide our funders with enough information and updates to run a very successful campaign to reach our goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot donate at this time, we encourage you to share this campaign!!!

Also please take some time to learn more about the actions of ICE, learn about the US militarization along the US-Mexico boarder, and how its affected indigenous communities such as the Tohono O'odham in Arizona.

Resources:

American Civil Liberties Union:https://www.aclu.org/issues/immigrants-rights

LA Times Article about Militarization US-Mexico Border: http://www.latimes.com/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-ff-arizona-border-protests-20150527-story.html

Short documentary on the Tohono O'odham and US Militarization at the US-Mexico Border. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CjlG7P3NDWU&index=6&list=PLRqWBOOQunMolSygm_8kvkuA8VylEwUjM


More info about our projects:

Sashi's Projects: http://www.youtube.com/user/zumaoneproductions

Pablo's Project: http://www.muzikgenesis.com

story:
Philadelphia Wind Symphony

The Philadelphia Wind Symphony is a professional ensemble whose members share a common goal of engaging the Philadelphia community through presenting performances of the band and wind ensemble literature. Founded in 2011 by Virginia Allen, this is a 51-member volunteer ensemble of woodwind, brass and percussion players are citizen artists who are engaged in various professional pursuits. Under the direction of Dr. Bradley Genevro, The Philadelphia Wind Symphony presents half a dozen concerts each season around the Philadelphia region. The ensemble is committed to high-quality performances of standard wind ensemble literature while exploring new artistic heights of contemporary music.

Help Support Our Fifth Season!

We are fortunate to have an all volunteer ensemble and staff who are passionate about our mission of sharing wind ensemble performances with the Philadelphia community. Every dollar donated helps us further our mission and is applied to our direct costs of presenting performances.

  • $5,000 will help us complete the season and increase our visibility throughout the region and across the country: $1,000 will be applied to improve our branding, website and social media presence, $3,000 will help us present 4 concerts throughout the city through securing venues, purchasing music and paying for soloists and $1,000 will help pay for insurance, printing costs, and transporting our percussion equipment to various venues.

The Impact

Philadelphia deserves a professional wind ensemble and we have filled that void since our founding in 2011. The greatest impact happens during rehearsals and concerts, when our musicians and audiences come together through the musical process. We have presented almost 20 concerts and performed dozens of works composers new and old, contemporary and traditional. Your gift will help us continue to break new ground and preserve the rich history of wind ensemble repertoire.

Opportunities

We have relied on the generous financial support from our members and audiences to fund our season. By making a gift now, we can be assured that we present the music in the venues that help us connect with the communities we want to serve. Our financial limitations have presented us from doing so in the past and each dollar goes a long way!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute funds, there are many ways you can help!

  • Volunteer at one of our concerts!
  • Donate services like graphic design and photography!
  • Share this campaign with your friends!
