story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • My name is HM Johnsen. I have been playing the guitar since i was nine years old, and i`ve played almost every day since. I have one goal in my life, and that is to stand on the great Royal Albert Hall stage and play my own songs. Today i am 18 years old, and i work every single day to make my dream come true. I live in Bergen, Norway, and have a fantastic band behind my back. We play under the name HM Johnson. I am grateful and very lucky to have someone to play with, and who is willing to help me up in the music business. Band members: Jone Kuven on bass, Kjetil Osablod on drums, Kim Guldbransen on keys and HM Johnsen on vocals and guitar. 
  • CHASED. This is the first and most important step i have to make. This is my first album, and every song is ready and written.i started working on the album 2 years ago. The title song is already on youtube, and the rest are in the band. I need help to make the album, so i am starting this campaign. 
  • If you support you will put a new Blues/Rock band to life, and our music will be available for everyone. You can pre-order the album and you will get every penny back if we don`t reach our funding goal. If you have pre-ordered the album you will get extra gifts and merch that won`t be available in the store. You can choose from different package deals and you will be able to buy the packages for a much lower price than in the store.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 12 500 USD to cover our use. Every penny will be used for a top quality studio and recording process. A webside will be opened, and the cost for merch and album design will covered from the fund. 
  • You will get a special thanks for the help, and you will have access to special offers only for you. 
  • If we don`t reach our funding goals, every penny that you have funded to us will be sendt back to you. 

The Impact

We will be making vinyl and digital releases. Spotify and iTunes will be the platform for the music. Blues/Rock is the front of the songs, mixed with different cultural inspirations. if you like artists like Pink Floyd, Gary Moore, Joe Bonamassa and Eric Clapton you will love this. We will be making videos of the making, and music videos as well, and the goal is to bring a new type of blues that will hit the heart of music lovers all over the world. 

Risks & Challenges

It`s not for sure that we will reach our goals for funding. And there is a risk that we have to close the project in case we don`t have enough money. 
We will be sending back the money to the funders if we can`t make the album. It is possible that we will make a lower budget album if the goal is not reached. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute

  • You can help by sharing the campaign on sosial medias. Videos, pictures and links for campaign. Spread the word in your neighborhood, spread it on Facebook, twitter and so on.

story:
Hello - and thank you for stopping by to find out more about An American Landscape. My name is Laura Melanie Stein-Collins and I have been singing since I could speak, and performing in bars before I was old enough to drink in them.

    An American Landscape is a unique perspective of a woman (moi) who traveled across the country to find  home, community, love, and herself. The songs are a reflection of the changing landscape, looking forward, looking back.

    After decades of singing other peoples songs, I found exciting stories to tell. Having had a great experience previously recording with my former band, Blue Moon Prairie, the idea for a solo CD nagged at me.
  This CD is proof that is is never too late to make your dream a reality. 

The songs are written, the session players are on board - all that is needed is you .

What It Takes to Make a CD:

Not everyone reading this is a musician - so...what are the steps in bringing a CD to market?
This is where the money will go:
Pre-production:
  • Songwriting - the process of creating the lyrics & music
  • Arranging - who plays what, where & when
  • Musicianship - identifying the right musicians to bring the song from idealization to reality.
  • Rehearsals - playing with the musicians to avoid wasted time in the studio
Recording/Mixing/Mastering:
  • Recording the vocal and instrumental tracks.
  • Once the tracks are recorded, we then "mix" each track so the levels are correct (e.g. vocals on top of the instruments, lead instruments ahead of rhythm etc.)
  • Mastering is a post-production process that prepares the final mix for duplication. 
Printing/Duplication:
  • Once the final Master is done, it is sent off for the actually CD to be made (duplication).
  • Graphic design and artwork is submitted for the CD cover and any liner notes

Perqs:

I've spent some time looking at other campaigns and seeing what would be interesting to offer. I'm going to bet you don't need stickers, a "sweaty headband from the last performance", or other tschotskes (Yiddish word - Google knows), that gather dust. So I've compiled some thanks you that I think will be fun and not add to your cleaning regime.
  • The perks will not only include the CD, but you get to sample my other passion - Cooking! My specialty is gourmet vegan cuisine and my fabulous Hatch Green Chile sauce (and recipe!) are available. Even tastier, is the opportunity to let me teach you some of my cooking techniques in your home. 
  • Like to sing? Can you sing? Doesn't matter - you may get a chance to on the CD~!
  • A verse written and recorded just for you!
  • Certain levels also include a house concert. If you have ever attended a house concert, than you know that it is the penultimate way of experiencing a show.

Risks & Challenges

My first effort - Stories and Lies, with Blue Moon Prairie, was successful and the process of producing a CD is now familiar and comfortable.I will once again be working with Don Richmond at Howling Dog Recording studios in Alamosa, Colorado. Don is reknown for his musical abilities and recording prowess.

  • Some of the challenges may be logistical issues with guest musicians. However, the backup plan involves relying more on Don for instrumentation, and possibly having parts recorded elsewhere and mixing here.
  • Should the goal not be reached, the CD will be made, however, I may not be able to include the full compliment of songs, will have to scale down the packaging concept (no lyric sheets, use a different packaging type, etc.), and make different choices for photographic and graphic design.

OverFunding: In the event of overfunding:

  • Bonus tracks
  • The ability to bring in additional musicians
  • Expanded packaging (to include complete lyric book)
Thank you for helping a dream come true - and for supporting independent music.
Laura~

story:
Short Summary

I'm a vaporwave/vaportrap producer from Orlando, FL. I've had releases on labels like Dream Catalogue,Virtual Disk Systems, and Null Religion Records (Coming soon). But as of now I want to release my smaller projects on cassette and CD. 

What I Need & What You Get

  • Funding goes towards the ordering and production of cassettes and CDs, along with other various costs including shipping and artwork printing.
  • The first two releases I'm doing is a cassette run of 空港のための音楽 MUSIC FOR AIRPORTS and a CD run of NOW THAT'S WHAT I CALL. Both are name your price so you can listen/download for yourself to see which one you prefer.
  • No need for separate purchasing! One of the rewards will get you the release of your choice without having to purchase one once the releases are out.
  • All releases will come with download codes.
  • Any excess funds will go right back into producing more physical releases, including other albums that haven't been on any physical format.

The Impact

  • Every contribution you make will help me continue to make art and release new material.
  • All of my music is digital and available for free one way or the other, so contributing helps me bring my art into the physical world.

Risks & Challenges

  • The risks are pretty small, if worst comes to worst I would have to just reorder something again.
  • I will make sure nothing slips through the cracks, but if something happens you can give me an email at anytime and I will fix it.

Other Ways to Help

  • Spread the word! Whether it's on Facebook, Twitter, or just word of mouth.
  • Support any of my other releases

Video Credits

3D Modeling and Animation: James Webster

Video Editing and Score: Windows 98の

story:
Hi !

  • My name is Ella Tofaeono. I am 16 years old, I attend St. John Paul II Catholic College in Quakers Hill (formally known as Terra Sancta College). 
  • I am currently in Year 12/11 as I am doing pathways due to my demanding basketball schedule. I train 6-8 sessions a week and currently compete at a national level for basketball. 
  • I started playing basketball in 2010 and I was fortunate enough to have height and skill to have been looked as a future star for basketball in Australia. 

Basketball

  • I play representative basketball for the division one under 18 women and Waratah Championship League (ABA senior women) at Penrith Panthers, I have represented my school at NSW Combined Catholic Colleges, and I have represented NSW Metropolitan women three years in a row. 
  • I was lucky enough to have performed well at the under 16 Australian National Junior Championships held in Adelaide 2013 to have earned a spot in the under 17 Australian Squad as a bottom age athlete where I attended a trial selection camp. 

My Injury

  • Unfortunately I had to withdraw from the NSW Women's Metropolitan State program this year after sustaining a knee injury. 
  • I have also had to put important basketball pathways such as National Intensive Training Program, National Players Program and Sydney Flames Development Academy on hold. 
  • I have been diagnosed with an osteochondral lesion over my medial trochlea which is pretty much cartilage damage amongst the main bones in my knee. This injury requires an arthroscopy procedure and intense rehabilitation/physio. 

What your donation means to me:

  • My goals for after the surgery is to have a speedy recovery and be able to compete in other important basketball events throughout 2015 at 110 %.
  •  My goals for the future are to represent Australia at a World Championship or an Olympics, play in the Women's National Basketball League and Women's National Basketball Association and to study a degree in Exercise Physiology. 
  • Not only that but growing up in Western Sydney has given me the motivation to persist with my studies and basketball as I want to be an inspiration for Polynesian kids in the area to work hard at school and sport. 
  • I also want to be able to support my family as they have persevered and worked hard to get me to where I am today.
story_txt:
Hi !

My name is Ella Tofaeono. I am 16 years old, I attend St. John Paul
II Catholic College in Quakers Hill (formally known as Terra Sancta College). 


I
am currently in Year 12/11 as I am doing pathways due to my demanding basketball
schedule. I train 6-8 sessions a week and currently compete at a national level
for basketball. 


I started playing basketball in 2010 and I was fortunate enough
to have height and skill to have been looked as a future star for basketball in
Australia. 

Basketball

I play representative basketball for the division one under 18 women
and Waratah Championship League (ABA senior women) at Penrith Panthers, I have
represented my school at NSW Combined Catholic Colleges, and I have represented
NSW Metropolitan women three years in a row. 


I was lucky enough to have
performed well at the under 16 Australian National Junior Championships held in
Adelaide 2013 to have earned a spot in the under 17 Australian Squad as a
bottom age athlete where I attended a trial selection camp. 

My Injury

Unfortunately I had
to withdraw from the NSW Women's Metropolitan State program this year after
sustaining a knee injury. 


I have also had to put important basketball pathways
such as National Intensive Training Program, National Players Program and
Sydney Flames Development Academy on hold. 


I have been diagnosed with an
osteochondral lesion over my medial trochlea which is pretty much cartilage
damage amongst the main bones in my knee. This injury requires an arthroscopy
procedure and intense rehabilitation/physio. 

What your donation means to me:

My goals for after the surgery is
to have a speedy recovery and be able to compete in other important basketball
events throughout 2015 at 110 %.


 My goals for the future are to represent
Australia at a World Championship or an Olympics, play in the Women's National
Basketball League and Women's National Basketball Association and to study a
degree in Exercise Physiology. 


Not only that but growing up in Western Sydney
has given me the motivation to persist with my studies and basketball as I want
to be an inspiration for Polynesian kids in the area to work hard at school and
sport. 


I also want to be able to support my family as they have persevered and
worked hard to get me to where I am today.

story:
“She struts and roars, she growls and she purrs, equally capable of caressing a lyric with loving care or reaching the rafters with disarming ease.”~John Taylor, Reviewer – Blinded by Sound~

In a few short years, Ms. ANNIKA CHAMBERS has rapidly risen to be one of Houston’s local favorite Blues artists. She has captured the hearts of both Blues and non-Blues fans alike with her natural vocal talent, powerful energy, and vivacious stage presence.  Annika Chambers was named Houston Press “Female Vocalist of the Year” in 2013, and she is currently nominated for a 2015 Blues Artist Award in the “Best New Artist” category with her band, The Houston All-Stars. She has become a favorite of Houston Mayor Annise Parker, she sang America the Beautiful for Citizenship month in 2013 and was on the float in 2014 for the Houston Thanksgiving Parade. Annika was also recently honored with first SWAN (Support Women Artist Now) award by Houston SAG-AFTRA Conservatory and Women in Film Houston.

Annika Chambers’ debut album, “Making My Mark” was nominated for Best Blues in Houston by the Sammy awards.This notable CD has also ranked on the following Blues charts. 

  • #16 On Living Blues Charts

  • #1 "Bakers Dozen"  Blues411.com

  • #20 Roots Music Report

  • #10 Bluesdebut.com

As much as we would like to keep our Annika Chambers all to ourselves here in Houston, Annika has a true, God-given gift that is meant to be shared with the world.  She is rapidly reaching a ceiling here in Houston in her ability to grow professionally and personally as an artist.  Her recent performance at the 2015 SXSW in Austin was met with rave reviews, and Annika continues to receive invitations, make connections, and broaden her potential for greater opportunities on the road. 

Annika Chambers is driven, motivated, ambitious, and hard-working as an artist.  Besides playing regularly in her own performances around town, she is often seen around town as a guest vocalist for many of our other local favorite Blues artists.  In addition, to playing her music gigs, Annika and her bandmates volunteer regularly performing for children in local hospitals and playing at benefits for other local music artists and their family members. 

After her dedicated  7 ½ year tour of active duty in the US Army and then earning her degree in radio and TV broadcasting, Annika is now able to focus on her music career full-time, and she is ready to take on the world! 

The only real way that an artist can move to the next level professionally is to take the band “ON THE ROAD!” We all know this to be true. We also know that a musician’s reimbursement package for playing locally does not sufficiently fund major purchases like a “Tour Van,”  A decent, reliable Tour  Van would allow Annika and her band to pursue their dream to take the music on the road safely and reliably. 

Please listen to Annika’s special, heartfelt video message above and see her personal note below: 

Hey y'all 

First of all, I would like to thank you from my heart for taking the time to read through our campaign.  It is not easy asking for money as someone who considers herself to be a dedicated, independent woman who is used to standing proudly on my two feet.  I am no stranger to hard work and giving it all both to my music and to my community.  Anyone who knows me knows that I BELIEVE IN THE PRINCIPLE OF “GIVING BACK.” 

However, my band and I are on the brink of so many opportunities, and WE NEED YOUR HELP!   As most of you know, it is a huge dream for me and my stellar band to travel across the country sharing our music with the world.  The only thing holding us back is RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION for us and our music equipment. As many of you know, Paul Ramirez and I were stranded last year in Arizona with a broken-down vehicle.  With your help then, we made it home after a few days of pure stress!! 

Today, I am asking for your help again to support our music. I sincerely hope that you can help our cause. 

  • We are asking your donationto help purchase our first reliable TOUR VAN. 

  • Our perks for your donation range from a signed CD to an “all-access pass” for six months to our shows. 

  • We also have some cool surprise perks for our FIRST 20 MUSIC TOUR BACKERS!!!

It's tough asking for money but I'm putting my pride aside and asking.

If you truly can't help us, PLEASE share this with your friends!!

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!!!! 

Annika


facebook.com/bluesbaby85
twitter.com/bluesbaby85
youtube.com/bluesbaby85
Annika Chambers

We are asking your donationto help purchase our first reliable TOUR VAN. 
Our perks for your donation range from a signed CD to an “all-access pass” for six months to our shows. 

We also have some cool surprise perks for our FIRST 20 MUSIC TOUR BACKERS!!!
It's tough asking for money but I'm putting my pride aside and asking.
If you truly can't help us, PLEASE share this with your friends!!

story:
Who is Lady Low?

We are Lady Low and we're here to croon sweet anthems and melt your heart. Since November, we have grown exponentially, playing at popular venues around LA from the Viper Room to traveling across state to San Francisco and San Diego, leaving a trail of tears (all happy). With two music videos under our belt, we are going for an odd three. The song Rainy Day is the antithesis of our moody feel, both dark and romantic.

The Goal

Only a video of utmost quality would do a piece of our heart justice. This is where you, our supporters, come in. We truly need and appreciate every dollar that goes toward our dream; we cannot do it without you!

We want "Hello Sweet Goodbye" to be very special. Our team of talented and experienced filmmakers is excited about this project, and committed to making the most beautiful video possible. However, even a "low budget" video is expensive to make. We hope that you will be willing to be a part of creating this unique piece of art by supporting us!

The goal we've set is modest compared to the actual costs of production, but your contributions would help towards covering the costs for:

- Preproduction

- Production Crew

- Props & set dressings

- Camera Equipment

- Lighting Equipment

- Hair & Makeup

- Costumes

- Editing

- Visual Effects

- Transportation

- Location fees

- Food

The Goods

We aspire to deliver something spectacular and that is why we are offering the following perks that we think you will enjoy! 

$5: Free download of Hello Sweet Goodbye

$20: Lady Low Collectable Button and free download (plus the above)

$50 Lady Low Patches and free download (plus the above) 

$100 Lady Low T-shirt, Free download and Invitation to Video Release Party
(plus the above) 

$200 Cover Song of your choice at our next performance! (plus the above) 

$500 Guest Appearance in Hello Sweet Goodbye Music Video (plus the above)

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be amazing if you scan spread the word about our campaign on Facebook, twitter, your blogs, and anywhere else you possibly can! Thanks again!

story: We thought that this was something that we could deal with on our own, but after learning of the cost to repair the van and replace the stolen and damaged items, it is truly a circumstance that we cannot bear the weight of by ourselves. So we are asking for your help, family, friends, fans, and anyone that even remotely likes what we do, and would like to see us continue to be able to do so at the highest level possible. We have some big plans for the summer kicking off with a big tour announcement coming soon, as well as plans for our first full length album. In order to make it all happen, we humbly ask for your help.

story:
Hi, I'm Hannah! You may know me In many different capacities. You may know I have a folk/roots band but aren't aware that with VERY LITTLE PROMO we've had our music on two radio stations: WDCB 90.9FM and WFMT 94.7FM in Chicago and that we've played venues that national acts perform at. That got me thinking...what if we invested in promotion? How many more people would be able to enjoy the music?

Bands are like cars: they work best when they're running with all the right gear. You can help us get rolling! I'm hoping you can learn more about my band and enjoy our music by purchasing our album (PUSH/Studio LP1)-- available only by snail mail, it's not online anywhere so you're getting exclusive content. 

Up until now nearly all of the investment in my band is my own sweat equity, going strong for about twenty years.

With a simple purchase of $10, you are providing a push that will help get Hannah Frank Group up and running with a national press campaign and professional booking opportunities. With literally over 100 years of music experience between the four of us, we have a lot of wonderful music to share with the world. We just need a little push.

What We Need & What You Get

A national press campaign and booking support for band will cost us about $2,000 in man-hours (or woman-hours!) and services.  Once we have our promotional materials and plan in place, we can market our music to a new larger audience. Of course, our small, wonderful audience YOU make this all possible. We will be able to invest more of our own time in promotion, as well as utilize the resources of professional promotion companies.

To thank you for your unparalleled awesomeness, we have created gifts that radiate with gratitude and even a little bit of fun.

You can get our CD (PUSH/STUDIO LP1)

You can have a song written on a topic of your choice, or using a certain name.

You can get a comfy Hannah Frank Group T-shirt.

You can have us perform at your home or private event.

Even if we don't meet our complete goal, we will use the money we obtain through this campaign to fund a regional press campaign and regional booking opportunities. This will also help move our band forward. 

Just like the first footprint on the moon, every little step counts.

The Impact

Your donation will mean a lot to me on a personal level because sometimes, frankly, it's hard to make art the center of your life. It's easy to get busy with jobs and other responsibilities. However, when you consider that, I have a Bachelor's degree in Fine Art, which I obtained as a backup plan for music, you'll realize that I'm perfectly willing to starve. It's not about money. It's about putting the word out. I'm hopelessly creative and truly need your help to "go pro" with my creative passions.

My band and I have already been working hard at this:

  • According to Neil Young, rock and roll will never die. We know it's just a lyric, but there's truth to the power of music. I noticed this the first time I wrote a song. That was twenty years ago and I've written hundreds. Having them recorded and released to the world so they can be enjoyed takes some doing! There's no such thing as pixie dust.  we have spent many hours in recording studios and on live stages honing our sound.
  • For two years, Hannah Frank Group has hosted "Singing for Your Supper", a monthly songwriter showcase in Rogers Park where we've welcomed hundreds of songwriters and musicians to share their music. On First Tuesdays, this has built community in the songwriter scene and provided fans with some great entertainment, for free!
  • Your contribution will help put all of this hard work to use, as a foundation for moving forward with the knowledge and skills to be effective.

Risks & Challenges

There is a lot of competition out there. While making music is easier than ever, there seems to be literally millions of independent bands trying to get attention. We are not trying to hype ourselves up. We will combat this sea of competition by being professional and putting out a quality product.

In addition to being in my own band (which is pretty necessary, I suppose),  I'm also a Publicist for the international podcast Chicago Acoustic Underground, and it's record label, CAUDog Records. I've also been a live sound engineer, working with local bands, for over 10 years. While working with great people, I've learned a lot about the music industry in these roles, and have put in long hours and taught myself what I did not know.

The music industry background and skill set allow me to strategize and make project management decisions that are on point. The goal is always to satisfy our fans and provide more music to the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate today, we still love you dearly. Please keep in touch with us online at our website HannahFrankGroup.com, sign up our mailing list for news updates and if you're into social media, like us on Facebook and follow us @HannahFrankGrp. 
  • Sign up on our email list by email hfrankgroup@gmail.com and you'll receive email updates about the show and upcoming music.
  • You can help push this campaign forward by e-mailing this page's URL to friends and family that like folk/roots/songwriter music.
  • You can use Twitter #HFGPUSH to put the word out.
  • If you're feeling techy, use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks everyone! Now check out our cool prizes and consider donating-- just a little push helps!

Respectfully,

Hannah Frank Group!

FOLK ROOTS -- HEAR IT AT 

www.hannahfrank.bandcamp.com

Well, look at this masterpiece! Isn't it breathtaking?

I'd like to get one of these and enjoy playing on it. I will never have the chance buying it on my own, as i live and work in Hungary, with a 300 Eur monthly salary that's only enough for food and paycheques. That's why i chose social funding, maybe i can give it a try, give my dream another chance to come true. :)
I would be extremely happy with any kind of support, little can go a lot.

story:
Projet : Faire un bébé "solidaire"...

(You will find hereunder the translation to english)


Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

Je m'appelle Sarah. J'ai 32 ans. Et je souffre d'endométriose. Cette maladie me rend infertile et m'empêche de devenir Maman naturellement...

Cette maladie ne vous dit peut-être rien, alors voici quelques explications...

Découverte il y a plus d'un siècle, incurable, touchant 2 femmes sur 10 dans le monde, cette maladie gynécologique reste pourtant méconnue, ses origines ne sont à ce jour pas identifiées, et la pathologie met en moyenne 6 à 7 ans à être diagnostiquée... Pendant ce temps, elle fait des ravages... Physiques et psychologiques, irréversibles. 


L'endométriose


Qu'est-ce que l'endométriose ?

L'endométriose se caractérise par la présence anormale de fragments d'endomètre (tissus qui tapissent la cavité utérine) ou endométriomes, à l'extérieur de l'utérus. Pour les femmes non atteintes, lorsque l'ovule n'est pas fécondé, l'endomètre est éliminé durant les règles puis renouvelé. Lorsque l'on est atteinte d'endométriose, ces tissus se développent à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur de l'utérus, et ne peuvent être évacués... Des segments d'endomètre viennent alors se greffer et se nécroser en dehors de l'utérus, sur des organes génitaux comme le corps de l'utérus ou les ovaires, mais également non génitaux comme le péritoine, membrane tapissant la paroi abdominale ou le rectum.


Comment se manifeste-t-elle et quelles sont ses conséquences ?

Les symptômes de la maladie sont très invalidants sur le plan physique, mais également psychique et social :

- Présence d'endométriomes plus ou moins importants, détruisant entièrement ou partiellement, de manière définitive certains organes... ,

- Dysménorrhées (douleurs intenses précédant, accompagnant et suivant les règles),

- Dyschésies ou diarrhées (difficultés et douleurs intenses à la défécation), rectorragies,

- Troubles urinaires (douleurs et brûlures lors de la miction, difficultés à vider la vessie ou hématurie),

- Dyspareunie (douleurs intenses pendant les rapports sexuels),

- Douleurs pelviennes très intenses, provoquant des bouffées de chaleur, une incapacité partielle ou totale à se mouvoir, des nausées voire des vomissements, des vertiges, des spasmes voire des convulsions, et parfois des pertes de connaissance,

- Une fatigue chronique,

- Un isolement subi (incompréhension de l'entourage quant à la maladie, impossibilité d'honorer certains rendez-vous personnels et professionnels, etc) et un grand sentiment d'impuissance menant à la dépression,

- L'infertilité voire la stérilité. 


Quels sont les traitements ?

Il n'en existe pas. Cette maladie est aujourd'hui incurable et évolutive. Elle s’aggrave à chaque période de règles.

Les seules alternatives à ce jour sont : des opérations très invasives et répétées par cœlioscopie (lors desquelles le chirurgien va vous enlever les endométriomes, kystes qui reviendront progressivement et implacablement à chaque menstruations...), et un traitement de ménopause artificielle (ce "traitement" vous empêche juste d'avoir vos règles et donc d’aggraver la maladie, mais il ne la soigne pas).


PS : Pour obtenir davantage de renseignements sur la maladie, il vous suffit de taper "Endométriose" sur Youtube, ou encore de visiter les sites Endofrance ou Lili-H contre l'endométriose...


L'endométriose et moi


En 2011, j'ai décidé de concevoir un enfant avec mon partenaire. J'ai donc arrêté de prendre ma pilule. Très rapidement, des douleurs très importantes et tous les symptômes listés ci-dessus sont apparus, et bébé n'est pas venu... Nous avons consulté plusieurs gynécologues qui, comme pour nombre de mes "Endosisters" ont jugé que le problème était psychologique, les kystes bénins, et mes douleurs exagérées...

Jusqu'au jour où, en 2012, j'ai rencontré un ostéopathe dans le cadre de notre envie de procréer... Celui-ci a détecté la maladie et m'a envoyé chez un gynécologue spécialisé en Endométriose. Quelques jours plus tard, je rencontrais ce spécialiste, le diagnostic était posé. Sur le moment, je n'ai pas paniqué. Pour moi c'était un peu comme une MST bénigne, un petit traitement médicamenteux allait tout régler. Mais 1 mois plus tard j'étais opérée d'urgence. Les kystes étaient tellement gros qu'ils avaient pris la place des ovaires et les avaient endommagés, tout comme ma vessie, mon utérus, et mon colon. Après l'opération, je me pensais guérie, et je croyais que les problèmes étaient derrière moi... Mais quelques mois/années après, j'ai compris que la maladie ferait désormais partie de ma vie. Mon partenaire et moi avons tout essayé ou presque pour faire notre bébé, mais rien n'y a fait...

2013, je n'ai plus de partenaire (car la maladie ne détruit malheureusement pas que le corps), mais toujours cette envie profonde, sincère et viscérale de donner la vie moi aussi... J'attends de trouver l'Homme de ma vie...

Et puis début 2014, mon gynécologue m'annonce qu'il ne me reste qu'1 à 2 ans devant moi si je veux un jour porter un enfant... J'ai besoin de temps pour réfléchir, pour trouver des solutions... Pendant ce temps, je suis placée sous "ménopause artificielle", afin de mettre la maladie en sommeil quelque temps...


Un bébé, malgré l'endométriose...


Aujourd'hui en 2015, j'ai 32 ans, 4 ans se sont écoulés depuis que le diagnostic a été posé ; 1 an et demi se sont déroulés depuis l'annonce "ultimatum" de mon gynécologue, je suis toujours célibataire, et il n'est pas dans mes convictions de faire un enfant avec un homme de passage (chose qui serait d'ailleurs impossible puisque je ne peux pas concevoir un enfant naturellement). Le temps passe, le mien passe plus vite, et je ne veux pas laisser ma vie défiler sous mes yeux sans rien tenter. 

C'est pourquoi aujourd'hui je vous demande de l'aide... Ma seule chance de concevoir un enfant est de passer par une "FIV DO" (Fécondation In Vitro à partir de mes ovules, avec un DOnneur de sperme anonyme). Cela n'est pas autorisé en France pour une personne célibataire, mais les gynécologues français ont l'habitude de travailler avec des cliniques spécialisées, en Espagne et en Belgique... C'est ce qui m'a été conseillé.

Après renseignements auprès de différentes cliniques, je sais que chaque tentative coûte en moyenne 5000€... Ce prix comprenant la visite préalable à la Clinique, les traitements hormonaux et les divers examens (non remboursés par la Sécurité Sociale française), l'acte de FIV en lui-même, les soins pré et post-intervention, les trajets et l'hébergement sur place (j'habite à Montpellier) durant les jours précédant et suivant l'intervention...

A ce jour, je n'ai pas réussi à réunir cette somme à moi-seule... J'ai cherché comment faire pour y arriver, j'ai travaillé plus, j'ai dépensé moins, j'ai économisé... Et pourtant... Et un jour, alors qu'une amie lançait un projet de Crowdfunding, je me suis dit "Tiens, si je faisais la même chose pour concevoir mon bébé !"... Au départ, j'avoue que l'idée m'a semblé un peu "saugrenue"... Et puis j'ai réfléchi et je me suis dit que ce serait si beau de faire cet enfant seule, mais avec vous tous... Quelle belle histoire que serait celle de mon enfant... Et quelle belle valeur il porterait en lui : la SOLIDARITE...

Je suis donc très fière de vous présenter mon projet... Et j'espère de tout cœur que vous me soutiendrez dans ma démarche...

Je vous remercie sincèrement de m'avoir lue et de l'intérêt que vous portez à mon projet. Et je vous remercie par avance pour votre participation généreuse et solidaire. Surtout ne soyez pas gêné de ne pas pouvoir donner, ou de ne pouvoir faire qu'une maigre contribution, les temps sont durs pour tout le monde... Je suis preneuse de tout soutien, moral, matériel ou financier, quelle qu'en soit la hauteur... 

Surtout n'hésitez pas à me contacter si vous voulez en savoir plus, et n'hésitez pas non plus à partager au maximum ! MERCI !


Sarah


PS : Si nous dépassons les 5000€ (ce qui serait absolument merveilleux !!!) cela servira à financer toute ou partie d'une deuxième tentative (car je ne suis pas naïve, il faudra malheureusement peut-être plusieurs tentatives) ou, si par chance cela fonctionnait du premier coup, le matériel pour accueillir ce bébé-miracle... 


----------------------


English translation :

Project: Conceive a solidary-baby...


Hello to all of you,

My name is Sarah. I am 32 years old. And I suffer from Endometriosis. This disease makes me infertile and unable to become naturally Mum...

Maybe this disease does not appeal to you, so here are some explanations...

Discovered over a century ago, incurable, affecting 2 in 10 women in the world, this gynecological disease is yet unknown, its origins are not identified to date, and the pathology takes on average 7 years to be diagnosed ... Meanwhile, it wreaks havoc ... Physical and psychological, irreversible.

Endometriosis


What is endometriosis?

Endometriosis is characterized by the abnormal presence of fragments of endometrium (tissue lining the uterine cavity) or endometriomas, inside and outside the uterus. For women unaffected, when the ovum is not fertilized, the  endometrium is removed during menstruation and renewed. When you are affected by endometriosis, these tissues develop themselves on the inside and outside of the uterus, and cannot be evacuated ... Endometrial segments are then grafted and become necrotic outside the uterus, on the genitals as the body of the uterus or the ovary, but also non-genitals, as the peritoneum membrane lining the abdominal wall, the rectum, the bladder, and even other organs.


How does it manifest itself and what are its consequences?

The symptoms are very physically debilitating, but also mentally and socially:

- Presence of endometriomas more or less voluminous, destroying permanently, entirely or partially, some organs...

- Dysmenorrhoeas (severe pain preceding, during and following the menstrual periods),

- Dyschésias or diarrheas (difficulties and severe pain with defecation), rectal bleeding,

- Urinary symptoms (pain and burning during urination, difficulty emptying the bladder or hematuria),

- Dyspareunia (severe pain during sexual relationships),

- Very intense pelvic pains, causing hot flashes, a partial or total inability to move, nauseas or emises, dizziness, spasms or seizures, and sometimes loss of consciousness,

- Chronic exhaustion,

- A suffered isolation (misunderstanding of the entourage about the disease, unability to fulfill certain personal and professional appointments, etc.) and a great feeling of helplessness leading to depression,

- Infertility or sterility.


What are the treatments?

They do not exist. To date, this disease is incurable and progressive. It gets worse at each menstrual period.

The only alternatives so far are: highly invasive and repeated operations by laparoscopy (during which the surgeon will remove you the endometriomas, cysts that come back gradually and relentlessly at every menstruation ...), and an artificial menopause treatment (" treatment "inhibits your menstrual periods and therefore slows down the aggravation of the disease, but it does not cure it).


PS: For any further information about the disease, simply type "Endometriosis" on Youtube, or visit the websites Endofrance, Lili-H contre l’endométriose (these are French websites, but you can also find Anglophone ones on the Internet)...


Endometriosis and I


In 2011, my partner and I decided to conceive. So I stopped taking my pills. Very quickly, very important pains and all the symptoms listed above appeared, and baby did not come... We consulted several gynecologists who, like many of my "Endosisters", told me that the problem was psychological, the cysts benign, and my pain exaggerated...

Until the day when, in 2012, I met an osteopath as part of our desire to procreate... He detected the disease and sent me to a gynecologist specialist in Endometriosis. A few days later, I met this specialist, the diagnosis was made. At this time, I did not panic. For me it was like a benign STI, a small drug treatment would solve everything. But one month later I had an emergency surgery. The cysts were so big that they had taken the place of the ovaries and had damaged them, as my bladder, my uterus and my colon. After the operation, I thought I was cured, and that the
problems were behind me... But a few months / years later, I understood that the illness would become part of my life. My partner and I have tried almost everything for our baby, but nothing worked...

2013, I have no partner (as unfortunately, the disease does not destroy the body only), but still this deep, sincere and visceral desire, to give life... I expect to find the Man of my life...

And then, early 2014, my gynecologist told me that there were only 1 to 2 years remaining before the date I will not be able to bring life anymore... I need time to think, to find solutions .. . Meanwhile, I am under "artificial menopause", to put the illness on standby for a while...


A baby despite endometriosis...


Today in 2015, I am 32 years old, 4 years passed since the diagnosis was made; 1 year and a half occurred since the "ultimatum" announcement from my gynecologist, I'm still single, and it is not in my convictions to make a child with
a man passing through (something that would be impossible anyway since I cannot conceive naturally). Time passes, mine goes faster, and I will not let my life flash before my eyes without attempting anything.

That is why today I ask for your help ... My only chance of conceiving a child is through a "IVF DO" (In Vitro Fertilization from my ovum with anonymous sperm DOnor). This is not allowed in France for a single person, but the French gynecologists are accustomed to work with specialized clinics, in Spain and Belgium... This is what I have been advised to do.

After getting information from different clinics, I know that each attempt costs on average €5,000... This price includes the prior visit to the Clinic, hormone treatments and various examinations (not reimbursed by the French Social Security), the IVF act itself, pre- and post-procedure care, trips and accommodation on site (I live in Montpellier, south of France) in the days preceding and following the intervention...

To date, I have not managed to raise the money on my own... I searched how to get there, I worked harder, I spent less, saved... And yet... And one day, when a friend launched a crowdfunding project, I thought "Well, what if I did the same thing to conceive my baby!"... At first, I admit that the idea seemed a little "crazy" to me... And then I thought about it, and I finally reached the conclusion that it would be so beautiful to make this child alone, but with all of you... What an amazing story would be the one of my child... and what a great worth he would bring in him:
SOLIDARITY...

I am very proud to present my project to you ... I hope wholeheartedly, that you will support me in my approach...

I sincerely thank you for reading me and for your interest in my project. And I thank you in advance for your generous and solidary involvement. Do not be embarrassed not being able to give or, just being able to do a small contribution, times are tough for everyone... I am taker of any support, moral, material or financial, regardless of the height...

Do not hesitate to contact me if you want to know more, and do not hesitate to share the fullest!

THANK YOU!

Sarah

PS: If we exceed € 5,000 (which would be absolutely wonderful!!!) it will finance all or part of a second attempt (because I'm not naive, it will perhaps unfortunately need several attempts), or if luckily it worked the first time, the equipment to accommodate this miracle-baby...
story_txt:
Projet : Faire un bébé "solidaire"... 

(You will find hereunder the translation to english) 

Bonjour à toutes et à tous, 


Je m'appelle Sarah. J'ai 32 ans. Et je souffre d'endométriose. Cette maladie me rend infertile et m'empêche de devenir Maman naturellement... 
Cette maladie ne vous dit peut-être rien, alors voici quelques explications... 
Découverte il y a plus d'un siècle, incurable, touchant 2 femmes sur 10 dans le monde, cette maladie gynécologique reste pourtant méconnue, ses origines ne sont à ce jour pas identifiées, et la pathologie met en moyenne 6 à 7 ans à être diagnostiquée... Pendant ce temps, elle fait des ravages... Physiques et psychologiques, irréversibles. 

L'endométriose


Qu'est-ce que l'endométriose ? 

L'endométriose se caractérise par la présence anormale de fragments d'endomètre (tissus qui tapissent la cavité utérine) ou endométriomes, à l'extérieur de l'utérus. Pour les femmes non atteintes, lorsque l'ovule n'est pas fécondé, l'endomètre est éliminé durant les règles puis renouvelé. Lorsque l'on est atteinte d'endométriose, ces tissus se 
développent à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur de l'utérus, et ne 
peuvent être évacués... Des segments d'endomètre viennent alors se greffer et se nécroser en dehors de l'utérus, sur des organes génitaux comme le corps de l'utérus ou les ovaires, mais également non génitaux comme le péritoine, membrane tapissant la paroi abdominale ou le rectum. 


Comment se manifeste-t-elle et quelles sont ses conséquences ? 

Les symptômes de la maladie sont très invalidants sur le plan physique, mais également psychique et social : 
- Présence d'endométriomes plus ou moins importants, détruisant entièrement ou partiellement, de manière définitive certains organes... ,
- Dysménorrhées (douleurs intenses précédant, accompagnant et suivant les règles),
- Dyschésies ou diarrhées (difficultés et douleurs intenses à la défécation), rectorragies, 
- Troubles urinaires (douleurs et brûlures lors de la miction, difficultés à vider la vessie ou hématurie),
- Dyspareunie (douleurs intenses pendant les rapports sexuels),
- Douleurs pelviennes très intenses, provoquant des bouffées de chaleur, une incapacité partielle ou totale à se mouvoir, des nausées voire des vomissements, des vertiges, des spasmes voire des convulsions, et parfois des pertes de connaissance, 
- Une fatigue chronique,
- Un isolement subi (incompréhension de l'entourage quant à la maladie, impossibilité d'honorer certains rendez-vous personnels et professionnels, etc) et un grand sentiment d'impuissance menant à la dépression, 
- L'infertilité voire la stérilité. 


Quels sont les traitements ? 

Il n'en existe pas. Cette maladie est aujourd'hui incurable et évolutive. Elle s’aggrave à chaque période de règles. 
Les seules alternatives à ce jour sont : des opérations très invasives et répétées par cœlioscopie (lors desquelles le chirurgien va vous enlever les endométriomes, kystes qui reviendront progressivement et implacablement à chaque menstruations...), et un traitement de ménopause artificielle (ce "traitement" vous empêche juste d'avoir vos règles et donc d’aggraver la maladie, mais il ne la soigne pas). 

PS : Pour obtenir davantage de renseignements sur la maladie, il vous suffit de taper "Endométriose" sur Youtube, ou encore de visiter les sites Endofrance ou Lili-H contre l'endométriose... 

L'endométriose et moi

En 2011, j'ai décidé de concevoir un enfant avec mon partenaire. J'ai donc arrêté de prendre ma pilule. Très rapidement, des douleurs très importantes et tous les symptômes listés ci-dessus sont apparus, et bébé n'est pas venu... Nous avons consulté plusieurs gynécologues qui, comme pour nombre de mes "Endosisters" ont jugé que le problème était psychologique, les kystes bénins, et mes douleurs exagérées... 
Jusqu'au jour où, en 2012, j'ai rencontré un ostéopathe dans le cadre de notre envie de procréer... Celui-ci a détecté la maladie et m'a envoyé chez un gynécologue spécialisé en Endométriose. Quelques jours plus tard, je rencontrais ce spécialiste, le diagnostic était posé. Sur le moment, je n'ai pas paniqué. Pour moi c'était un peu comme une MST bénigne, un petit traitement médicamenteux allait tout régler. Mais 1 mois plus tard j'étais opérée d'urgence. Les kystes étaient tellement gros qu'ils avaient pris la place des ovaires et les avaient endommagés, tout comme ma vessie, mon utérus, et mon colon. Après l'opération, je me pensais guérie, et je croyais que les problèmes étaient derrière moi... Mais quelques mois/années après, j'ai compris que la maladie ferait désormais partie de ma vie. Mon partenaire et moi avons tout essayé ou presque pour faire notre bébé, mais rien n'y a fait... 
2013, je n'ai plus de partenaire (car la maladie ne détruit malheureusement pas que le corps), mais toujours cette envie profonde, sincère et viscérale de donner la vie moi aussi... J'attends de trouver l'Homme de ma vie... 
Et puis début 2014, mon gynécologue m'annonce qu'il ne me reste qu'1 à 2 ans devant moi si je veux un jour porter un enfant... J'ai besoin de temps pour réfléchir, pour trouver des solutions... Pendant ce temps, je suis placée sous "ménopause artificielle", afin de mettre la maladie en sommeil quelque temps... 

Un bébé, malgré l'endométriose...

Aujourd'hui en 2015, j'ai 32 ans, 4 ans se sont écoulés depuis que le diagnostic a été posé ; 1 an et demi se sont déroulés depuis l'annonce "ultimatum" de mon gynécologue, je suis toujours célibataire, et il n'est pas dans mes convictions de faire un enfant avec un homme de passage (chose qui serait d'ailleurs impossible puisque je ne peux pas concevoir un enfant naturellement). Le temps passe, le mien passe plus vite, et je ne veux pas laisser ma vie défiler sous mes yeux sans rien tenter. 
C'est pourquoi aujourd'hui je vous demande de l'aide... Ma seule chance de concevoir un enfant est de passer par une "FIV DO" (Fécondation In Vitro à partir de mes ovules, avec un DOnneur de sperme anonyme). Cela n'est pas autorisé en France pour une personne célibataire, mais les gynécologues français ont l'habitude de travailler avec des cliniques spécialisées, en Espagne et en Belgique... C'est ce qui m'a été conseillé. 
Après renseignements auprès de différentes cliniques, je sais que chaque tentative coûte en moyenne 5000€... Ce prix comprenant la visite préalable à la Clinique, les traitements hormonaux et les divers examens (non remboursés par la Sécurité Sociale française), l'acte de FIV en lui-même, les soins pré et post-intervention, les trajets et l'hébergement sur place (j'habite à Montpellier) durant les jours précédant et suivant l'intervention... 
A ce jour, je n'ai pas réussi à réunir cette somme à moi-seule... J'ai cherché comment faire pour y arriver, j'ai travaillé plus, j'ai dépensé moins, j'ai économisé... Et pourtant... Et un jour, alors qu'une amie lançait un projet de Crowdfunding, je me suis dit "Tiens, si je faisais la même chose pour concevoir mon bébé !"... Au départ, j'avoue que l'idée m'a semblé un peu "saugrenue"... Et puis j'ai réfléchi et je me suis dit que ce serait si beau de faire cet enfant seule, mais avec vous tous... Quelle belle histoire que serait celle de mon enfant... Et quelle belle valeur il porterait en lui : la SOLIDARITE... 
Je suis donc très fière de vous présenter mon projet... Et j'espère de tout cœur que vous me soutiendrez dans ma démarche... 
Je vous remercie sincèrement de m'avoir lue et de l'intérêt que vous portez à mon projet. Et je vous remercie par avance pour votre participation généreuse et solidaire. Surtout ne soyez pas gêné de ne pas pouvoir donner, ou de ne pouvoir faire qu'une maigre contribution, les temps sont durs pour tout le monde... Je suis preneuse de tout soutien, moral, matériel ou financier, quelle qu'en soit la hauteur... 
Surtout n'hésitez pas à me contacter si vous voulez en savoir plus, et n'hésitez pas non plus à partager au maximum ! MERCI !

Sarah 

PS : Si nous dépassons les 5000€ (ce qui serait absolument merveilleux !!!) cela servira à financer toute ou partie d'une deuxième tentative (car je ne suis pas naïve, il faudra malheureusement peut-être plusieurs tentatives) ou, si par chance cela fonctionnait du premier coup, le matériel pour accueillir ce bébé-miracle...

And one day, when a friend launched a crowdfunding project, I thought "Well, what if I did the same thing to conceive my baby!"... At first, I admit that the idea seemed a little "crazy" to me... And then I thought about it, and I finally reached the conclusion that it would be so beautiful to make this child alone, but with all of you... What an amazing story would be the one of my child... and what a great worth he would bring in him: SOLIDARITY...I am very proud to present my project to you ... I hope wholeheartedly, that you will support me in my approach...I sincerely thank you for reading me and for your interest in my project. And I thank you in advance for your generous and solidary involvement. Do not be embarrassed not being able to give or, just being able to do a small contribution, times are tough for everyone... I am taker of any support, moral, material or financial, regardless of the height...Do not hesitate to contact me if you want to know more, and do not hesitate to share the fullest! THANK YOU!SarahPS: If we exceed € 5,000 (which would be absolutely wonderful!!!) it will finance all or part of a second attempt (because I'm not naive, it will perhaps unfortunately need several attempts), or if luckily it worked the first time, the equipment to accommodate this miracle-baby...

story:
In 2012, I launched an IndieGoGo campaign to make my album “From The Saltland To The River” and quite a few people helped me make the album through the campaign. I’ve had such a positive response to this album from all over the world. I left my record label, manager, and agent in 2009 to pursue my own path in the music industry. I’ve never really fit into a genre, industry, or scene. My touring life is very eclectic. I realized a while ago that I am more interested in people than music; it’s just that I’ve found that music gets me to people in a very unique way.

I have a great new collection of songs that I am really excited about and with your help I hope to release them as a new album. Thanks to you, I raised some money some months ago. I used the money to record and could have put out the album. But I really didn’t feel that the songs were as great as the ideas behind them. So I re-wrote and re-worked them all and wrote some new ones. This was a major step forward artistically but it meant that I needed more funds to keep going. I aim to honor all those who contributed the first time in a special way in the hope that nobody feels slighted. I really thought long and hard about whether to run another campaign and in the end after consulting with friends, felt confident that my motivation is to release life changing music and as a result I made the right call going back and re-working it all. I’ve peered almost every perk here, giving more value for money. I would LOVE to get this record out ASAP. I would very much appreciate your help.

My hope is that the songs on this new album will wrap themselves around your heart, encourage you and lift you up, and that they will be a beautiful soundtrack to your life journey. There are some great perks here that I will be very excited to fulfill. Please come back to this page for regular updates, videos and photos. Also, please visit me on

story:
Hello!

Chances are you’ve caught us on a stage or on a boat as we made our way from Jinja across East Africa and the US over the past year. Or perhaps you’ve heard us on the radio. National Public Radio called our first CD one of the “Top 5 Must-Hear International Albums” of 2013.

Our ship’s journey to Jinja (the album) begins in Jinja (the city) with a musical residency at the end of January 2014 that turned into a 2-month tour of Africa and a 4-month tour of the US. In fact, we’re still on the road as we launch this campaign, stealing a day or two every other week to get into the studio and record some of the music we’ve been cooking up.


Here is the story...

From Africa..
After our Nile Gathering in Jinja, we performed our first show on a boat in the Ugandan city, February 6.

Then we hit the road on a 5-country African Tour, playing at some very special places.

In Egypt, we played in Cairo, Aswan and Alexandria. We also appeared on the popular talk show El Bernameg with this guy.


..To America
In November 2014, we reunited in Minya, Egypt for another Nile Gathering.  Afterwards, we flew to New York to kick off our 4-month US Tour.  Our first show was at globalFEST15. The New York Times reviewed the show and called us a "committed, euphoric international coalition.”

We went on to perform all across the country with stops at the United Nations, the Lincoln Center, and 30 Universities across 20 states.


Recording Begins.
The music was so good, we decided to start recording. Over four months time, we captured 15 live concerts and 5 full days in recording studios in Chicago, Amherst, and College Park. Don' Tell anyone but we even converted a few of our hotel rooms into makeshift studios so we could finish before everyone went back home.



But what does this music have to do with the Nile?

In 2011, the Nile Project was born to inspire, educate and empower Nile citizens to foster the sustainability of their shared ecosystem. But in order to cooperate on the sustainability of our river, we first have to address the sustainability of our relations. And in order to build trust, we first need to understand where each of us is coming from. In the Nile Project, we believe that our musical collaborations inspire the cross-cultural curiosity and empathy necessary for this water conversation to begin on the right note. Only then can we focus our creativity to find mutually beneficial solutions to our respective challenges.

Learn more about our programs
Join our mailing list, like us on facebook, or follow us on twitter.

And, how can you help?

We need to raise $55,000 to fund the recording, mixing, and mastering of Jinja this summer. No record deals. Only your financial support can make this possible. To show our gratitude, we’ve got some very special perks waiting for you when you contribute. And tell all your friends!

Thanks and looking forward to meeting you!

Your river neighbors,
THE NILE PROJECT

Photos by Akiko Terai, Mina Girgis, Peter Stanley, Mario Di Bari, Cindy Quezada, Kevin Yatarola, and the New York Times.

story:
Short Summary

Hi - I'm Wendy Songe.  Independent musician from Oklahoma.  I've got a busy summer tour season about to kick off in just a few short weeks.  But on March 25, 2015, severe tornadic storms rolled through Oklahoma and caused extensive damage to my only touring transportation.  I need your help to get rolling again!

  • My goal is to raise $5500 in just 30 days.
  • I can't pay that money back - but I AM PAYING IT FORWARD!
  • YOU CAN HELP!

What We Need & What You Get

The world is full of people in need, and we can all do our part!  I'd like to be a part of the solution, by sending my fundraising campaign full circle - helping others.

  • $5500 is the amount needed to purchase a replacement touring vehicle.
  • As a pay-it-forward initiative, I have partnered with a non-profit agency benefiting disabled adults, to provide 55 hours of hands on service - bringing music into the lives of people in need of specialized care.
  • Every contributor to my campaign will receive special perks and incentives!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate financially, you can still help spread the word!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and help DRIVE JOY HOME!

story:
Some info on me

My name is Blair Lucas and I'm a 25 year old Cape Breton musician. I've been involved in music since I was 14, with changing instruments over the years, starting with drums, then piano and finally guitar. I've been writing my own songs for maybe 5 years now.

I'm hugely influenced by artists and bands from the 60's and 70's, with the biggest influence being The Beatles. I'm not just influenced by the melody, songcraft or spirit of that time, but also the production and organic sound of many of the records of that time. I keep getting tagged as "folk rock" but honestly, my music ranges from pop, rock and roll, folk, blues, bluegrass, progressive rock, etc. Honestly it's hard to pin point a specific genre that my music falls into and I see it more as just "organic pop". 

The Project & Funding Needs

This is going to be a 6 song EP. These 6 songs come from range of different genres, tempos, moods and years. Some of these songs are new, older and even from years ago. Basically, these 6 songs are the culmination of 5 years of songwriting.

I'm asking for $1500 for the recording, mixing and mastering of the EP. The studio I'm planning on recording at is an extremely affordable location so I believe $1500 is a reasonable price for what I'm looking for.

Some of the rewards I'm offering include a limited quantity of lyric illustrations done by Carla Jessome and for a big donation, a personal live show at your place. A Cape Breton kitchen party! 

You Beautiful People Can Help

If you guys share this on Facebook, Twitter, Google +,etc it would be amazing. Hell, share this on Myspace, MSN Messenger, ICQ or AOL. Anything helps.
I've also been told to mention Indiegogo's sharing device thing or whatever as well. So....use that too!

story:
Since the success of my last record, self titled "Dana Robbins" , I've been working hard writing like crazy and co-writing new songs that I feel really good about.  So many of you told me that you wanted to hear me sing more on my last record, so that's exactly what I'm going to do on this NEW record. 

I can't do it without your help, so thank you in advance. Please check out the rewards I'm offering to you ranging from MP3's, a copy of the new CD, my first Vinyl record, T shirts, a Meet & Greet and much more.

I wanted to share with you some REVIEWS from my LAST record:

****************************************************************************

BLUES MATTERS ISSUE 81  (END NOV '14)-DANA ROBBINS - DANA ROBBINS

This, I find, is a stunning second solo album from the excellent saxophonist Dana Robbins and it features vocals from Delbert McClinton and Jimmy Hall. Long overdue a review. Dana hails from Detroit but now calls Nashville home after seven years in LA. She has played with John Mayall, Frank Zappa, James Brown and Steve Cropper amongst so many others and is a very highly rated and in demand player.

(see full review on my website)

____________________________________________________________________________

AQUARIAN WEEKLY RANT N' ROLL     http://www.theaquarian.com/2014/08/20/rant-n-roll-dana-sean-orrin-the-rev/

On her self-titled self-released second solo CD, the six instrumentals rock with a funky edge. Vocals on the other five tracks are by McClinton, Jimmy Hall (remember Southern rock’s Wet Willie?) and, making her vocal debut, Robbins herself. 


_____________________________________________________________________________

DOWNBEAT MAGAZINE review in Oct. 2014!!!!

                     *** 1/2 STARS!!!!!!!

file:///Users/danarobbins/Documents/Downbeat%20Review%20Oct%202014.webarchive

"The name Dana Robbins may not be familiar to you, but its almost certain you've heard her burnished work on saxophone, flute and piccolo on other artists' albums."

_____________________________________________________________________________

 I'm looking forward to this new project!!        

Please visit my website for videos, interviews and tour schedule                www.danarobbins.com

THANK YOU!!

story:
www.thenashvilleconnection.com

Please help and assist us to Honor, Salute, and Support our military and their families AND give a huge leg up in the music industry for deserving singers and songwriters throughout the nation!

The Nashville Connection – Heroes Salute, 21-25 July 2015, is an annual, grass roots, extreme educational, music industry experience for aspiring singers and songwriters throughout the nation to connect, learn, and network with the very best in the music industry – those who make the stars. We assist aspiring singers and songwriters to experience first-hand, up close and personal, “Experiential Sessions” and the many facets of the music industry, from to A to Z.

Our unique Songster Bus™ opportunity for serious singer/songwriters is to travel in a tour bus for 7 hours with award winning celebrity songwriter mentors and to write the next hit song together while traveling to Nashville with cameras rolling. This is a unique musical journey of a lifetime for singer/songwriters.

We also award music industry scholarships, mentoring, and development programs for the younger artists.

We culminate our music experience week with a Heroes Salute Concert, Live Auction, and Red Carpet Event in Nashville to honor and salute our military and to raise money for selected military causes such as Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) treatment for our veterans and support to our Gold Star Moms and Wives (mothers and spouses of U.S. service members who have died during war). We also contribute with service projects for the military and their families, as an added benefit.

                                  

This year we a thrilled to have Josh Gracin, a Michigan native who grew up listening to country and R&B music. Josh Gracin catapulted to fame after auditioning for the second season of the hit television series American Idol. Josh, who was serving in the United States Marine Corps at the time, quickly became a fan favorite and won the hearts of viewers with his strong fourth place finish on Idol.  Josh’s powerful and golden voice is a force to be reckoned with.  Whether performing live or in the recording studio – his vocal ability is a constant reminder of what a true singer/performer is, especially in our current era of technology.  His voice stands the test of time in an ever changing industry.

          The Nashville Connection Heroes Salute LIVE Audition Shine Night!

                                                  Every genre of music!

                 Country, Rock/Pop, Folk/Bluegrass, R&B/Urban Crossover

                 Singers and songwriters – take your music to the next level!

                                          Join us in Nashville, July 2015!

                                       www.thenashvilleconnection.com

Your funds will go toward the production of our event which directly benefits all of our causes. Music, Arts, Entertainment, and Patriotism – The Best Mix in America!

Videos which represent the heart and soul of what we stand for:

·  FOX and Friends June 2012 broadcast with Darryl Worley about The Nashville Connection – Heroes Salute:

Fox & Friends - June 2012

·  FUTURE’s “Hugs for Healing” flight to Iraq 2010:

Hugs for Healing

·  “A Heroes Salute” video: 

A Heroes Salute

story:
GREETINGS & THANK YOU!

My name is John Hanifin, cellist & lead singer for John Hanifin Band. I speak for all members of JHB in saying that we are very excited at the opportunity to begin recording & we can't wait to hit the studios! As part of the Celebrity Series of Boston "Arts & Education" outreach program, we recently had the amazing opportunity to work with the Mattapan Teen Center, Boys & Girls Club of Boston. We are thrilled to announce that 10% of ALL record sales will be donated to them! In addition, a donation of electric basses from my sponsors at NS Design will be provided to the center! We need your help to continue to grow as a band and in doing this you will help us continue to help others. Our goal is $20,000.00 which I know seems like a hefty sum, but it will allow us to record, promote and make an impact in our Boston community & hopefully reach our national and international fans.


What We Need & What You Get


$12,000.00 will allow us to not only record but engineer, master, package & distribute our album. Our management company 3P Music Productions & Management (which is located in New York City) has been extremely helpful in setting us up with high-end professional studios at a fraction of the cost. Kiyanu Kim, the CEO and Producer, has done hundreds of projects including being the music director and lead guitarist for Gwen Stefani’s tour. He’s an amazing musician in his own right and he knows the industry inside and out. $8,000.00 will be used for promotion. I am so thankful to to my amazing sponsors at NS Design, Coda Bow, Rutmans Violins, management at 3P Music Management & Productions in NYC, and Celebrity Series of Boston who have all been very helpful in getting the word out about JHB but we can’t stop there! In addition, luckily I have been able to utilize social media platforms such as Secret Boston, free social platforms like Twitter, Instagram and Facebook to get the ball rolling. This gorilla marketing has led to some really great relationships with magazines, newspapers, blogs and other commercial ventures that will help us get the word out but unfortunately, their services aren’t free. Making the album is one thing but having your generous contributions would help us continue in the process and let the world know about JHB!


The Impact


Described as "Redefining Classic" by Strings Magazine in their fall issue, it is my hope that this record will stand out from others. As a cellist, I have the opportunity to not only perform on tour with JHB, but also bring classical recitals to surrounding schools, universities and local programs to promote the importance of music & art in education. Art education is especially important to me. I would like to focus my involvement to underfunded public school systems where there are limited resources for the arts. The success of this record will ensure that I can continue to make a difference. Ultimately through JHB’s alliance with the Boston Public Schools and Mattapan Teen Center, we hope to make a profound difference in the lives of our youth.


Risks & Challenges


Making a record is no easy task, but the team I have put together is one that will ensure its completion. With the amazing guys I have in my band (Brandon Allen, Trevor Pitts, Mauricio Andrade, Louis Ochoa & Jeremy Turgeon), incredible images and video from our director Olise Forel, and production by Kiyanu, everyone is dedicated to putting in the time and effort to make this happen. Our deadline to have our album done is Mid-May as we will be debuting it live at the Montauk Music Festival for 5,000 people! As a donor, you will be the first to receive your copy! 


Other Ways You Can Help


If you cannot contribute financially, thats fine! Times are hard and the support you've shown us by reading this far means the world! Please, share our campaign with friends, family, any millionaire entrepreneurs you might know or people that have recently won the lottery!

I speak for all members of JHB in saying that we are very excited at the opportunity to begin recording & we can't wait to hit the studios! As part of the Celebrity Series of Boston "Arts & Education" outreach program, we recently had the amazing opportunity to work with the Mattapan Teen Center, Boys & Girls Club of Boston. We are thrilled to announce that 10% of ALL record sales will be donated to them! In addition, a donation of electric basses from my sponsors at NS Design will be provided to the center! We need your help to continue to grow as a band and in doing this you will help us continue to help others. Our goal is $20,000.00 which I know seems like a hefty sum, but it will allow us to record, promote and make an impact in our Boston community & hopefully reach our national and international fans.

What We Need & What You Get

$12,000.00 will allow us to not only record but engineer, master, package & distribute our album. Our management company 3P Music Productions & Management (which is located in New York City) has been extremely helpful in setting us up with high-end professional studios at a fraction of the cost. Kiyanu Kim, the CEO and Producer, has done hundreds of projects including being the music director and lead guitarist for Gwen Stefani’s tour. He’s an amazing musician in his own right and he knows the industry inside and out. $8,000.00 will be used for promotion. I am so thankful to to my amazing sponsors at NS Design, Coda Bow, Rutmans Violins, management at 3P Music Management & Productions in NYC, and Celebrity Series of Boston who have all been very helpful in getting the word out about JHB but we can’t stop there! In addition, luckily I have been able to utilize social media platforms such as Secret Boston, free social platforms like Twitter, Instagram and Facebook to get the ball rolling. This gorilla marketing has led to some really great relationships with magazines, newspapers, blogs and other commercial ventures that will help us get the word out but unfortunately, their services aren’t free. Making the album is one thing but having your generous contributions would help us continue in the process and let the world know about JHB!

The Impact

Described as "Redefining Classic" by Strings Magazine in their fall issue, it is my hope that this record will stand out from others. As a cellist, I have the opportunity to not only perform on tour with JHB, but also bring classical recitals to surrounding schools, universities and local programs to promote the importance of music & art in education. Art education is especially important to me. I would like to focus my involvement to underfunded public school systems where there are limited resources for the arts. The success of this record will ensure that I can continue to make a difference. Ultimately through JHB’s alliance with the Boston Public Schools and Mattapan Teen Center, we hope to make a profound difference in the lives of our youth.

Risks & Challenges

Making a record is no easy task, but the team I have put together is one that will ensure its completion. With the amazing guys I have in my band (Brandon Allen, Trevor Pitts, Mauricio Andrade, Louis Ochoa & Jeremy Turgeon), incredible images and video from our director Olise Forel, and production by Kiyanu, everyone is dedicated to putting in the time and effort to make this happen. Our deadline to have our album done is Mid-May as we will be debuting it live at the Montauk Music Festival for 5,000 people! As a donor, you will be the first to receive your copy! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, thats fine! Times are hard and the support you've shown us by reading this far means the world! Please, share our campaign with friends, family, any millionaire entrepreneurs you might know or people that have recently won the lottery!

story:
Lance Carpenter EP presale and other cool stuff...

Hey y'all, thanks for checking out my indiegogo campaign.  I am so excited for you to hear some new music... you've been asking for it...and it's almost here!!!  

Before I start talking about my project I want you to know that this is not me asking you to fund my project.  This is just your chance to pre-order my EP and have the opportunity to score some other cool stuff like merch packages, special collectors items, and one on one experience's that I wouldn't be able to offer without this campaign.  

Each of YOU are so important to me!!!   Without you I would not have a career with my music so I want you to be as involved with my music and this process as I can.  

My goal says $5,000...but I want to be 100% transparent and break down my estimated expenses to you for this project so you know this money won't be going into my pocket...

  • Tracking - $5,400
  • Vocal recording - $600
  • Mixing - $1,000
  • Mastering - $400
  • graphics/photography - $400
  • Duplication - $1,500
  • i'm sure i'm forgetting something but I just wanted to let you in on the $ side of things....
So that's a little under $10,000 to get this EP recorded and in your hands!!!  So this is my way of involving you so let's make that process FUN!!!

The Songs...

I can tell you I am recording 6 songs...5 that I co-wrote with some amazing folks, and 1 song that I did not write...i repeat... DID NOT WRITE.  I discovered this song a few years ago and didn't think i'd be able to record it but I am beyond blessed that we made that happen.  As we get closer to the release date I will reveal the track listing, cover art, and other details.  I can tell you that I recored the music for the project at Jay Demarcus's house (Rascal Flatts). Jay is such a nice and I am blessed he allowed me to bring this project to life in his studio.  

Looking back..and looking forward...

A few years ago, I recorded my first project and used a platform like this to raise the money for the project.  I can't thank y'all enough for making that happen!!!  It was a dream come true to release my first album and I can't wait for you to hear this new project and see what the impact is going to be.  

The Impact...

Just to let you know...i've had fans come up to me after shows and tell me how much they love my music but more than that...how a specific song has brightened their day, has helped them get over a break, has comforted them through a divorce an in at least one case helped a couple work through their differences and make their marriage work and they say they've never been happier.   Songs from my first album have been played at weddings and have even been the first dance for a few couples, it's made people laugh and reconnect with old friends.  The impact my music has made on these folks WOULD NOT HAVE HAPPENED WITHOUT YOU... Yeah i recorded and sang the songs but you have just as much ownership in this positive impact as I do.  It makes me wonder what kind of impact this new project can have!!!

Short on funds...Other Ways You Can Help...

I understand that not everyone has extra money laying around to spend on things like this but if you want to help here are a few things you can do that would be equally appreciated:

  • SPREAD THE WORD....Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign with indiegogo share tools and social media
  • FIND ME...on social media, Facebook, twitter, instagram, youtube...and share those pages with your friends and family so they can discover my music.  
  • EMAIL....for those of you who still use it, send a personal email to your close friends and family with links to this campaign and my social media links and website.

And that's all there is to it ...Love y'all

Developed with a Southern accent!!!
