story:
Short Summary

My name is John Carmichael, and I am the conductor of the Florida Wind Band (a 501c3 not for profit corporation). When we began this project 7 years ago, it was our mission to develop a professional-level concert band in which players would be paid per service in a manner similar to professional orchestras.  Currently, there is not one civilian, full-time, professional wind band in America. We estimate that there are between 30 to 40 million people in our country who have taken band sometime during their lives. Even if only a fraction of those numbers would still be interested, there would be a strong market for professional bands. For us, the cost of putting on a concert usually requires all of the proceeds coming from ticket sales, leaving us nothing to use for marketing, music purchasing and staffing. Without successful marketing, we will not be able to get ahead of our expenses enough to develop an  image or brand that would help to secure more patronage, sponsorships and to sell more tickets.

This crowdfunding proposal is intended to find supporters of bands and music who would be willing to contribute to the marketing and operational needs of the Florida Wind Band. Of the fundraising goal, 50% will be used to develop and execute a marketing strategy (including a marketing director) that would gain more positive exposure for the FWB. 10% would be used to purchase music for future concerts, and the other 40% would be used to fund a staff member responsible for the development (fundraising) efforts of the band.  If we are unable to reach our goal, the funds would be applied first to marketing (up to $10,000), then to the hiring of development staff  (up to $8,000) and finally to purchasing music ($2,000).

Our band enriches the lives of those who attend the concerts. We have been received so positively that every performance has earned a standing ovation. The existence of a highly successful professional band is only going to enhance the position of bands in secondary schools. The FWB would serve as a model of quality for area bands, would provide in-school clinical services, and would create additional income for professional musicians in the Tampa Bay area who are constantly looking for opportunities to perform. Perhaps the biggest perk for the musicians is that the professional band would be able to perform wind band masterpieces at the highest level for people who love the wind band medium.

Each dollar contributed will move the Florida Wind Band closer to the time when we would be able to generate sufficient funding from ticket sales, patronage and from the sponsorship of businesses in the Tampa Bay region. Without your support, we will continue to be locked in a cycle of performing a concert, paying the expenses of that concert, and then planning for the next concert with $0 with which to work.

This is an outstanding opportunity for those folks who support the existence and educational effectiveness of bands to fund a next logical step in the evolution of the band movement. 

Our most immediate concert is on June 29, 2015 entitled "Land of the Free, Home of the Brave." It will occur in the Concert Hall at the University of South Florida School of Music at 7:30 pm. Tickets are available through Ticketmaster.

Please look at our website:  floridawindband.org

story:
Once known as the humble, Matiwane Mathews II. 

Matiwane meaning The Leader or Lion Killer in an African language as told by his Mother and Grandfather.

Matiwane was raised in the town of Killeen/Fort Hood, TX. The eldest of four of a single parent home, he began to grow into a young man at an early age. 

The passion of art and entertainment started at the young age of 5. Performing in church (C.O.G.I.C.) , talent shows and school plays, and always enjoyed the attention of family during gatherings. Growing up in Killeen with lots of support from friends and family encouraged him to pursue his dreams of someday being the great entertainer he hoped to be.

During his later years in Shoemaker HS, studies were always a priority. Constantly  standing out from his peers, revolutionary ideas developed. With help of some friends, he established the dance crew known as THE BANDITZ before graduating. 

When he found the time though, he would find himself in the Viva Les Arts Theatre. Being molded on a stage by many professionals that watered a dream that was only a seed. The experiences in church helped him to understand that their is a higher calling for him. Many prophecies were spoken upon him  and his family, which allowed him to have the faith to do what he was chosen to do. Not what society said he should or expected him to do. 


Sounds like a lot of pressure right......you tell me another way precious stones are naturally made. 

 

At the earth age of 18, he quickly found himself travelling to a land unfamiliar. The city of dreams, New York, NY.

Despite not having anyone there he knew, his luggage, $300 in his pocket, and ambition as his bling, he found himself being connected with good people that would guide him. He received an acceptance letter to the NY Conservatory of Dramatic Arts. He would soon meet friends that would last a lifetime. Still acting, his creative free time began to go toward writing music. Like always, he would put on small shows for his peers for attention and approval. Still young in the mind, he didn't really have any substance in his lyrics yet. 

The struggle of job hunting and trying to survive led him to began to feel subservient. Dependent, and unaccomplished. On the verge of depression, he felt lost. He began to disbelieve, lose faith and be very cold on the inside. The darkness was covering him in a way that he never sensed before. Searching for answers, his skill of research forced him to empty his cup, and learn about his world and himself like a child again. 


During this path, he met people of many cultures, different dialects and points o view of life. In turn he listened more than spoke. Gave more than received and feel more than analyze. The life of fame and riches faded as an admiration. The journey of a Contemporary Sacred Hip Hop artist began to flourish. 

The Oracle of NYC gave him the next steps and tools to be the Emperor he once was. The age of his slavery was now over. Freedom was an illusion, until
he freed his soul. His true self..... The Blu Mantic.


The knowledge of the ancient philosophers, yogis, revolutionaries, shamanism esoteric, astrologist, and the indigenous ways of being all resonant with what my message has become. The balance of duality is my thing. I take the thought of my masculine energy and flow it with my creative feminine energy. Yin and Yang. NY and TX. Beginning and End. Life and Death. Past and the Future...

So above, So below.

To coexist is the key. Music will be the way I speak to this planet. My life on the other hand will give example to the youth that have no one to believe in, such as i did when I was younger. My mind altering heart-felt expressions will bring a different awareness to the inhabitants of Earth/Terra. 



I am now traveling with the inspiration of living out my vision.  No longer in the developing stages, only continuing to grow as soul man. I now know who I am. 

I feel now is the time to come out and show what I have been working on.

My freshman album titled No Shades Of Grey is looking to debut spring of 2016. 

So what I am asking you, the family, the friend, the supporter is to help me get those funds together in order to complete my efforts. 

$6,000 USD is the total

MUSIC FUNDING

275 Trademark

115 Soundcloud.com PRO 

200 Reverbnation.com PRO

200 Mix n Mastering

500 Marketing Campaign

700 Photo/Video Equip

TRAVEL FUNDING 

Travel fees include transportation tickets, lodge, and meal budget. 

Cities for shows, studio time, and networking include, but not limited to, 

London

Stockholm

Africa

Frankfurt

New York

2753 TOTAL Travel cost

MERCHANDISE
300 Posters

___________________________________

4943 TOTAL

1057 Taxes and Indie GoGo's %

___________________________________

6000 GOAL

____________________

I broke it down so that you understand where your donations are going. The veil is removed.I hope you shall embark on this journey with me. I am grateful for anyone who gives me there time to read, watch, and listen to anything I have to say or do. 
Much love to you and may your blessings over flow. Together we can make our world a better place.
Thank you,

The Blu Mantic

story:
We are looking for the Voice of Peace 2015!

We have launched a song contest in 5 unstable African countries, to select a voice among the most talented artists singing about peace and reconciliation.

We will then produce their album and ensure that their peace message reaches over 20 million people in violence-prone regions of Africa.

We are a non-profit association of a dozen journalists, musicians and humanitarian workers, united to promote peace by using the power of music. Kimia means "peace" in lingala, and Cantus is "song" in latin. We have worked or lived in some of those countries, and are deeply convinced that Music can make Peace.


Make this dream possible by supporting our project!

Our project will cost 60'000 Euros in total to be completed, with most of the funds to go to the production of the winner's album. We have already raised 20'000 Euros, which has allowed us to launch the song contest. Once the winner is selected, we will produce his or her album and ensure its promotion. 

11'000 Euros will cover the next phase of the project: the recording of the album, which should take place in December. It will allow us to pay the musicians' fees and studio recording on the spot. We hope to finance the rest of the project through institutional support.


Spreading peace to over 20 million people 

Thanks to our partnership with the Fondation Hirondelle, we can convey a powerful message of peace and reconciliation through over 200 radios and reach 20-30 million people.

The Fondation Hirondelle is a Swiss non-governmental organisation that operates in Mali, Democratic Republic of Congo, Guinea, Central African Republic and Ivory Coast in support of a network of over 200 radios. Since 1995, it creates or supports information media in fragile countries, war zones, endemic crisis or post-conflict situations. The Fondation Hirondelle is not directly active in music production and promotion, but all its radio stations broadcast music. Hence complementarity with this contest which should mark the 20th anniversary of the Fondation Hirondelle.


Our challenge 

We have tight deadlines if we want to produce the album of the winner before the end of 2015, on the 20th anniversary of the Fondation Hirondelle. 

We know that this timing is feasible - but we cannot loose time and need to move forward with the recording of the album as quickly as possible.


Let's Make it Happen! 

No matter what you donate,  you're helping us reach our goal.  In addition to donating, there are other ways to help, such as:

  • spreading the word about #thevoiceofpeace #lavoixdelapaix around you
  • "liking" our facebook page www.facebook.com/KimiaCantus
  • sharing this page on your social media account inviting your friends to support our project

story:
Anna Grahm

Anna Grahm is HATE DRUGS' second EP that will be released on July 7th, 2015. The album is a story of love found and love lost. From the opening track "Hellow", to the closing track "Oh Well", the anagram tells a bittersweet tale that we can all relate to. We're excited to take you on this musical journey with us. 


Why This Campaign?

Although the creation of music is free (which we are happy about), the capture and distribution are unfortunately not. Sharing our art with you is one of favorite parts of creating it, so here is a budget of the things that we hope to fund through this campaign:

  • Production - $400  This EP was self recorded and self produced, which saved us a lot of money and taught us a lot of valuable lessons, but there were still some costs that come along along with making our product the best that we can make it. This covers some of the mastering fees.
  • Digital Distribution - $100 We will be releasing the album on iTunes, Spotify, and through other digital distributors. This covers the cost of making our music available online through a myriad widely used platforms.
  • Hard Copy Distribution - $300 There's nothing like having a hard copy CD or cassette tape from one of your favorite bands in your hands. We want to make sure that our fans have that. This covers the cost of the duplication of our CD's and Tapes.
  • Advertisement and Promotion - $100 We are so excited about this album that we want everyone to know about it. Although the internet provides many means of free advertisement, there are ways to boost that in order to make the most of the release. This covers the costs of online promotion.
  • Merchandise - $100 Along with the new album we would love to provide new stickers and buttons and various other goodies. This cost would cover new merch, specific to this release.


Thank You

Without your continued love and support we would not be able to do what we have done already and what we hope to continue doing. We've been able to accomplish so much in so little time, thanks to you. You are the heartbeat of this project. You keep us alive and motivated to share our gifts with you. Thank you so much for your contribution! Whether it be $1 or $100, it means the world to us.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with your friends and family! Let's get the word out and together we can create something special. 

Learn more about HATE DRUGS and get to know us through our social media. Listen, Love, Share www.hatedrugsmusic.com

story:
Video music by soundtrack artist Wes Speight.

Thanks to all of my amazing soundtrack artists, who are listed in detail below!

Note: we'll be ADDING MORE GREAT REWARDS AS THE CAMPAIGN GOES ON!

(Yeah, we're saving some of the goodies for later...)


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

I want to be clear that this Indiegogo is strictly for producing the soundtrack, not the actual novel.  But folks have been asking for more info on the story. You can find that at edgethenovel.blogspot.com.

You can also check out the trailer... because any novel with a soundtrack really should have a trailer.... ;)



Last week's

SOUNDTRACK TEASER: the great psych-folk sound of Tiny Messengers featuring the just-wow voice of Kimo Muraki! Kimo's many music credits include singing backing vocals on the debut album "Dream Your Life Away" from Vance Joy (Riptide, Mess Is Mine) on Atlantic Records, and he composed, arranged, and performed the horns for that entire album, including the sax, trumpet, coronet, baritone, mellophone, trombone, and flute!



Previous soundtrack teaser:

**The video is NOT related to the novel or soundtrack!! It's just the only direct link available to the song!



Previous soundtrack teaser:



Hi there!

I'd like to invite you to help make history by supporting the start of what will hopefully become a new paradigm: soundtracks for novels!

This one is for my upcoming young adult sci-fi / fantasy novel, Edge - a dark-ish love story involving liminal beings who walk the edges between dimensions, and that also takes a rather unusual perspective on climate change.

This soundtrack is not music in an eBook.

It's not meant to be listened to while you're reading the book.

It's a closely connected but separate music project.

It's basically like the soundtrack (NOT score) for a film.


It's an album of amazing music that aligns with and enhances the atmosphere of the book, but also stands just fine on its own.


It's said that stories are how we understand our world, and that right now we're in need of some new stories.

Edge is a story of a radically transforming world - including a more compassionate post-meat world - and is my gift to that world. This soundtrack is a crucial part of that gift.

It will help reach people's hearts - where change begins.

Learn more at http://edgethenovel.blogspot.com/

Sharing great music has always been a passion of mine. I can’t tell you how excited I am to introduce you to my soundtrack artists (below) and share their phenomenal music with all of you. I'm honored and humbled that they want to be a part of it.

I'm just the vehicle for this project, which has taken on a life of its own.

But I'm honored to be the facilitator and coordinator.

Let’s make a soundtrack together!

-CJK


WHY SOUNDTRACK A NOVEL?

The idea is that the music will help you feel for the story and the story will help you feel the music.

The two will cross-promote one another.

It's a rough market these days for indie writers and musicians - which is exactly why soundtracking novels could become an important new paradigm.

  • The music helps with writing (I've actually written some scenes for songs!)
  • The music helps to emotionally bond readers with the story, and vice versa
  • The soundtrack expands the venue options for concerts, book tours, and especially combination performances, and provides an unusual “hook” to help music artists get shows - and authors get talks.
  • It expands promo reach – reaching the audience of every project artist instead of just one person.
  • This crowdfunding campaign provides additional publicity for all
  • The project connects artists and creates a community of mutual support
  • It's FUN!

For the author, for the music artists, and for you our audience – it's a WIN – WIN – WIN!


THE TEAM

My soundtrack artists will have a basic contract and will retain the rights to their songs.

Each soundtrack artist will receive some CDs to give away or sell, as they wish.

They will have the option of purchasing future CDs at cost, to sell and keep the money.

If the soundtrack and novel do well, I hope to set up some future combination music / book tours with soundtrack artists who are interested.


THE $ GOAL $

This might look like a lot of money, but a lot of it goes away before it even gets to us, via Indiegogo commissions and taxes.

If we hit the goal we get a LOT better deal on Indiegogo commission (paying only 4% as opposed to 9%).  This means much more of your pledge goes to supporting the project instead of paying fees.

So here's hoping you can help us hit the goal!

I don't believe in asking music artists to work for free and hopefully you don't either. These artists have poured their hearts and souls and piggy banks into their music. Many have written or adjusted songs especially for this soundtrack. This Indiegogo is in part to compensate them a little for their time and talent. Since there are 17 of them, it adds up.

But, 17 artists translates to nearly 75 minutes of wonderfully diverse yet unified music for your ears and soul and imagination. That's a lot of bang for the buck!

The money is also needed to cover the costs of mastering and manufacturing the CD, rewards, and shipping. I also hope to make at least one music video for a soundtrack song, since this would be invaluable for promoting the soundtrack and the artists on it.

If you would like to see the actual nitty gritty project budget, just drop me an email at edgethenovel@gmail.com and I'll be happy to provide it.


FAQs

If we don't hit the goal will we still make the soundtrack?

Yes – even if only as a digital.

But then I might have to ask the artists to work for free :(

And it could get kinda demoralizing, depending. Let's not go there!

If we only raise enough money to release the soundtrack in digital form, will folks who pledged for a real CD still get it?

Yes. The cost of making those, and all the rewards, is built into the pledges even if worst came to worst. And, actually, they would be even more valuable at that point because there would be far fewer of them!

If we exceed the goal, what will we do with the extra money?

The plan is to use that money to make music videos for more of the songs, which will boost promotion of the project, provide additional exposure for artists, and give you the audience some extra sweetness. Additionally, I'll be using those videos to help deliver some of the critical messages of the novel (climate change, environment, homelessness, etc.) at a deep emotional level... using them as a vehicle for positive transformation in the world.


THE REWARDS!

We've put together some kickass rewards, some of them one of a kind that will only and ever be available HERE and NOW.

AND WE'LL BE ADDING MORE AS THE CAMPAIGN CONTINUES.

Just think: these soundtrack artists are achieving new levels even as you read. Some may break out before this soundtrack even releases. These rewards could end up being hot items in the near future!

The soundtrack CD itself is going to be a special, super sweet Indiegogo version. We'll be doing a limited run with exclusive artwork. Any future manufacturing runs will have different artwork. (More on this coming in the days ahead!)

If you want to collect more than one reward (and of course you do), that's great too!

And if you wish to support this project in other ways beyond or aside from this Indiegogo, we're open to considering that - drop us an email.

If you have any questions on rewards, feel free to email us at edgethenovel@gmail.com.

NEWLY ADDED: contribute just ONE DOLLAR to our project and we'll immediately email you a sheet (in both PDF and JPEG format) of 8 bookmarks, with the classy Edge photo and 8 different Edgy quotes and taglines. Yes you must print and cut them yourself, but that means you can print as many as you want! Pass them out to all your friends!

Contribute just $5 and get the above bookmarks PLUS a sheet of Edge SONGQUOTES bookmarks! Poetic words from the soundtrack. You could even punch a hole in the top and add one of those classy little tassled cords...



CREDIBILITY

For those of you who don't know me, here are a brief bio and credentials – not all music related to be sure, but a statement of my reliability and ability to see projects through:

CJ Kinton is a writer, music agent, educator and biologist, with dozens of published articles and hundreds of public speaking and workshop presentations to her credit. She has a BA in Human Ecology.

  • Booking and management for select Seattle indie music artists.
  • 7 years as advertising sales coordinator / fundraiser / general assistance for the Pentangle Arts Council in Woodstock, VT, showcasing artists such as Shawn Colvin, Dar Williams, Tom Rush, Great Big Sea, Bruce Coburn, David Mallett, Gaelic Storm, Jon Andersen of Yes, and more.
  • 1.5 years as Producer and Production Manager for a large community theater group (Revels North), including a large summer solstice festival and an annual Christmas theater production at The Hopkins Center at Dartmouth College.
  • 10 years as editor and production manager for a critically acclaimed community newsletter for a Vermont co-op.
  • Varied work with many scientific and environmental non-profits including Allied Whale in Maine (public relations, admin, humpback whale fluke catalog), New England Marine Mammal Stranding Network (establishment and coordination of a harbor seal pup rescue / rehab clinic and drafting a rehab manual, in affiliation with the Boston Aquarium and the University of Guelph, Canada), Marineland of the Pacific Wildlife Rehab Clinic (including drafting a rehab manual for oiled seabirds), the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History in Washington DC (detailed cetacean skeletal collection inventory team, educational materials), the University of Minnesota's Monarch Larvae Monitoring Project (Advisory Board), and the Vermont Institute of Natural Science (Outreach Education Coordinator, freelance exhibit design consultant).


THANK YOU SO MUCH!

Big thanks for taking the time to read, and for your consideration for supporting this project.

AND NOW...

MEET THE ARTISTS!

This is an assembly of truly impressive talent!

  • Two of these artists were recently signed;
  • one got a Juno (Canadian equivalent of Grammy) nomination;
  • one was named “Best Songwriter” in the 2014 Seattle Sound Music Awards and “Best Singer/Songwriter” in the 2014 Toronto Independent Music Awards;
  • one did arrangements / plays on Vance Joy's recent debut album;
  • and one has been recording some of his songs with the guys of R.E.M. - so yes, one song on my humble soundtrack includes backup guitar by Peter Buck.

Not to mention the credits of our mastering engineer (see below).

The artists who don't yet have this sort of credentials are equally amazing and I have no doubt the world will figure that out very soon. Check out their websites and music links and I bet you'll agree!

I am so pleased to have a small part in showcasing each and every one of these 17 talents. Who knows where they might be before the soundtrack even releases this fall?! Give 'em a Like on Facebook so you can be among the first to find out!


ALBUM MASTERING:

Haywire Recording, Portland, Oregon, U.S.

http://www.haywirerecording.com/

https://www.facebook.com/haywirerecording?fref=ts

The album will be mastered by Robert Bartleson at Haywire Recording in Portland, OR. Haywire is currently one of five nominees for the Willamette Week's Best of Portland “Best Recording Studio in Portland.” Rob has done work for labels such as Sub Pop, Sony, Warner Brothers, Capital, and Kill Rock Stars, and his client list includes artists like Wilco, Pond, Pink Martini, Paul Jenkins of the Black Heart Procession, and David J of Bauhaus. Yep, it's gonna sound great! \m/

***


*****

AVA BONAM

Berlin

https://soundcloud.com/avabonam

http://avabonam.bandcamp.com/music

https://www.facebook.com/avabonamofficial?fref=ts

A Berlin singer, songwriter and multi-instrumentalist who has been involved in various music projects and is currently working solo. She's inspired by nature and is “drawn to the darker issues of life, exploring edges, filling the gap of the unknown.” The dark intricate mystery of her music slinks into the soul. Her underworld siren voice and overall haunting sound will be so welcome on the Edge soundtrack that I'm going to try and squeeze in a second song from her if space allows!


*****

LUCY DALTON

Berlin / London

http://www.looceedee.com/

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Looceedee/243024296900?pnref=lhc

A quite unique Berlin/London based indie-electronic producer/songwriter and multi-instrumentalist, who has played around the UK including Glastonbury Festival, the TT motorbike festival and numerous concerts for Rock Against Racism. She's also played Florida and New York, including a show at the famous Trash Bar and for ZombieCon. Keen to delve into electronic music, she moved to Berlin to soak up the vibes and to work on new material. Using a combination of Ableton Live, guitar and micro Korg, she has successfully blended her passion for electronic music with the raw sound of her roots, creating something unique which many find hard to pinpoint.

In 2014, she recorded and produced her debut solo album in London. She says, "I was inspired by Rainer Maria Rilke's, 'Letters to a young poet' and wanted to write an honest album reflecting the events of that period.” She is currently in Berlin, pursuing her interest in instrumental music and working on movie and video game scoring and a new instrumental album, and was just signed to a label.


*****

THE DIVERTERS

California, U.S.

https://soundcloud.com/dirty-for-doris

https://www.facebook.com/thediverters

A four piece band out of Santa Cruz / Monterey who will contribute their gritty rock sound, electric darkness and a touch of creep to the soundtrack. American and British guitar-driven rock and electronica influences meet with dark, poignant storytelling, haunting vocals, and orchestral-style acoustic/electric arrangements to deliver a powerful, raw, gritty, and beautiful world that can only be experienced by immersing yourself in the music of... The Diverters!

"...bone-chilling high-frequency guitar licks meet crashing cymbals and dark, Danzig-esque vocals." ~Monterey County Weekly


*****

STEVE FISHER

Seattle, U.S.

www.cerebraltone.com

www.soundcloud.com/cerebraltone72

Steve Fisher, of Cerebral Tone, is a singer/songwriter/composer/performer/impressionist/actor who has performed in the northwest for years. His musical style ranges from blues to folk to classic rock, and some songs that are indefinably all his own. He's been playing piano and guitar since his early teens and in later years performed on Public Access and ITV in Seattle. In 2006 he signed a three-year publishing contract that garnered him substantial airplay in Belgium and across the Netherlands, and is currently playing at SeaTac Airport. Steve says, “Music has always been a part of my soul.” Nosing through his catalog, I discovered a song that's pure serendipity for the pinnacle scene of the story.


*****

HELL MARY and PATRICK GALACTIC

Seattle, U.S.

http://www.hellmarymusic.com/

https://www.facebook.com/hellmarymusic

http://www.patrickgalactic.com/

Hell Mary is the alter ego of Seattle Indie Folk artist, Rachel Mary Helen Angerman. “Hell Mary embodies the duality of my nature. It’s a way to symbolize the darkness and light that lives within us all.” When I think of her I think of ravens; I suspect that may be her totem spirit. She's just finished her debut EP “Worship Games” and will be touring the west coast this summer.

On the Edge soundtrack, she will be performing a duet, paired with the smokey baritone of twinflame Patrick Galactic - solo acoustic artist and frontman for the electro-punk trio Death By Stars.  Bathed in reverb and echo, Galactic’s work blends the weary introspection of Leonard Cohen, Nick Cave, and the Velvet Underground with the pop sensibilities of David Bowie, Elliot Smith and Harry Nilsson.

"Hell Mary's first single "Damned" is an equally appropriate soundtrack for when you find yourself writhing with your face in the dirt, or when the devil gives you enough strength to pick yourself up, dust off and embrace your human side again." - Northwest Music Scene


*****

ILANA HERST

New York City, U.S.

http://undergroundminds.com/2015/01/20/featured-ilana-herst/

https://soundcloud.com/lana-herst

Ilana is quite different from, yet reminiscent of, the very early Joni Mitchell - there is a similar element of lyrical magic and sense of promise. Her songwriting embodies both simplicity and depth. She is also frequently compared to Taylor Swift. With a sweetly innocent yet heartrendingly wise and expressive voice, accompanied by her acoustic guitar and piano, she produces a warm, familiar and poignant sound. She began playing guitar when she was eight, and at age 23 has already realized her dream of playing music full time while being completely independent. “Emotions inspire me,” says Ilana. “My lyrics don't describe emotions in a dictionary-like manner, rather they describe an individual, a moment, or a memory that causes the listener to feel that emotion and not just hear about it.” She seems to know my main character better than I do myself, and is contributing two tracks, one a key song written from the innermost being of that character.

“For any fans of poetry, delicately woven into soft, acoustic strings, this adept young lady might have a warm song you could serve with a cup of tea.” ~ undergroundminds.com


*****

KEU II

eMalahleni, South Africa

http://www.emusic.com/album/keu-ii/cry-thebeloved-country/14589521/

https://www.facebook.com/KeuII?fref=ts

Keu Ndebele is a South African musician, composer, singer and songwriter whose musical style embraces songs rooted in African indigenous music and indie rock, using guitar, piano, horns, xylophone and whatever weird or exciting new instruments he can find. His debut album Cry the Beloved Country, with a lead single that reached the top 10 on local radio charts, is available on iTunes. He has been writing and performing since age 14 and has toured in South Africa with his band Keu II. For the last few years he has been producing session work for various local and international music groups, and is currently working on fresh material for his next release and actively recording and playing live radio shows. I'd been wanting a warm yet dark African touch to the soundtrack, but it took me awhile to find an artist with the right sound. Keu has written a brilliant, mostly instrumental song.


*****

ORSINO NATION

Adelaide, Australia / Berlin

https://soundcloud.com/orsinonation

https://orsinonation.bandcamp.com/album/picnic-...

https://www.facebook.com/orsinonation?fref=ts

“LANA DEL REY meets METALLICA!” This progressive art music duo, originally from Adelaide, Australia has been likened to Kate Bush, Pink Floyd, Stevie Nicks, Devin Townsend – and in their more eerie moments, Cradle of Filth. The songs have an atmospheric, theatrical quality, often building to a crescendo of primal vocals, ethereal harmonies, strings & choirs.

“If there’s one thing you can pin them down to, it’s that you can’t pin them down to any one style. Ethereal acoustic pop, speed metal, haunting vocals, beauty and power, often all in the one song and invariably accompanied by intelligent lyrics. They are equally adept at the varying moods and styles, as proven by the consistent quality of the vocals and instrumental performances. 5 stars." - Michael Hunter, MusicSA, South Australia


*****

DAVID REASON

Stuttgart, Germany

https://soundcloud.com/davidreason

David hails from Stuttgart. Born and raised in Germany, he is self-taught on piano, guitar, percussion, flute, and in composition. He grew up with electronic and house music which later led him to working as a DJ. But he soon fell in love with classical / orchestral music, and, inspired by John Williams' scores for Prisoner of Azkaban and Star Wars II, started doing film scoring. His style is theme-oriented, melodic, and classical; his favorite genres to score are fairytales and children's movies. His current project is for a computer animated apocalyptic movie, which will release late this year. Being a perfectionist, he only scores 1-2 films a year.... but he kindly and enthusiastically agreed to write a delicate piano-based love theme for the novel's soundtrack.  :)


*****

SAINT JOHN AND THE REVELATIONS

Seattle, U.S.

http://www.sjatr.com/

https://www.facebook.com/saintjohnandtherevelations?fref=ts

Saint John was born in Canada, busked around Europe, and now makes Seattle his home base, performing almost nightly throughout the Pacific Northwest solo or with his band. He has opened for performers such as Jackson Browne, Colin Hay (Men At Work), Tom Morello (RATM, The Nightwatchman), Wang Chung, Naked Eyes, VAST, and many others. Recently he's started recording some of his songs with Peter Buck (R.E.M.), Bill Rieflin (R.E.M., KMFDM, Ministry, King Crimson), and Scott McCaughey (R.E.M., Fresh Young Fellows, Minus 5), with production by Paul Fox (10,000 Maniacs, Wallflowers, Semisonic, Bjork). He has a real knack for capturing atmosphere through vivid snapshot moments, with an aching sweetness. His songs have found their way around the world and deeply into people’s lives and hearts. The one that will be on the soundtrack certainly found its way into mine, and while some of the lyrics are not closely aligned with the story, it somehow just had to be on there. (It also turned out to have Peter Buck of R.E.M. on backup guitar.) If you think of the story as a movie, this song will be the one that makes you wipe a tear over the closing credits.


*****

SHADES OF STATIC

Seattle, U.S.

http://www.reverbnation.com/shadesofstatic

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Shades-of-Static/471605746192327?fref=ts

This obscure Seattle rock band has just found their destiny in the form of acoustic rock, and I think will soon be obscure no more. I was lucky enough to be at their very first acoustic performance, which goosebumped me to my core. They made me think of several other bands – Live, Kings of Leon, Godsmack – though they don't really sound like any of them; their sound is familiar but all their own. I boldly walked up to frontman Brent Quick after the show and said, “Would you like to be on my novel's soundtrack?” Amazingly, he said “Sure!” They've ended up with two songs on board.


*****

FRANK SORRENTI

Boston, U.S.

Oddlytwistedproductions.com

https://www.facebook.com/oddlytwistedproductions?fref=ts

A Boston area Berklee graduate, Frank is currently working as a singer for a premier band playing venues large and small across the U.S. and Europe. He has also recorded television and radio commercial tracks. He describes his approach to music composition as “mining for gems. I believe musical ideas are around us all the time, waiting to be discovered for anyone willing to make the effort.” One of his instrumental pieces is absolutely perfect for a certain scene in the novel!


*****

WES SPEIGHT

Seattle, U.S.

http://wessp8.blogspot.com/

https://soundcloud.com/wes-sp8

https://www.facebook.com/wessp8

Musical sorcerer Wes Speight is listed as one of the “Seattle bands to watch in 2015” by NadaMucho.com - http://www.nadamucho.com/41-seattle-bands-were-... He has been hailed as “gritty and gutty,” with “sometimes otherworldly voice and music [that] ensnare the soul.” He has played across the nation including Nashville, Manhattan, San Diego, Portland and Seattle, and has released four full length albums (one brand new on July 1, the same day this Indiegogo launched!) and several EPs. His songs have been heard on various stations around the country including Lightning 100, WRVU, NWCZ radio, Seattle Wave Radio and Radio Crystal Blue. He is signed with Washington Street Publishing in Nashville, which represents some of Nashville's top songwriters (including those with #1 Country songs, BMI, ASCAP, CMA, Emmy & Academy Awards). He's a bit of a musical virtuoso, playing harmonica, bass, synthesizer / keyboard, mandolin, and percussion as well as guitar. He'll be accenting the soundtrack with a crucial touch of wild and untamed tribal!


*****

TINY MESSENGERS

Seattle, U.S.

https://soundcloud.com/tinymessengers

https://www.facebook.com/tinymessengers?fref=ts

Tiny Messengers is the debut ensemble from independent Seattle multi-instrumentalist Kimo Muraki who is also a current member of several acclaimed local bands. His musical contributions can be found on the albums of artists such as The Strumbellas, Ewert & The Two Dragons, SoKo, Ed Harcourt, and Vance Joy, and his work has involved recording projects with musicians such as Joe Plummer and Yuuki Matthews of The Shins, and Lumineer producer Ryan Hadlock. He has also played with or shared bills with bands such as The Maldives, Buffalo Tom, Mother Hips, Langhorn Slim, Cotton Jones, Truth and Salvage Co., Thomas Dybdahl, and many more. Just Wow! His own band Tiny Messengers, to be featured on the soundtrack, has a wonderful psych-folk sound. And oh, yeah, his voice will knock your socks off.


*****

TOBIAS THE OWL

Seattle, U.S.

https://soundcloud.com/tobiastheowl

https://www.facebook.com/tobiastheowl?fref=ts

Tobias the Owl is a band based on the songwriting, guitar and vocals of Toronto native Elijah Dhawan, now residing in Seattle. He spent years traveling, sometimes on foot, throughout the southwest and along the west coast. His music reflects the traditions of his Moroccan heritage, from the deeply spiritual of Sufi music to the community folk music of Berber culture: using music to heal and transcend to a higher spiritual awareness. His songs have been covered by artists such as Deer Tick and Jonah Tolchin, and he has worked with drummer/percussionist Scott Seiver and legendary producer Marvin Etzioni. He has been named “Best Songwriter” in the 2014 Seattle Sound Music Awards, and also “Best Singer/Songwriter” in the 2014 Toronto Independent Music Awards. The band was recently signed with London Tone Music. They'll be closing the story just before the “credits” with a dark and deeply haunting song.


*****

PIERRE VENIOT

Hong Kong

https://www.youtube.com/user/VeniotPierre

I first connected with Pierre about two and a half years ago while booking an international music tour. He makes his home in Hong Kong, but started his musical career in Montreal as a jazz performance major. He co-founded a world beats music group that won the Rythmes Du Monde contest in Montreal; the group toured extensively through Europe, and received a Juno nomination – the Canadian equivalent of a Grammy Nomination. He has worked with choirs, singers, theatres, dance companies and instrumentalists, exploring fresh approaches to arranging and expanding his mastery of music software. In Hong Kong, he has founded a jazz network, and is helping to build the next generation of performance artists, regularly taking time out to teach young, local musicians. Now he brings his smokey mysterious jazz trance to the Edge soundtrack, with a touch of Oriental and an almost Arabic overtone that oddly enhances the dark northern atmosphere.



***

From Earth to the Edge - the Shift begins!
story_txt:
Video music by soundtrack artist Wes Speight.

Thanks to all
of my amazing soundtrack artists, who are listed in detail below!
Note: we'll be ADDING MORE GREAT REWARDS AS THE CAMPAIGN GOES ON! 
(Yeah, we're saving some of the goodies for later...)


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ 


I want to be clear that this Indiegogo is strictly for producing the soundtrack, not the actual novel.  But folks have been asking for more info on the story. You can find that at edgethenovel.blogspot.com.
You can also check out the trailer... because any novel with a soundtrack really should have a trailer.... ;)

album "Dream Your Life Away" from Vance Joy (Riptide, Mess Is Mine) on

Hi
there!
I'd
like to invite you to help make history by supporting the start of
what will hopefully become a new paradigm: soundtracks for novels!
This one is for my upcoming young adult sci-fi / fantasy novel, Edge - a dark-ish love story involving liminal beings who walk the edges between dimensions, and that also takes a rather unusual perspective on climate change.




This soundtrack is not music in an eBook.


It's
not meant to be listened to while you're reading the book.


It's
a closely connected but separate music project.


It's
basically like the soundtrack (NOT score) for a film.



It's
an album of amazing music that aligns with and enhances the
atmosphere of the book, but also stands just fine on its own.





It's said that stories are how we understand our world, and that right now we're in need of some new stories.
Edge is a story of a radically transforming world - including a more compassionate post-meat world - and is my gift to that world. This soundtrack is a crucial part of that gift. 

It will help reach people's hearts - where change begins.

Learn
more at http://edgethenovel.blogspot.com/



Sharing
great music has always been a passion of mine. I can’t
tell you how excited I am to introduce you to my soundtrack artists
(below) and share their phenomenal music with all of you. I'm honored and humbled that they want to be
a part of it.


I'm
just the vehicle for this project, which has taken on a life of its
own.
But
I'm honored to be the facilitator and coordinator.


Let’s
make a soundtrack together!


-CJK





WHY
SOUNDTRACK A NOVEL?


The
idea is that the music will help you feel for the story and the story
will help you feel the music.
The
two will cross-promote one another.
It's
a rough market these days for indie writers and musicians - which
is exactly why soundtracking novels could become an important new
paradigm.



The music helps with writing (I've actually written some scenes for
songs!)
The music helps to emotionally bond readers with the story, and vice
versa
The soundtrack expands the venue options for concerts, book tours, and especially
combination performances, and provides an unusual “hook” to help
music artists get shows - and authors get talks.

It
expands promo reach – reaching the audience of every project artist
instead of just one person.
This crowdfunding campaign provides additional publicity for all
The project connects artists and creates a community of mutual
support
It's FUN!



For
the author, for the music artists, and for you our audience – it's
a WIN – WIN – WIN!





THE
TEAM


My soundtrack
artists will have a basic contract and will retain the rights to
their songs.
Each
soundtrack artist will receive some CDs to give away or sell, as they
wish.
They
will have the option of purchasing future CDs at cost, to sell and
keep the money.
If
the soundtrack and novel do well, I hope to set up some future
combination music / book tours with soundtrack artists who are
interested.





THE
$ GOAL $


This
might look like a lot of money, but a lot of it goes away before it
even gets to us, via Indiegogo commissions and taxes.


If
we hit the goal we get a LOT better deal on Indiegogo commission
(paying only 4% as opposed to 9%).  This
means much more of your pledge goes to supporting the project instead
of paying fees.
So
here's hoping you can help us hit the goal!


I
don't believe in asking music artists to work for free and hopefully
you don't either. These artists have poured their hearts and souls
and piggy banks into their music. Many have written or adjusted songs
especially for this soundtrack. This Indiegogo is in part to
compensate them a little for their time and talent. Since there are
17 of them, it adds up.


But,
17 artists translates to nearly 75 minutes of wonderfully diverse yet unified
music for your ears and soul and imagination. That's a lot of bang for the buck!


The
money is also needed to cover the costs of mastering and
manufacturing the CD, rewards, and shipping. I also hope to make at
least one music video for a soundtrack song, since this would be
invaluable for promoting the soundtrack and the artists on it.


If
you would like to see the actual nitty gritty project budget, just
drop me an email at edgethenovel@gmail.com
and I'll be happy to provide it.



FAQs


If
we don't hit the goal will we still make the soundtrack?
Yes
– even if only as a digital.
But
then I might have to ask the artists to work for free :(
And
it could get kinda demoralizing, depending. Let's not go there!


If
we only raise enough money to release the soundtrack in digital form,
will folks who pledged for a real CD still get it?
Yes.
The cost of making those, and all the rewards, is built into the
pledges even if worst came to worst. And, actually, they would be
even more valuable at that point because there would be far fewer of
them!


If
we exceed the goal, what will we do with the extra money?
The
plan is to use that money to make music videos for more of the songs,
which will boost promotion of the project, provide additional
exposure for artists, and give you the audience some extra sweetness.
Additionally, I'll be using those videos to help deliver some of the
critical messages of the novel (climate change, environment, homelessness, etc.) at a deep emotional level... using
them as a vehicle for positive transformation in the world.







THE
REWARDS!


We've
put together some kickass rewards, some of them one of a kind that
will only and ever be available HERE and NOW.
AND
WE'LL BE ADDING MORE AS THE CAMPAIGN CONTINUES.


Just
think: these soundtrack artists are achieving new levels even as you read. Some
may break out before this soundtrack even releases. These
rewards could end up being hot items in the near future!


The
soundtrack CD itself is going to be a special, super sweet Indiegogo
version. We'll be doing a limited run with exclusive artwork. Any
future manufacturing runs will have different artwork. (More on this coming in the days ahead!)


If you
want to collect more than one reward (and of course you do), that's
great too!
And if you wish to support this project in other ways beyond or aside from this Indiegogo, we're open to considering that - drop us an email.


If
you have any questions on rewards, feel free to email us at
edgethenovel@gmail.com.
NEWLY ADDED: contribute just ONE DOLLAR to our project and we'll immediately email you a sheet (in both PDF and JPEG format) of 8 bookmarks, with the classy Edge photo and 8 different Edgy quotes and taglines. Yes you must print and cut them yourself, but that means you can print as many as you want! Pass them out to all your friends!






Contribute just $5 and get the above bookmarks PLUS a sheet of Edge SONGQUOTES bookmarks! Poetic words from the soundtrack. You could even punch a hole in the top and add one of those classy little tassled cords...

those of you who don't know me, here are a brief bio and credentials
– not all music related to be sure, but a statement of my
reliability and ability to see projects through:


CJ
Kinton is a writer, music agent, educator and biologist, with dozens
of published articles and hundreds of public speaking and workshop
presentations to her credit. She has a BA in Human Ecology.

Booking and management for select Seattle indie music artists.
7
years as advertising sales coordinator / fundraiser / general
assistance for the Pentangle Arts Council in Woodstock, VT,

1.5 years as Producer and Production Manager for a large community

10
years as editor and production manager for a critically acclaimed community newsletter for a
Vermont co-op.
Varied work with many scientific and environmental non-profits
including Allied Whale in Maine (public relations, admin, humpback
whale fluke catalog), New England Marine Mammal Stranding Network
(establishment and coordination of a harbor seal pup rescue / rehab
clinic and drafting a rehab manual, in affiliation with the Boston
Aquarium and the University of Guelph, Canada), Marineland of the
Pacific Wildlife Rehab Clinic (including drafting a rehab manual for
oiled seabirds), the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History
in Washington DC (detailed cetacean skeletal collection inventory
team, educational materials), the University of Minnesota's Monarch
Larvae Monitoring Project (Advisory Board), and the Vermont Institute
of Natural Science (Outreach Education Coordinator, freelance exhibit
design consultant).

From Earth to the Edge - the Shift begins!

story:
Everyone has a beginning to their story...

For me, the beginning was pretty simple. I had a mini-van that took me all over the country from gig to gig. I started out playing in my home town at local haunts, but as things began to take off for me, I ended up traveling the country. In the beginning, all I had was a mini-van, a six-string guitar,   and a handful of songs. Now you can hear these songs in a previously unreleased format.  The Mini-Van Tapes is a collection of songs that never made it on an album, early versions of songs that DID make it on an album, and a couple of LIVE tracks including a brand new song that I debuted on the Redneck Yacht Club Radio Show this year.  Some of these songs were recorded in my living room, some were recorded in bars, and some were recorded somebody else's living room!  Its rough around the edges, totally unique, and totally unreleased. UNTIL NOW!

The Mini-Van Tapes (Track List)
1 Bar Room Angel
2 Family Tree
3 Falling
4 Generation X
5 Some Kind of Blue
6 Younger Days
7 Born On the Singing River
8 Redneck Girl
9 Winding Roads
10 Something Ain't Right to Me
11 Minivan Kind of Man (Live)
12 Hard Twerking American (Live)

What I Need

  • I'm raising 5 thousand dollars to put this album into production, increase the inventory in my merchandise line, and promote this new album in a digital and physical CD format. 

 What You Get

  • Online shout-outs
  • Single-song downloads
  • Matt Hoggatt bumper stickers
  • Signed matt Hoggatt Posters
  • Digital copies of the new album
  • Signed copies of the new CD
  • Music from my personal CD Collection
  • Merchandise Bundles
  • House Concerts

Risks

If I don't meet my goal, I'll travel to New Orleans, sit on a sidewalk with  a cardboard sign and raise the money the old fashioned way. Whatever it takes!


All Jokes Aside

This project is almost complete and ready to go, that's why you will get the album much sooner than later. This campaign is to reimburse my expenses that I paid out of pocket to make it happen.  You should receive your perks by June, 2015. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Money doesn't grow on trees. If you can't donate, please reccomend this page to someone that can. Share with your friends and lets make it happen :)
story_txt:
Everyone has a beginning to their story...
For me, the beginning was pretty simple. I had a mini-van that took me all over the country from gig to gig. I started out playing in my home town at local haunts, but as things began to take off for me, I ended up traveling the country. In the beginning, all I had was a mini-van, a six-string guitar,   and a handful of songs. Now you can hear these songs in a previously unreleased format.  The Mini-Van Tapes is a collection of songs that never made it on an album, early versions of songs that DID make it on an album, and a couple of LIVE tracks including a brand new song that I debuted on the Redneck Yacht Club Radio Show this year.  Some of these songs were recorded in my living room, some were recorded in bars, and some were recorded somebody else's living room!  Its rough around the edges, totally unique, and totally unreleased. UNTIL NOW!The Mini-Van Tapes (Track List)1
							
								Bar Room Angel
2
							
								Family Tree 						
					
						
							
								3
							
								Falling 4
							
								Generation X 						
					
						
							
								5
							
								Some Kind of Blue 6
							
								Younger Days 7
							
								Born On the Singing River 8
							
								Redneck Girl 9
							
								Winding Roads 10
							
								Something Ain't Right to Me 11
							
								Minivan Kind of Man (Live)12 Hard Twerking American (Live)
  What I Need 
  I'm raising 5 thousand dollars to put this album into production, increase the inventory in my merchandise line, and promote this new album in a digital and physical CD format.  



 What You Get


Online shout-outs
Single-song downloads
Matt Hoggatt bumper stickers
Signed matt Hoggatt Posters
Digital copies of the new album
Signed copies of the new CD
Music from my personal CD Collection
Merchandise Bundles
House Concerts

 Risks 
  If I don't meet my goal, I'll travel to New Orleans, sit on a sidewalk with  a cardboard sign and raise the money the old fashioned way. Whatever it takes!




All Jokes Aside
This project is almost complete and ready to go, that's why you will get the album much sooner than later. This campaign is to reimburse my expenses that I paid out of pocket to make it happen.  You should receive your perks by June, 2015.  
   Other Ways You Can Help Money doesn't grow on trees. If you can't donate, please reccomend this page to someone that can. Share with your friends and lets make it happen :)

story:
About us

We are a music based organization for charity. We work with national touring acts and bring them to you either by organizing an event at live music venues in the area or by showcasing them at our big event once a year on the Blitzcreek Stage 

What We Need & What You Get

We need people who love music and what you get is a party that includes up and coming talent mixed with local and regional talent. 

  • As always, a party costs money, we are not in this for personal gain. Our reward is the friendships and fun that is gained through each and every show we do. 
  • We are looking for local sponsors and we prefer ma and pops businesses who enjoy the same 
  • We are donating this years funds to the Urbana 5 scholarship fund. It is a very personal charity for us. One of our stagehands and friends was killed in a car accident a month before his graduation, along with his sister, brother, cousin and friend on April 9th. 

The Impact

We fell into this business due to tragedy and found it healing. Music is therapy and the friendships and following we have gained has healed us in many ways. We are thankful for it.

  • We work hard to make a difference in the music industry in our area by bringing talented musicians who love their fans and work hard for success. 
  • We work hard to make it affordable and fun for all involved. 

Risks & Challenges

There is always risks and challenges in what we do. However we believe in it, we love it and we couldn't imagine our lives without it so we will push hard to continue this passion.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, word of mouth, volunteering and bringing people to the shows to see what we can do would be priceless.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Autumn Maria Reed. I love to compose and orchestrate pop, jazz, and orchestral music from my home in Wisconsin. Being an independent woman, I have decided to take a big step by releasing my first album.

What We Need & What You Get

I would need $5,000 USD to produce this album. This will include:

·  Hiring up and coming session musicians and vocalists

·  Artwork

·  Mastering and printing CDs

·  Publishing on Spotify, iTunes, Amazon, and more. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially, have no fear! You can always help by listening to my YouTube channel at http://www.youtube.com/user/amreed8 or share this campaign with your family and friends.

story:
Bass music radio station

RoodFM is an established online bass music radio station. Once at the heart of the upcoming Dubstep movement with peak listeners in 2012-2013.

I have personally been running RoodFM since the beginning as a non-profit and it's fantastic to have seen the community grow and support the station through some truly amazing and unique experiences.

However the station is now in trouble and I begin to close it down, playing it's last ever show on 31st July 2015. I was not expecting the horror of this announcement which has led me to allow you guys to decide it's fate.

After 6 years of funding the station with my own money and help from previous backers it has become to difficult to continue. In order for RoodFM to rise to the next level it requires a management team and initial funding to implement change and monetisation methods so it can at the very least support it's own growth running costs.

What We Need & What You Get

So we need your help!

  • To have the best chance at survival we need £3000 & a sponsor.
  • Any funds will go directly into creating self-sustaining revenue and a team backing promotion.
What you get!
  • Shout out on the station!
  • Copy of the ROOD#1 album
  • Pair of Rood Sunnies!
  • RoodFM Member Band
  • Your name as a permanent fixture on the website
  • Your own radio show (subject to our broadcast quality guidelines)

The Impact

RoodFM was always a passion to develop a platform for talented bass music artists to share their sound with the world, hard times stuck when the dubstep movement slowed down and we moved into other bass music genres, the quality was just as good, the dubstep fad however promoted us in organic ways for free. After that platforms such as Mixlr allowed artists to play online, but without the backing of a globally known station.

  • The site has an historic archive of over 600 podcasts since the station began. 
  • RoodFM ran the first major unsigned UK DJ competition backed by Fostex, Livid, Reloop, InMusic, Serato & Jawbone.
  • We broadcast 70+ shows live in over 12 countries for 6 years as a non-profit.

Risks & Challenges

Honesty & transparency are key. This has been a tough road in a tougher market. The lack of man power has meant doing the hours required to secure the right placements at festivals or gain that important sponsorship has become increasingly difficult. The team I am looking to place at the forefront of RoodFM is Trojan Audio, a well known and respected label in the base music scene with the experience needed to secure a bright future for the station. We face rejection at corporate level, the battle to secure places at known festivals and the upward continued clime of global listenership. But we will succeed!

  • I have been involved in this scene for many years. I have overcome the hurdles presented to me at every corner to build the station we see today. The only thing holding me back is I can no longer afford to run this station for these brilliant artists on my own.
  • A full market strategy is being developed and available to anyone on request.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, trust me I understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about RoodFM's campaign.
  • Remind them to use the share tools!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for taking the time to read and I hope you'll consider backing us.

story:
The Capitol Hill Jazz Jam is a weekly performance of live music, similar to an open mic, at the Historic Mr. Henry's Restaurant; that features an assortment of Jazz musicians typically from the DC/MD/VA area all performing together.

Founded by Washington, D.C. native and saxophonist Herb Scott in February 2015, the Jam has become D.C.'s newest and greatest Jazz Jam Session. D.C. once played host to a number of Jazz clubs, jam sessions and the like during the 20th century but in the last few decades those venues and musicians have become scarce. It is the CHJJ's mission to create a space where musicians of different levels can come together and play with hopes that the advanced musicians will bring up the beginner musicians. The Jam session is a communal activity that strengthens the Jazz scene and makes musicians want to play on a higher level, spend more time practicing and rehearsing and creates a friendly sense of competition.

Since its inception the CHJJ has hosted a number of well known and legendary Jazz musicians in the house band and even revived an old Jazz tradition of musical competition with the infamous Cuttin' Contest. The Cuttin' Contest has become the highlight of the CHJJ. From March to May of 2015 musicians competed in three rounds of elimination for the top prize of $50 or a $25 gift card to the runner-up and the winners were chosen by the audience's applause. And in a effort to give back to the community, the CHJJ held a Back to School Drive to donate school supplies to the Two Rivers Public Charter School. We would like to do more to build bridges in our community. 


In our short time we have:

Been picked by the Washington City Paper as the Best, Oldest Newest Jazz Venue

Participated in the D.C. Jazz Fest's Jazz in the Hood program as part of the DC Jazz Fest 2015

Have been a part of the Fox 5 Zip Trip Special on the Capitol Hill/Eastern Market neighborhood

Held a Back to School Drive for the Two Rivers Public Charter School

Given out $300 in cash and $150 in gift cards to musicians in the Cuttin' Contest

We would love to increase our ability in the community but we need your support:

We would like to pay our house band more than we do. These are legendary musicians with decades of experience and we want to make sure that they are justly compensated for their talent and time.

We want to offer a higher prize for our Cuttin' Contest and Finale Contest. We believe that a competitive Jazz scene is a healthy Jazz scene. 

We want to form more partnerships with local schools and arts programs as part of our effort of giving back. We need to be able to sponsor deserving students with materials they need to be successful students

We want to have special guest musicians, local and out of state and compensate them.


If you would like to see more please visit Mr. Henry's website, the Capitol Hill Jazz Jam Facebook Page our Youtube channel. 

We are also on Twitter @CapHillJazzJam and Instagram @CapitolHillJazzJam

We greatly appreciate any and all of your support and invite you to come check us out live every Wednesday 8-11pm at Mr. Henry's Restaurant 601 Pennsylvania Ave. S.E.

story:
Summary


Help Electronic Blue  launch a worldwide marketing strategy for the new album 'Reflections'
I have been composing and producing music as Electronic Blue since early 2008, as a solo artist.
My musical training started in early secondary school with private piano lessons after classes, along wih theory.
Since then, I have had various private tutors and music school training in both practical & theory.
I also have a very deep interest in classical music.
in my 20's, I was a member of 2 Liverpool bands and played the local circuit in the city.
With continued musical training over the intervening years, I started to formulate the sound of Electronic Blue, which is where I am today.

The most expensive and time consuming side, the making, producing and release of the album, has been completed by Dubai based artist Electronic Blue (Joe Campbell) and it is available now on most major download stores worldwide, including iTunes, Amazon mp3, amongst others:
itunes.apple.com/us/album/reflections/id952586581

Unfortunately, I currently do not have the funds or income to market/promote the album fully. I believe I have created a unique sound with this album and I am determined to have it represented on a global scale.
Within each track on the album I have managed to create it's own unique sound, exploring the Electronica/Rock genre fully with these instrumental compositions.
This project will enable me to entice music lovers of the genres to the album sites to purchase and download on a much wider and hopefully worldwide scale.

It will also be promoting the albums visibility to potential record labels too.

I have included a video of one of the album tracks 'The experiment' here for anyone to play & hear my musicianship!

Please check this out as you will then hear an example of  the professional & high standard of the music .

I am doing as much as i can currently to promote the album, through social media sites etc, but to do this on, i believe, the scale my music deserves will take funding. The music sites & web page of Electronic Blue I have listed here, so please take the time if you can to listen to the album tracks on these sites. I am sure you will not be disappointed!

Any size donation will be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance for taking the time to read this. Regards, Electronic Blue (Joe Campbell)

http://electronic-blue.com/

https://www.reverbnation.com/electronicblue

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Electronic-Blue-official/903337369693335

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will enable Electronic Blue to promote the new album 'Reflections' on a global scale.

The idea is to promote it across all available social sites and music industry sites to create a global liking/following for the album and the music of Electronic Blue.

The funding will also enable more intense promoting to record labels also.

The total sum to achieve this and to a mass audience is set at $5,000.

this will be used for payments necessary on sites to promote the album to the fullest capability.

All expenditure will be visible to anyone wishing to view.

any partial funding achieved will still be used for the global promotion of the album to its fullest possibility.

Up to now, $400 has been raised offline for this project.

    The Impact

    This project will give me the capability to promote my music on a global scale and to enable me to share my gift as a musician with a far wider audience than today. I am fulfilling a lifelong ambition to share and promote my music on such a scale, as i believe I have something unique to share

      Risks & Challenges

      The main challenge is to expose the album to potential fans on a global scale!
      Also, to make the music of Electronic Blue a household name.
      This is a low risk project but it will require and has my fullest commitment, time & energy.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't commit in dollars then please share my Electronic Blue links from here etc, by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Thanks so much for stopping by to see what my project is all about.  Ever since a young age I wanted to be a singer, it was when I herd my sister singing in her bedroom, Hero By Mariah Carey. I herd the passion in her voice and how beautiful it sounded and I fell in love with the Art. The first song I ever remember singing for my mom and sister my two best friends is "I Believe I Can Fly" By R.Kelly.

My biggest goal and dream in life is to record Music. Music is something that can change the way your feeling in a few short moments. I'd love nothing more then the chance to make music from my heart and inspire people. The latest song ive written is called "Imagine Dream Believe" This song tells the story of my life and  the struggles of a kid who is different then the rest. Who is picked on and put down but never gives up. 

 "If you imagine dream believe you can do anything, anything.If you imagine dream believe you can be anything and everything no matter what the people say, live your life everyday doing what you love and have no regrets".

All the money I raise will be going towards the album from purchasing the beats to recording and mastering the songs, a Photo shoot, getting my EP on iTunes, getting a song on the radio, CD duplication and design, also getting the PERKS made and sent.

As for Perks i'd love to be able to do soooo much more then I can but here's what I can do. :)

In no particular order and some may come as a package, the more you donate the more you receive :) 

~A Signed Photo From My Shoot 

~A Copy Of The EP 

~A Free Download Of The EP On Itunes 

~A Thank You Shout Out In the Album Booklet 

~A Video Shout Out Sent to your Email

~A Signed Chris James T-Shirt 

~A Card stating that you indeed helped Chris James reach his dreams They will be numbered and they will be unique. 

~My Love Always <3

~Everything Listed Above 

If my goal is not met in the 60 day's I will extend the campaign for another 60 day's if i'm allowed. If not I will have to work my butt off extra hard to make the rest of the money i need for the project; it might take awhile but i've never been more determined in my life to do something, so it's happening I just need a little help. :)

This is a very hard inderstury to brake into, I have a lot of love and support from my friends and family my mom keeps me grounded and always thinking positive.  I will get knocked down but ill just stand right back up again.  Here's another reference from  "Imagine Dream Believe" 

"My momma raised no quitter cause she raised ya she raised a fighter.She said these dreams are hard to follow but baby I believe in you I know you have what it takes to shine brighter"

so with out a doubt in my mind I believe that we, you and I can do this. 

I'm starting a new Chapter in my Life. I'm going to call it. Say it with me now lol 

           Chapter 24 

Imagine Dream Believe 

Help me Write it..  

Love Always  Chris James xoxo <3

FACEBOOK                                                      

facebook.com/chrisjames1111

Instagram 

Chrisjames11.11

SOUND CLOUD

Chrisjames1111

Twitter 

ChrisJames_11

If your Unable to donate don't sweat it, :)  share my campaign 

with your friends and spread the word.  It's just as good as Donating. <3

Who is picked on and put down but never gives up.  "If you imagine dream believe you can do anything, anything.If you imagine dream believe you can be anything and everything no matter what the people say, live your life everyday doing what you love and have no regrets".All the money I raise will be going towards the album from purchasing the beats to recording and mastering the songs, a Photo shoot, getting my EP on iTunes, getting a song on the radio, CD duplication and design, also getting the PERKS made and sent.As for Perks i'd love to be able to do soooo much more then I can but here's what I can do. :)In no particular order and some may come as a package, the more you donate the more you receive :) ~A Signed Photo From My Shoot ~A Copy Of The EP ~A Free Download Of The EP On Itunes ~A Thank You Shout Out In the Album Booklet ~A Video Shout Out Sent to your Email~A Signed Chris James T-Shirt ~A Card stating that you indeed helped Chris James reach his dreams They will be numbered and they will be unique. ~My Love Always <3~Everything Listed Above If my goal is not met in the 60 day's I will extend the campaign for another 60 day's if i'm allowed. If not I will have to work my butt off extra hard to make the rest of the money i need for the project; it might take awhile but i've never been more determined in my life to do something, so it's happening I just need a little help. :)This is a very hard inderstury to brake into, I have a lot of love and support from my friends and family my mom keeps me grounded and always thinking positive.  I will get knocked down but ill just stand right back up again.  Here's another reference from  "Imagine Dream Believe" "My momma raised no quitter cause she raised ya she raised a fighter.She said these dreams are hard to follow but baby I believe in you I know you have what it takes to shine brighter"so with out a doubt in my mind I believe that we, you and I can do this. I'm starting a new Chapter in my Life. I'm going to call it. Say it with me now lol            Chapter 24 Imagine Dream Believe Help me Write it..  Love Always  Chris James xoxo <3FACEBOOK                                                      facebook.com/chrisjames1111Instagram Chrisjames11.11SOUND CLOUDChrisjames1111Twitter ChrisJames_11If your Unable to donate don't sweat it, :)  share my campaign with your friends and spread the word.  It's just as good as Donating. <3

story:
"At heart, I’m a philanthropist. The essence of who I am is strengthened and uplifted when I am given the opportunity to meet a need."

The statement above has been my defining purpose for as long as I can remember. I wasn't born into a musical family, but one day when I was about 15, something in me allowed me to believe I have the ability to do music, so I pursued it and have been doing it ever since.

Around mid-2012, I did my first official studio recording--a single entitled “Who Are We”, an original song that’s dear to my heart. Well, 2012 was a long time ago, and aside from some travelling, I've been writing and performing many more songs since then and I want you to hear them. It’s time to hit the studio again, and this time, I'm recording a 4-song EP called “#LoveLifeAndGod”

Click here to listen, get lyrics, and download the single for free


What is my music about?

I was born and raised in Jamaica, where I spent the first half of my life. I later migrated to the U.S. where I spent the next half, and then a year ago, I moved to Africa--a long way from my small island. This has put me in the interesting position of having lived in both the 1st and 3rd world, and from this viewpoint, I've observed that quite a number of people either think the grass is always greener or browner on the other side. My conclusion is this: it’s just grass, and grass changes color. Regardless of our religion, race, or grass, our humanity binds us together. A man is my brother because he is human, therefore, he is entitled to my love regardless. As a songwriter, I desire to simply write about the world through the lens of my faith, experience, and understanding. I see the many problems that exist, and I see how easily men lose hope. If my songs can inspire and encourage, I have accomplished my goal.


The EP

This is an Indiegogo exclusive campaign— meaning that the perks here will not be available anywhere else at any time after this campaign has ended.

This EP will consist of 4 songs, plus a bonus track (available depending on your backing amount). These songs are meant to give everyone a taste of my message, and it'll also allow the opportunity to take my musical journey to another level.

The tracks to be included are:

  • Peace Must Come to Earth
  • Everything is Alright (Once there is Love)
  • Reason to Sing
  • Lift my Hands (God of my Life)
  • Bonus track (can’t tell you the name--it’s a surprise)
These songs were carefully selected from my vault because I feel that, with everything that's going on today, I want to use my music as a way to help uplift the human spirit. My hope is to embolden my audience as they navigate the confusions and tumults along the way.

The Recording Process

Currently, I’m living in Uganda where I serve with an empowerment organization, and will not be able to travel back to the U.S. to record this EP (although that would be nice). However, with today's technology, a cross-continental production is as easy as pushing a button. I’ll do the pre-production work in Uganda, then send it to my producer in Philly where we will collaborate remotely on producing the tracks. After we produce the tracks, we will fly them back to Africa via the internet where I will record vocals. After vocals are done, we will send it back to America again for mixing and mastering, and after that, I will make it available online so the whole world can have access. Cool huh?


Why I need you

Good production is really expensive! It takes a lot of hours put in by musicians, recording engineers, producers, and other music professionals. For me to bring this project to completion, I need a team of backers and supporters like you.

To complete this project, we need to raise $5,000.

Here's a quick breakdown:

  • $150 for pre-production costs
  • $1,000 for recording
  • $500 for mixing
  • $400 for mastering
  • $1,500 for CD printing
  • $300 for artwork
  • $600 for merchandise (t-shirts, posters, etc.)
  • Plus digital distribution, promotion, crowdfunding fees, and other expenses!
Everyone can help

Let’s say you don’t have any money to back to the campaign. I still need you on my team. Indiegogo won't allow me to do a perk amount of $0 so you will have to join the team via my mailing list - Click Here to Signup Now. You will still get a special thank you, and an early digital download of the EP.

Everyone can play a major role in helping to get the campaign funded by getting the word out to people you know (and even those you don't know), regardless of whether you are able to back the project or not.

If you want to show your support, here are some things you can do:

  • Link other people directly to this campaign page
  • Share on social networks, and encourage your friends to support
  • Share the EP when it's released!

Even if you backed the campaign, you can still help us to spread the word! Also, check out the links at the bottom, so you can follow our digital breadcrumbs.


Alternate payment methods
For check, or money order, send to:
Anthony J Thompson
437 W Valley Forge Rd, King of Prussia, PA 19406 U.S.A.

For mobile money, send to
+256 0771 665 867



Thank you so much for sharing in this special experience!
Anthony Jermaine

P.S. I have a street team, if you want to join the group on Facebook, CLICK HERE
