story:
Overview of Guitar-Jo

Though guitars and banjos are both stringed instruments, they are very different. Guitar players who desire to play the banjo often do not follow through for several reasons: A banjo uses metal finger picks to pluck the strings versus a guitar pick or bare fingers, they have a very different tuning and playing style, it requires time to learn a completely new instrument and it is an extra expense. That is where Guitar-Jo comes in.

Guitar-Jo is an electric guitar accessory that mounts onto the body of a guitar and produces the sound of a banjo. It is more affordable, easy to use, and gives guitarists the opportunity to broaden the sound of their guitar. Watch the video at the top of the page to see how it works!



About

I am 23 years old and live in a small town in Massachusetts with my beautiful bride Katie. I have a passion for creating, whether it is writing music, web or graphic design, musical instruments and gadgets, or just home projects. I have been singing, playing guitar, bass, drums, piano, and doing music production for over 10 years (youtube.com/user/jlangbergmusic).
I never expected to create a musical invention that was not only proprietary but something that people actually wanted to buy themselves, so this is all really exciting to me! What would have been another a lost invention stored in my closet was brought to light by the encouragement of family and friends, so thank you everyone!


What We Need & What You Get

We have designed and refined the product over and over again, and we are finally ready for Guitar-Jo to hit the masses. With experience in sales and marketing, we have developed excellent marketing campaigns and strategies for a successful move into the market, but we need your support to help it come to fruition. Through your contributions, we will be able to turn this dream into a reality.

The contributions will be put towards:

  • Hiring a patent attorney to draft and file a non-provisional utility patent along with government filing fees (we have already filed a provisional patent, which lasts 12 months from the filing date)
  • Purchasing production materials
  • Purchasing specialized equipment
  • Online and offline marketing campaigns

There are more costs associated with the implementation of Guitar-Jo, but that is the general gist of it. Please consider contributing, and if you contribute certain amounts, you will get perks such as your very own Guitar-Jo among other rewards.

Risks & Challenges

We have worked hard to minimize the risks and challenges associated with this project. With experience in sales and marketing, we have developed excellent marketing campaigns and strategies for delivering this product to the masses, and with the funds we paid out of our own pockets, we created a customized production shop for producing the Guitar-Jo's.

The current production setup will suffice for the beginning, but we may face challenges in keeping up with production when the product starts to gain momentum. The part of the production process that consumes the most time is bending the aluminum, and though it is fine for now, we have been coming up with alternative solutions for the future when we do need to shift gears due to higher demand. To do that, we need contributors to help us hit our financial goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you contribute $1, any amount helps! But if you can't contribute any monetary amount, there are still ways you can help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Guitar-Jo! (you can use the Indiegogo share tools to make it easier!)
  • Like us on our Facebook Page.
  • Drop us a positive comment (please message us if you have suggestions about the product)

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone!

I am Nubia Emmon, an R&B artist from Austin, Texas. I've been singing since the age of 3 and performing since I was 7 years old. My goal is to become a world-class performer while making a meaningful contribution through my Foundation, especially by raising awareness about breast cancer, research and detection.

What I hope to accomplish through Indiegogo and with YOUR help is twofold: convene our 2nd annual "Pretty Girls that Rock the Mic for Breast Cancer Awareness" Benefit concert and complete my EP. In addition to the many perks listed, ALL contributors will have their names listed in the Acknowledgements as having made this all possible.

This campaign is soooo important to me because I absolutely love music and I made a promise to myself AND to my Mother that I would make it in the music industry. Unfortunately, my Mother passed away about a year ago from breast cancer, I cannot begin to describe to you how much I miss her and would give anything to have her back! With that said, I made a promise to her that I would succeed as a Musician and I want to keep that promise.

Prior to her passing, with my Team, I had been involved in raising awareness about this deadly disease and the importance of early detection.  About a couple of years ago, we organized our first "Pretty Girls that Rock the Mic for Breast Cancer Awareness" concert. The purpose was to showcase some of Austin's brightest women artists from a variety of music genres while raising breast cancer awareness in a benefit concert. We worked with the Susan G. Komen Foundation/Austin Affiliate in educating the public and my Mom gave a personal testimony. With only 3 weeks of planning and on a shoestring budget, we drew over 600 people and it was held at a local club.


This project is important to me because with your help, my Team and I want to Rock our next Pretty Girls concert at a larger-family friendly venue so we can reach more people (5000 is our target)--especially young people who may think "it can't happen to me" (My Mom was only 44). My vision is for this to become an annual educational/musical event.

Some of the exciting things I've been part of with help from my Team:

  • Pretty Girls that Rock the Mic benefit concert (2012)
  • Breast Cancer Awareness Mixer (2012)
  • Invited to sing the National Anthem at the Susan G. Komen/Austin Race for the Cure (11/2012); also participated in other Komen/Austin events
  • Organized a Team that raised funds for the Susan G. Komen/Austin Race for the Cure and sang the National Anthem (11/2014)

          

        RIP -I Love You Mommy......


The Impact

By joining this Movement, your support will not only help us to convene the next Pretty Girls that Rock the Mic concert, but you will be helping to educate our youth and families whom we hope to inspire to join the breast cancer awareness movement. In addition, you will be helping me to release my very first EP as an Indie Artist. I describe my music as fun, fresh, and "relatable" to the things teenagers and people in general go through. I am extremely excited about that!!!


    What We Need & What You Get

    My goal is to raise $20,000. Here is the breakdown of where funds will go:

    Production ($7000); We've raised funds for the music that I am currently working on but we're still short and so funds are needed for new music in order to complete the EP. This also involves Mixing & Mastering, Studio recording, CDs (pressing and packaging) and music videos. This budget also includes Sound and Lighting for the Pretty Girls concert.

    Marketing ($7000); Advertising (Online, TV & Radio spots), Online Wire services, Website design & maintenance, Videography (event documentation), Photography, Promotional giveaways,

    Professional Fees and Living/Misc. fees ($4000)

    • Publicist and Event Planner ($1800)
    • Indiegogo fees + S/H of our perks to you = 15%
    • My music is my first job. My second job helps me pay the bills. I've had to scale down on my work hours in order to give the time necessary for this project. (.08% of the total budget will go to living expenses)   

    Travel ($2000); Even while we are organizing this event, shows are still being booked in and out of town and so funds are needed to help me get from city to city as well as out of state. 

    If I surpass my goal of $20,000, funds will be used to:

    • Begin planning for the 2016 Pretty Girls that Rock the Mic Concert
    • Begin work on next EP
    • Use surplus funds to organize fundraisers

    If we don't reach our entire goal on  Indiegogo:

    We will continue to raise money through sponsorships, angel investors, local fundraisers, in-kind contributions and personal efforts.

     Please be sure to check out our wonderful GIFTS for you!

    Risks & Challenges

    Musicians face the challenge of being in a very risky industry where you have to create your own opportunities to make it to the top. Knowing that there are other talented artist who want the same thing as I do, I understand that I have to work hard to distinguish myself.

    One of my greatest assets is my very knowledgeable team and primarily my manager who has over 20 years experience in the music industry. Having started with nothing but the power of belief, help from family and friends, we've come this far so I believe that when you start from the bottom, you're unstoppable


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Here's what YOU can do to join our movement and help:

    • If you aren't able to make a contribution, please send me prayers and positive vibes!
    • Please leave a comment--it will show that I have support
    • Help get the word out by sharing my Indiegogo project & video
    • Please stop by my website (nubiaemmon.com and thenubiaemmonfoundation.com) and leave your email address--I'd love to keep you posted on future releases and events--especially the Pretty Girls' concert:)
    • If you are inspired to contribute an insane amount - $1 or $1 million dollars:) please, by all means do so!
    • If you know any angel investors, connect us or share my Indiegogo site
    • Most importantly, ladies AND guys, get yourselves checked every year. Take nothing for granted--breast cancer can strike anyone at anytime
    • Blast me out on your twitter and facebook!

story:
Short Summary

Hey, Guys!!!

I am DJ Mo-Rilla, a new up and coming here in the grand city of Raleigh. Got myself into music at a young age and became an instrumentalist. Grew up and got a degree in Audio Production and Design. Now, I"m expanding my business into Karaoke.

Who doesn't love a good karaoke night? I could use some help to bring more karaoke to the people who want it most. There can never be enough. I have bars lined up waiting for me.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $5000 to buy karaoke sound packs to have a variety of songs available. A good karaoke DJ has at least 10,000 songs.

I have all the equipment I need. All that's left are the songs and to create the books. If I don't achieve my entire goal, I will get as many songs as I possibly can.

Other Ways You Can Help

 I know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks Guys!!!

story:
First off, I want to thank you so much for taking time to view my fundraising page! I wanted to tell you a little about myself and why I am doing all of this. 

I started singing when I was in high school. My family didn't have a lot when I was growing up. At a very young age I had to begin to work for myself to fund the things I wanted. I discovered my ability to sing through my high school musicals and choir class. I found such a passion for singing that I decided I wanted to pursue it as a career. At this time, I was entering my senior year of high school and did not have a lot of background in auditioning. I had leads in my high school musicals but, I never knew what it actually took to audition for schools. I had never even taken a voice lesson up to this point. But, I knew that my passion would lead me to my purpose. So, I auditioned for many schools and found the best fit for me was West Virginia University. I was a small fish in a big pond. I knew that my work was not over and that I would have to work even harder to make my dreams a reality.

I heard about AIMS, American International Music Society, through my colleagues and teachers at school. The program itself came highly recommended by all of them. They all told me that they "learned more about themselves and music in those six weeks than almost all my undergraduate degree". So, after doing some research I discovered what an exciting opportunity it was to sing for their program.  For years in my undergraduate I have worked with the goal in mind to one day sing in Graz, Austria. 

I had the opportunity to not only sing for them this fall, but I was fortunate enough to work with one of the teachers who will be at the program this summer in a masterclass. After only four days, AIMS sent me an acceptance letter expressing their interest in me attending their program. Words cannot describe how excited I am about this opportunity.

The program itself in total, with airfare and meals that are not covered, costs just about $6000. I was gracious enough to receive a scholarship from the program which did bring the price down a good bit, but I still need your help.

I know that this sounds like a lot but some of the opportunities that I will have over there are like no other.  Some of the things I'll get to do there are:

. Perform with a professional orchestra on many public concerts

.Study with world renowned teachers and coaches

. Audition for European agents, that could possibly lead to signing a contract to sing at one of the many European houses

. Audition to compete for cash money prizes at the end of the program

I personally, have never been to Europe, let alone, outside of the Pennsylvania-West Virginia-Ohio Region. I know that what I am asking is a lot but, this has been my dream since I first entered college. I know that God has a plan for me and he wouldn't put this great opportunity in front of me if he did not think I should take it. Any little bit helps me achieve my dream. I am very grateful for all the opportunities in life and I will make use of every moment I can. 

I want to thank you all in advance from the bottom of my heart for helping out, if you can, to make my dreams come true.

story:
My Story

Hello, I'm Joy Stuhr,  a classically trained pianist and cellist, working as a musician, and teacher in Berlin, Germany.  In short: I studied music in Wisconsin, created a music program for youth and adults in Panama, taught Bilingual Special Education in the Bronx, NYC and now am a freelancing in Germany.  This past September, an amazing opportunity fell into my lap which has led me to create this music project in Ghana, Africa with local musician and professional traditional flautist, Dela Botri, in order to create and record music and teach music to children who otherwise wouldn't have the opportunity.

In September 2014, I was invited to go to Ghana with the German/Ghanaian artist Philip Metz  to and participate in his project, Eagle Africa.  (Click for more info!)

(Philip Metz, on left, being introduced at his exhibition in Accra, Ghana at the Goethe Institute)

My role was to create music that represented both Germany and Ghana, by working and composing with local artists in Ghana and combining their traditional music and instruments with Western classical elements.

(In the practice room with Dela!)

The result was one of the best musical experiences of my life. I had the honor to meet and play with Dela Botri, who is well-established in Ghana with his traditional Ghanaian band, and together we combined our original music to create something beautiful and new. We were able to record one song, and afterwards, we wanted to repeat the experience. (Curious? Look to the right: You can purchase the song in the PERKS!)

(Day of the exhibition!)

The reaction from the audience the day of the exhibition was enthusiastic and inspiring. The people sang along, while I played a Steinway piano with Dela and his drummer!

Click HERE to listen to Dela Botri's music!

The whole trip inspired me to return to Ghana and record, not just one song, but a whole CD. I don't want to stop with Ghana, though - I want to work in other countries, learn from them and their traditional music as a way to honor it, value it and expose it to others. This is just the start!

Dela Botri mentioned that he teaches flute to youth at “Street Academy”.  A school  that provides free education to children in Accra, Ghana.

 While I am working on the CD project, I also plan to give one week of intensive lessons and workshops to students that could benefit from the experience, and otherwise could not afford it! 

Through all my past experiences in Panama, South America and New York, with music and education, my heart has a calling to this project. I cant wait to get started, and I want to thank you in advance for your support!

What We Need & What You Get

Where your donation will go:

  • Fund the cost of recording in Ghana: 150€ per track for the musicians, 100€ per track for the recording and mastering. That's 250€ per track. We would like to do at least 6 tracks for 1,500€.  Support a track and the original song will be dedicated to you!
  • Fund the teaching expenses. I want to pay a donation to Dela Botri so he can take time off to join me in teaching the students.
  • Instruments and costumes to donate to "Street Academy's" Drum team.
  • Costs and travel expenses to go there, stay there, and get around: 1.000€ flight, 700€ Lodging, 350€ travel expenses for moving equipment, etc, 550€ food and other expenses. 2.600€ estimated total
  • Invite Philip Metz to come make a documentary about the creation he started. 1000€ minimum budget.
  • After the trip, I will have the CD production and design costs, which could be about another estimated 1.000€

In sum: we need minimum 5.000€ at least ($5,600) to make the project happen! If we don't make the full goal, we will still send a donation to "Street Academy" and post-pone the project until the summer.

We will keep raising funds while we are there, until we leave Ghana, and the ideal goal is to reach $9.000 so we can afford everything listed above! Anything above that will be donated to the academy and used to make more tracks!

By supporting the project, you can choose from many different thank-you perks! Take a look at the right side bar, we'd like to offer you anything that "perks" your interest--from a CD, to a copy of the finished documentary, to having a song written in dedication to you, or a shout-out from the artists on Youtube!

The Impact

Your donation will make a difference with this project in many ways:

  • Create the possibility for new music with traditional Ghanaian instruments to exist in the world that otherwise wouldn't!
  • As a musician, I will get to learn and grow from the beautiful, traditional music of Ghana and bring it back to the USA and Europe.
  • You will be making my dream come true to do this project!
  • A select group of children with musical talent will have the opportunity to grow musically and learn more about their traditional music.  Many of these children would otherwise not be able to afford it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help and support the cause, and are looking for options other than a monetary donation, you can:

  • Spread the word about the campaign to people who you think would be interested!
  • Donate skills such as: video editing, CD production or art design, or some other skill you think could help to project!
  • Connect us with people who you may know in Ghana, or with connections to Ghana!
  • Remember, you can always share on social networks! Feel free to pass it on! Every contribution is greatly appreciated!

story:
I have a lot on my mind as I write this and, well, you seem like someone I can trust. So I'm going to let you in on a big secret. For practically my whole life, I've allowed the world to see me as a drummer. 

I was willing to do whatever it took to sustain the illusion. I took lessons (!), I started walking around with drumsticks in my back pocket and my baseball cap turned sideways. I went so far as to tour and record with the mighty Spock's Beard, and play on albums by legendary artists like Carlos Santana, Kenny Loggins, Selena, John Waite and Bruce Dickinson (yes, THE Bruce Dickinson). 

And the world believed it. Hell, I guess I started believing it myself. Look, I'm not sure how to say this, except just to say it. So here goes. Did you know that I love to sing? I do, I really do! I sing all the time. In fact, I'm singing as I type this. 

I've finally reached a point in my life when I'm comfortable in my own vocal cords, with who I really am. I like... nay, LOVE being a singer. And with the nurturing support of all the songwriters and brilliant musicians I've met along the way, I've decided that I don't care who knows it. As the very classy and wise Diana Ross once put it, "I want the world to know." 

So, world (that's you)...
It's time for a solo album! A solo album on which I'll sing every song. Oh, I'll still play drums and anything else I can get my hands on (spoiler: your girlfriend), but mostly I'll be singing my pants off. Don't be surprised if you know the friends I bring along for the ride. After 35 years in this business, I've made some pretty cool friends. 
Naturally, I've included some fun incentive packages so take a look and choose what's right for you. And visit often, because I'll be adding further incentives.
This can't happen without you. Help me make this lifelong dream a reality. Share in that dream and I will see to it that your ears get a belly full of sonic gourmet. And just as with any other deep, dark secret I share, feel free to tell everyone you know.

story:
This campaign is closed please go to the Fourth and Final one for the Vinyl lover in you

GONE TOO SOON - Featured in the Miami Herald and in the Miami New Times

They say that the third time is the charm. I first want to thank those who have pledged to parts 1 and  2 of this heartfelt project, I believe I've ben called to do. It came short of the goal, whoever I haven't given up yet. The World's Finest project  was able to raise  381.54 (including Indiegogo's fees) in Part 1 on and 335.05 in Part 2 this heartwarming project however the journey continues.

In 1989, two years before Magic Johnson announced he was HIV positive, My uncle and godfather lost his life to AIDS; he was a mere 28 years old. Although his life ended far too soon I am working on his legacy will lasting forever with this Indiegogo project to bring the recently found rare recording to life. I'm working with my uncle and godfather's music to raise awareness about HIV, encouraging everyone to know their own HIV status. This is important everywhere, but especially in Miami-Dade County, which Care Sources indicates is the number one county in Florida for new cases of HIV.

 

It all started this spring when I received a package in the mail. I opened the box, found a video, placed it in his video player, and pressed play. The harmonious sounds of his my late uncle and godfather, Daniel Coulanges, filled the room as Daniel played an unaccompanied classical guitar adaptation of:

"Ne Me Quitte Pas."

As the video continued, I saw and heard a number of musical masterpieces, including:

 

 
Don’t Cry for Me Argentina and
 

Killing Me Softly;

I felt my late uncle and godfather's presence as if they were in the same room.

With your pledges, I am confident we will get the music mastered and produce the album.

Have you ever wanted to share your talents with the world? What if you never had a chance to? My late uncle and godfather Daniel Coulanges described as, "The world's finest guitarist" died at the young age of 28 years old on April 30th, 1989 of HIV/AIDS. At that time it was a death sentence. Today with early testing and medicine many are living and thriving with HIV/AIDS.  In Miami, One in 99 Miami-Dade residents is living with HIV or AIDS (one in 67 male and one in 178 female) source careresource.org. Your generous pledge will help awareness of the importance of one knowing their HIV status negative or positive.  

Daniel never had an opportunity to share his talents with the world. Thanks to my other uncle Amos Coulanges, he was able to get rare footage of his late baby brother Daniel performing. My wife and I named our second daughter Danielle after my late godfather/uncle. Danielle has his sense of humor, candidness, and adventure.

This video is  Daniel's cover of "Killing Me Softly." With that rare footage, I was able to extract the audio. However, I need your help from there. With your pledges, I am confident we will able to fully commit and complete this project. This remarkable project includes: 

Digital copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 

Physical copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 

World's Finest guitar pick 

World's Finest Poster

A World's Finest t-shirt of your own

Credit on the Album

Executive Producer Credit

Digital Download Film of Daniel's Performance in Concert

 

In the spirit of transparency, here are the appromixmate breakdowns the World's Finest costs:

World’s Finest T-shirts $170.00 

Limited CD duplication and distribution $300

Graphic Design - $370

Mastering -$700

World’s Finest posters -$60

Custom World's Finest Guitar Picks - $50

Music License Fees - $117.24

 

$1767.2 + plus $185 (Fulfillment (Shipping and handling Cost)

 

$1952.2 - Funds raised so far $335.05 - $381.54 = 692.87

 

$1235.61 + 125 Indiegogo Fees 

 

I manage to reduce the cost from the original $2700 down to by not just raising what we've raised but reducing the actual cd production to a smaller amount  to get to the final number of $1358.61

 

By backing this project, it will give us the necessary funding to do four things:

1. For professional mastering. We are aiming high and will have this album mastered professionally for your listening pleasure 

2. For production. Once the album is complete, the funding you provide will allow us to bring the album into production and distribution. We have always made sure our albums are packaged beautifully & we want to maintain that standard. We will be fulfilling the orders of the t-shirts, posters and cd's

3. Professional graphic design. Because we are working with aged images we want those images to be restored and the graphics and text to be as professionally done as possible and your funding will help us get there.

4. Editing the concert video. Editing the aged footage will take some time and with your pledges, the editing will be done and distributed to you to enjoy watching over and over again

With your pledges, I am confident we will support this project fully funded 

World's Finest Live in New York album Track-lists

1. Etude No 17 

2. Adelita

3. Maria

4. Capricho Árabe

5. Valse Vénézuelienne

6. Valse Vénézuelienne (reprise)

7. Spanish Roman (Romance de Espana)

8. Killing Me Softly 

9. La Bohème

10. Ne Me Quitte Pas (Don't Leave Me)

11. Don't Cry for Me Argentina

12. Chason Latine

13. Sine

14. Nan Fon Bwa

15. M Pap Pale Man Pawôl

16. Belle Haîti

17. Ti Zandô

18. Kouzin

 

ONE LAST THING

I encourage everyone reading this to pursue your passion intentionally with purpose because if you don't no one else will. No one is promised tomorrow so why not pursue your passion with the natural gifts that you've been given right NOW.

To paraphrase a conversation I recently had with someone. We are killing ourselves softly with each moment that passes when we don't at least attempt to express and share our talents with each other. But letting your light shine you unknowingly inspire others to shine their lights as well. It is never too late until it is.

Risks and challenges

The risk and challenges that come with completing this project are not getting the funds to produce the album in a professional manner. With your pledges, I am confident we will support this project fully funded

Physical copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 
World's Finest guitar pick 
World's Finest Poster
A World's Finest t-shirt of your own
Credit on the Album
Executive Producer Credit
Digital Download Film of Daniel's Performance in Concert
 
In the spirit of transparency, here are the appromixmate breakdowns the World's Finest costs:
World’s Finest T-shirts $170.00 
Limited CD duplication and distribution $300
Graphic Design - $370
Mastering -$700
World’s Finest posters -$60
Custom World's Finest Guitar Picks - $50
Music License Fees - $117.24
 
$1767.2 + plus $185 (Fulfillment (Shipping and handling Cost)
 
$1952.2 - Funds raised so far $335.05 - $381.54 = 692.87
 
$1235.61 + 125 Indiegogo Fees 
 
I manage to reduce the cost from the original $2700 down to by not just raising what we've raised but reducing the actual cd production to a smaller amount  to get to the final number of $1358.61
 
By backing this project, it will give us the necessary funding to do four things:
1. For professional mastering. We are aiming high and will have this album mastered professionally for your listening pleasure 
2. For production. Once the album is complete, the funding you provide will allow us to bring the album into production and distribution. We have always made sure our albums are packaged beautifully & we want to maintain that standard. We will be fulfilling the orders of the t-shirts, posters and cd's
3. Professional graphic design. Because we are working with aged images we want those images to be restored and the graphics and text to be as professionally done as possible and your funding will help us get there.
4. Editing the concert video. Editing the aged footage will take some time and with your pledges, the editing will be done and distributed to you to enjoy watching over and over again
With your pledges, I am confident we will support this project fully funded 
World's Finest Live in New York album Track-lists
1. Etude No 17 
2. Adelita
3. Maria
4. Capricho Árabe
5. Valse Vénézuelienne
6. Valse Vénézuelienne (reprise)
7. Spanish Roman (Romance de Espana)
8. Killing Me Softly 
9. La Bohème
10. Ne Me Quitte Pas (Don't Leave Me)
11. Don't Cry for Me Argentina
12. Chason Latine
13. Sine
14. Nan Fon Bwa
15. M Pap Pale Man Pawôl
16. Belle Haîti
17. Ti Zandô
18. Kouzin
 
ONE LAST THING
I encourage everyone reading this to pursue your passion intentionally with purpose because if you don't no one else will. No one is promised tomorrow so why not pursue your passion with the natural gifts that you've been given right NOW.
To paraphrase a conversation I recently had with someone. We are killing ourselves softly with each moment that passes when we don't at least attempt to express and share our talents with each other. But letting your light shine you unknowingly inspire others to shine their lights as well. It is never too late until it is.
Risks and challenges
The risk and challenges that come with completing this project are not getting the funds to produce the album in a professional manner. With your pledges, I am confident we will support this project fully funded

story:
Short Summary

Kellimarie comes from a musical background, I myself am a singer, her brother, her auntie and her grandad.  Kellimarie has a quite confidence about her, her music is so above her years. Iv'e never known such a hard working, motivated,  dedicated young girl such as her. Kellimarie started learning to play the guitar at 7, with tuition from a fantastic musican; Neil Wardleworth .

The ep, that we will be recording; would be a 4 track produced ep. The ep will be fully produced with drums, guitars,bass and keys ect . We are very lucky to have some of the best musicians in the country, wanting to be part of this project. The tracks will be.

Better on my own (written by Kellimarie)

Your not mine (written by Kellimarie)

Under the same stars (written by Kellimarie) 

You without me (written by Kellimarie)

The producer that we have on board for this project is an amazing producer, Mathew Cotterill. All the recording will take place at the, Strawhouse studios in Newbold Avon, rugby.

I have already got a very strong distribution and marketing team in Place.

This project would  be a fantastic learning curve for Kellimarie, from putting pen to paper writing the lyrics and the music. Working with other musicians, recording, publishing, promoting, all of which will help her with her continued growth and success. 

You would be contributing to making a fantastic ep, written by a very talented young girl, with a very bright future. Time is of the essence with the up coming TV series, a spring board we dont want to miss.

We need to raise £2000 which will be used to produce the ep. Studio hire, musicians and producer. I already have the money for a live video and for an extensive promotional campaign, and tour.

If we were to raise more than the suggested target. we would use the money to have a produced video taken instead of a live one.

If we don't raise our goal the ep will still be made, however on a smaller scale and the promotional campaign will be stripped back as well to free up funds, needed for the production.

We are not expecting anything for nothing. There are some great perks from signed cds, pictures, posters, banners, hand wriiten lyrics, apperances, even naming the ep. You can even get your name on the ep as an official sponsor.

I am aware some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help

please get the word out about Kellimarie and the campaign.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi everyone!
I'm Oscar Feldman, an Argentinean saxophonist and composer based in New York City. I came to the US to study jazz at Berklee College Of  Music.
I always liked to play music the same way I like to listen to music: from Bach to Charlie Parker, from the Beatles to Jobim, from Piazzolla to Burt Bacharach…
Each style gives me the opportunity to “sing” melodies and enjoy the most beautiful game for me that is improvisation. 
Since moving to New York I have had the great privilege to record and perform with legendary artists Paquito D'Rivera, Eumir Deodato, Al Di Meola, Dave Samuels /The Caribbean Jazz Project, Dizzy Gillespie’s United Nations Orchestra, Bebo Valdes, all of whom helped me nurture my vision of music. 
I have released two albums, “El Angel” and “Oscar E Familia,” collaborating with  Grammy award-winning musicians Gato Barbieri, Paquito D‘Rivera, Alex Acuna, Claudio Roditti, Mark Turner and many others.
Most recently I have recorded material for what is going to be my third album 'GOL' with some of the hottest musicians on the jazz scene today: drummer Antonio Sanchez, bassist John Benitez, pianist and keyboardist Leo Genovese and composer Guillermo Klein.
And I am hoping to have you onboard to help me give birth to this CD!


About the CD 'GOL'
This is probably my most adventurous recording.
GOL represents emotion, interaction and teamwork. All elements necessary to score a goal, not only in soccer but also in life.
Everyone on board was eager to embark on such a journey, where we were ready to leave our comfort zone, being free from interpretive and stylistical boundaries, “without the net” … Our rendering, our sound turned more poetic and dreamy and quite personal.
The songs we chose to play are standards and originals, that even though are traditional in form, gave us the opportunity to stretch boundaries and surprise ourselves…
From the traditional Cuban bolero from the 1930’s “Murmullo” to a modern modal composition of mine “Viva Belgrano de Cordoba” dedicated to my favorite soccer team. From an exquisite swing tune by Duke Pearson “Is That So” to a pop song by Beck “Nobody’s Fault But My Own“, of which we made a video during the recording session.

“Nobody’s Fault But My Own“

 
 

About the musicians
I would like to speak briefly about each of the musicians who played in the album, starting with four time Grammy Award-winner and Golden Globe nominee drummer Antonio Sanchez, who played and recorded with the likes of the Pat Metheny Group and Chick Corea. Antonio composed and played the groundbreaking original drum score for “Birdman”, the 2015 Oscar winner for Best Picture.
John Benitez, one of the hottest bass players on the jazz scene. who has played with great artists such as Eddie Palmieri and Chick Corea.
A great pianist and emerging young keyboardist Leo Genovese, who has performed with Esperanza Spalding and Wayne Shorter.
Another fellow country man who played on the album is Guillermo Klein, a great composer who contributed with two of his songs and vocals on “La Cancion Que Falta”.

From left to right: Antonio Sanchez, John Benitez, recording engineer Luis Bacque, Leo Genovese, Oscar Feldman
 

 

Why I need You
For a musician, releasing a CD is somehow bringing to the world a little piece of eternity… I am reaching out to you in the hope of your support in doing so. 
There are so many expenses involved in producing an album of this scale. At this point I am halfway through the process. 
Only with your generous help will I be able to complete the project and make it come to life.
So far I was able to cover the following expenses: 
Studio recording
Musicians fees
Transportation and lodging
Video song production
Mixing and mastering
 
Your financial support will cover the following crucial expenses: 
CD Manufacturing 
Art work
Liner notes
Distribution
Promotional expenses 
 
As you can see there are many reward-categories to choose from. But I want you to know that every contribution will get me closer to my goal.
Thank you for your help and support!
Let’s score this GOL together!

 


Ahora en Español..

Hola a todos!
Mi nombre es Oscar Feldman. Soy un saxofonista y compositor argentino radicado en Nueva York, egresado de Berklee College Of  Music.
Siempre me gustó tocar música de la misma manera me gusta escucharla como oyente: desde Bach a Charlie Parker, de los Beatles a Jobim, de Piazzolla a Burt Bacharach...
Cada estilo me da la oportunidad de "cantar" melodías y disfrutar del juego más maravilloso para mí, que es la improvisación.
Desde que me mudé a la ciudad de New York tuve el gran privilegio de grabar y tocar junto a artistas legendarios como Paquito D'Rivera, Eumir Deodato, Al Di Meola, Dave Samuels /The Caribbean Jazz Project, Dizzy Gillespie’s United Nations Orchestra, Bebo Valdes. Todos ellos ayudaron a desarrollar y nutrir mi música.
He grabado dos álbumes como solista, "El Angel" y "Oscar E Familia, con artistas invitados, ganadores del premio Grammy como Gato Barbieri, Paquito D‘Rivera, Alex Acuna, Claudio Roditti, Mark Turner y muchos otros.

Recientemente grabé el material para mi tercer CD titulado 'Gol', junto a algunos de los músicos más destacados en la escena del jazz actual neoyorquino: el baterista Antonio Sánchez, el bajista John Benítez, el pianista y tecladista Leo Genovese  y el compositor y pianista Guillermo Klein.
Espero contar con el apoyo de ustedes para dar nacimiento a este CD!


Acerca del CD 'GOL'
Este es probablemente mi proyecto mas aventurado.
GOL representa emoción, interacción y trabajo de equipo.
Todos éstos, condimentos que se sabe son necesarios para convertir un gol, no solo en el fútbol sino tambien en la vida.
Todos los músicos que participaron en GOL se aventuraron a salir de la zona de confort, sin restricciones interpretativas y estilísticas, actuando como grandes trapecistas pero "sin la red" ... Es por eso que nuestro sonido se volvió más poético, onírico y mas personal.
Los temas que elegimos grabar son standards y temas originales, tradicionales en forma y estilo. Pero nosotros elegimos llevarlos hacia algo mas revelatorio, a veces sorprendiéndonos a nosotros mismos.
Desde el tradicional bolero cubano de los años 30 "Murmullo", a una composición mía mas moderna y modal como "Viva Belgrano de Córdoba", dedicada a mi equipo de fútbol favorito. Desde una exquisita melodía de swing compuesta por Duke Pearson "Is That So" a una canción pop de Beck "Nobody's Fault But My Own", de la que hicimos un video durante la sesión de grabación.


Acerca de los músicos
Quisiera contarles brevemente acerca de cada uno de los músicos que grabó en el álbum, comenzando con el baterista Antonio Sánchez, -ganador del Premio Grammy en cuatro oportunidades y nominado para el Golden Globe-, quien tocó y grabó con artistas de la talla de Pat Metheny Group y Chick Corea.
Antonio compuso y tocó la bateria en la innovadora banda original de sonido de la pelicula "Birdman", ganadora del premio Oscar a la “Mejor pelicula“ en el 2015.
John Benítez, uno de los mejores bajistas de la escena del jazz, quien ha tocado con grandes artistas como Eddie Palmieri y Chick Corea.
El gran pianista y joven tecladista Leo Genovese, quien haya colaborado junto a Esperanza Spalding y Wayne Shorter.
Otro de los músicos argentinos que grabó en GOL es Guillermo Klein, un destacado compositor que contribuyó con dos de sus temas y cantando en "La Canción Que Falta".

De izquierda a derecha; Antonio Sanchez, John Benitez, Luis Bacque (ingeniero de sonido), Leo Genovese, Oscar Feldman


Tu ayuda es importante!
Para un músico, grabar y editar un CD es de alguna manera traer al mundo un pedacito de eternidad...Y por medio de esta campaña los estoy convocando para que me ayuden en esa tarea.
La producción de un CD de esta magnitud genera grandes gastos. Me encuentro ahora  en la mitad de este proceso. Sólo gracias a la valiosa contribución de ustedes, podré editar este CD.
Hasta el momento he podido cubrir los siguientes gastos:
Estudio de grabación
Cachet de los músicos
Gastos de transporte y alojamiento
Producción de Video
Mezcla y Masterización

La contribución de ustedes cubrirá los siguientes gastos, indispensables para la edición del CD:
Fabricación del CD
Arte de tapa
Comentarios
Distribución
Gastos de promoción

Quiero que sepan que cada ayuda,- pequeña o grande-, hará que esté cada vez más cerca de la meta. ¡Gracias por su importante apoyo!
Y los invito a convertir este GOL juntos!

story:
I'm trying to raise $4,000 for the release of my debut EP. 

Hello family and friends! I'm recording an album in Los Angeles the weekend of the 19th of February. I'm aiming to raise $4,000 for the release of a 3-5 song EP. The number of songs will depend on how much money I'm able to raise. Your support means the world to me. If you're donating because you're a fan of my music or if you simply believe in me and what I'm doing, thank you. 

*the $4,000 goal amount doesn't include the cost to produce the perks offered for donating.

If you're donating because you're a fan of my music or if you simply believe in me and what I'm doing, thank you.

story:
The Old School Project is the first traditional coffeehouse in Greece with its own Internet radio station. Unique and innovative special feature is the combination of the cafe and station, as well as radio broadcasting through the space of the cafe, giving the opportunity to the participants to monitor them live, thanks to a specially designed studio.

 

 

Purpose of The Old School Project is the entertainment of the listeners and frequenters with musical selections, the theme of emissions and to publish interesting articles on the site columns. Parallel action of The Old School Project is the organization of events with cultural, artistic and charity or cooperation with enterprises and organizations.

In the context of events The Old School Project successfully organized two all day Slingshot Festivals in Panorama Thessaloniki on 21.09.2014 and 05.09.2015. Some of the participants in these activities was the workshop percussion Kroustofono, Sprint Graphics with accessories for motor sports, PXP with eight meters climbing wall, Gamecraft with role playing board games, Bliss band, Phonographic, Jumberingas, Beerocracy and others.

Major Sponsor of the events was the soft drinks company EPSA.

 

Finally, The Old School Project recently released a unique handmade accessories  series called H.I.T  (Handy Ingenious Tools).

 

Τhis campaign is raising funds for upgrading equipment, to built a better studio and a suitable environment for the guests of the web-radio.

 

And what exactly "Upgrading Studio" means in plain words? 

Let me present you my shopping list and from where the "Wind of Change" must pass. Due to non-professional equipment, there is distortion of sound and bad noise so we cannot satisfy our customers at full capacity.

First of all you must have the right gear for your tasks so that's why I will be needing  these:

1)  Console to establish a better connection between main speakers of the coffeehouse, the microphones, the headphones and the server that radio broadcasts. Till now this is my biggest problem.

2) Professional microphones and headphones so we can broadcast equally good inside the coffeehouse and on the internet. Also with the right equipment we could satisfactorily accommodate artists, bands and others for interviews and presentations.

3) Build the studio to be a real studio. As you will see at the video,  the place I named "studio" it's a part of the coffeehouse I made myself with materials I had or found since the moment I took the decision to make The Old School Project true. So to build the studio I will need the right materials such as wood, plasterboard etc.

4) Make it soundproof! No need to explain that I think .... I must isolate the sound coming from the coffeehouse to the studio, preventing echo and miking.

'nough said for the gear, although I had a few more to say!

Let's talk about the environment

The place where the studio is, has enough free space and I am willing to do what we call lounge. A comfortable place that my guests will wait for the time to present their work on air, enjoying the best coffee.

Let's see what I will need for the proper environment.

1) The right guy or lady to design it.

2)  Materials and hardware to build it.

3) The things everyone want in their living room. Sofa, chairs, lights etc.

4) Safety first. Secure the equipment. Therefore a part of your contributions will buy a few cameras and an alarm.

5) For all above I will need extra hands so as you can understand I will need workers fit for the job. Construction, paint, cleaning etc.

    The Impact

    So we come to the point to answer the big question....

    - Why I must make a contribution to The Old School Project?

    Because The Old School Project:

    1) Gives the opportunity to new producers to broadcast live their shows

    2) Gives the opportunity to djs to promote their sets.

    3) Most importand is that The Old School Project co-operates with new bands and artist who want to promote their work, organize gigs and all day festivals.

    Some of these bands are Emmavera, Screaming dead Balloons, Birthday Kicks.

    So if you are a band, a solo artist or a producer, or if you know anyone who might be interested, don't hasitate to contact at info@theoldschoolproject.com

    And that's why you must make a contribution.

      The Other Way You Can Help

      Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      You can simply 

      • use the SHARE button and let your friends know about this campaign. Don't forget to encourage them to do the same to their friends. Teamwork always brings good results.
      • Let the word out and make some noise about this campaign by listening our web radio.

      Thank you for your time

      Nick
story_txt:
The Old School Project is the first traditional coffeehouse in Greece with its own Internet radio station. Unique and innovative special feature is the combination of the cafe and station, as well as radio broadcasting through the space of the cafe, giving the opportunity to the participants to monitor them live, thanks to a specially designed studio.
 
 Purpose of The Old School Project is the entertainment of the listeners and frequenters with musical selections, the theme of emissions and to publish interesting articles on the site columns. Parallel action of The Old School Project is the organization of events with cultural, artistic and charity or cooperation with enterprises and organizations.
In the context of events The Old School Project successfully organized two all day Slingshot Festivals in Panorama Thessaloniki on 21.09.2014 and 05.09.2015. Some of the participants in these activities was the workshop percussion Kroustofono, Sprint Graphics with accessories for motor sports, PXP with eight meters climbing wall, Gamecraft with role playing board games, Bliss band, Phonographic, Jumberingas, Beerocracy and others.
Major Sponsor of the events was the soft drinks company EPSA.
 
Finally, The Old School Project recently released a unique handmade accessories  series called H.I.T  (Handy Ingenious Tools).
 Τhis campaign is raising funds for upgrading equipment, to built a better studio and a suitable environment for the guests of the web-radio. 
And what exactly "Upgrading Studio" means in plain words? 

Let me present you my shopping list and from where the "Wind of Change" must pass. Due to non-professional equipment, there is distortion of sound and bad noise so we cannot satisfy our customers at full capacity.
First of all you must have the right gear for your tasks so that's why I will be needing  these:
1)  Console to establish a better connection between main speakers of the coffeehouse, the microphones, the headphones and the server that radio broadcasts. Till now this is my biggest problem.
2) Professional microphones and headphones so we can broadcast equally good inside the coffeehouse and on the internet. Also with the right equipment we could satisfactorily accommodate artists, bands and others for interviews and presentations.
3) Build the studio to be a real studio. As you will see at the video,  the place I named "studio" it's a part of the coffeehouse I made myself with materials I had or found since the moment I took the decision to make The Old School Project true. So to build the studio I will need the right materials such as wood, plasterboard etc.
4) Make it soundproof! No need to explain that I think .... I must isolate the sound coming from the coffeehouse to the studio, preventing echo and miking.
'nough said for the gear, although I had a few more to say!
Let's talk about the environment
The place where the studio is, has enough free space and I am willing to do what we call lounge. A comfortable place that my guests will wait for the time to present their work on air, enjoying the best coffee.
Let's see what I will need for the proper environment.
1) The right guy or lady to design it.
2)  Materials and hardware to build it.
3) The things everyone want in their living room. Sofa, chairs, lights etc.
4) Safety first. Secure the equipment. Therefore a part of your contributions will buy a few cameras and an alarm.
5) For all above I will need extra hands so as you can understand I will need workers fit for the job. Construction, paint, cleaning etc.


The Impact
So we come to the point to answer the big question....
- Why I must make a contribution to The Old School Project?
Because The Old School Project:
1) Gives the opportunity to new producers to broadcast live their shows
2) Gives the opportunity to djs to promote their sets.
3) Most importand is that The Old School Project co-operates with new bands and artist who want to promote their work, organize gigs and all day festivals.
Some of these bands are Emmavera, Screaming dead Balloons, Birthday Kicks.
So if you are a band, a solo artist or a producer, or if you know anyone who might be interested, don't hasitate to contact at info@theoldschoolproject.com
And that's why you must make a contribution.

The Other Way You Can Help
Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
You can simply 

use the SHARE button and let your friends know about this campaign. Don't forget to encourage them to do the same to their friends. Teamwork always brings good results.
Let the word out and make some noise about this campaign by listening our web radio.

Thank you for your timeNick

story:
BRIEF REVIEW

My name isAngel Irizarry, and I am a Dominican Musician. In early 2015, seeking to fulfill my biggest dream, I applied to the prestigious college of music,Berklee and got average academic scholarship.  Few months later, I got some support from my country’s Ministry of Education and the Latin Grammy Foundation. Thanks to them, I completed the academic scholarship.

However, they still lackUS$20,000 since this scholarship does not cover maintenance and must be enrolled for the 2016 Summer (by May)because the grant expires and I cannot let it pass. So, because of this crucial reason, I decided to start a Pro-Fundraising Campaign with Indiegogo called “One Step for Angel!” All the proceeds will be used to cover the necessary expenses. Hopefully, we will achieve, at least, a year for studying.

I've waited my whole life for this unique opportunity, and with your help and support, this will be possible and will become a reality. Your contribution (big or small) will make a difference... and it will become a big step.


YOUR GIFT OF APPRECIATION:

I would like to show you my appreciation by offering guitar lessons! You can choose your class throught different ways (Skype, Google Video) You can send me a message specifying what exactly would you like to achieve and I will do my best to teach you!


INVESTMENT OF COLLECTED FOUNDS

The estimated goal is US $ 20,000.00 of which US $ 1,000.00 Indiegogo will retain for the service agreement page.

With the remaining funds, I can pay for my first year of maintenance, as well as, travelling costs, local transportation, buy computers and software that requires Berklee, books, health insurance and other added expenses.


THE IMPACT

The music is a tie that binds people to people, from my early days as a student and as a teacher, I could see how it transforms people, and ultimately, I would like that my music transcends borders. With your help you will be helping to spread this universal language and transforming lives through music.

I am very grateful that Berklee has been fixed in my work, who has valued my talent and my compositions, it is a big commitment that I accept. I take great pride in my music and accept this great opportunity to demonstrate my roots and show the great artistic diversity of the Dominican culture.

I'm really anxious to see, with your help, the results of this career, to continue creating, composing, playing my music to feel the adrenaline that gives and the thrill of hearing the applause at each stage.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

After the first year, I shall be able to work and seek more opportunities to continue paying such expenses over the next years of the career. After all, at the end of this Indiegogo’s campaing first stage, they provide the option to continue raising funds through its associated page called InDemand.

Even if we cannot collect the necessary funds, I, at least, hope to be able to cover main registration costs, and after that, figure my way up by myself! 

You can help make a difference!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

You can also help me by sharing the link of my Indiegogo’s campaing "One Step For Angel". I’ll also be presenting concerts. Go to my site on these social networks, give me one "Like and Share" and use the #onstepforangel Hashtag throught Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. 

There is no small contribution, your help give me a big push in my career.


BAND INFORMATION

http://instagram.com/carijazzrd

https://twitter.com/CarijazzRD

https://www.facebook.com/carijazzrd123 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JSPgWyrlADM

WHERE YOU CAN FIND ME?

https://www.instagram.com/angel.irizarry/

https://www.facebook.com/angel.irizarryalmonte

angelirizalm@gmail.com


Annex Letter scholarship






_____________________________________________________________________________


Breve reseña

Mi nombre es Angel Irizarry, músico Dominicano.  En busca de cumplir uno de mis sueños, a principios del 2015 aplique a la prestigiosa universidad Berklee College Of Music y obtuve media beca académica. Unos meses después logre el apoyo del Ministerio de Educación de mi país y de la Fundación Latin Grammy. Gracias a ellos pude completar la beca académica.

Sin embargo, aún hacen faltan U$20,000, pues esta beca no me cubre manutención y debo inscribirme en verano del 2016 (mayo),  porque ese mismo año se vence la Beca y no puedo dejar pasar la fecha.  Debido a esto, decidí tomar la iniciativa de emprender una campaña pro recaudación de fondos con Indiegogo, "One Step For Angel"  Los fondos recaudados serán destinados a cubrir los gastos necesarios.  Espero recaudar lo suficiente  para lograr mantenerme al menos un año estudiando.

Esta oportunidad la he esperado toda mi vida, desde mis inicios como músico era todo lo que quería.  Con tu ayuda dejará de ser un sueño y se convertirá en una realidad.  Por grande o pequeña que consideres tu contribución, tu ayuda va a marcar la diferencia…y se convertirá en un gran paso. 

 

Gratificaciones

Acá a tu derecha tienes opciones para escoger clases personalizadas de guitarra que recibirás por tu colaboración!  Puedes elegir clases via online (Skype, Google Video), puedes escribirme y contarme que te gustaría lograr/aprender y haré lo posible para que lo puedas realizar!


Fondos Ganados

Para esta campaña necesitare un aproximado de US$20,000.00 de los cuales Indiegogo retiene US$1,000.00 por el  acuerdo del servicio de la página (quedándome un total de US$19,000.00).

 Con los fondos obtenidos en esta campaña podré pagar por mi primer año de manutención. Y también cubrir los gastos de transporte aéreo, transporte local, comprar la computadora y software que exige Berklee, libros, seguro médico y otros gastos añadidos.  


El impacto

La música es un lazo que une a la gente, a los pueblos, desde mis inicios como estudiante y como profesor, pude ver como ella transforma a la gente, y se que con mi música puedo lograr grandes retos, trascender fronteras.  Con tu ayuda estarás colaborando a difundir este lenguaje universal y transformando vidas a través de la música.

Estoy muy agradecido de que Berklee se haya fijado en mi trabajo, que hayan valorado mi talento y mis composiciones, es un gran compromiso que acepto. Deseo aprovechar esta gran oportunidad para tomar todo lo que me ofrece, usando mis raíces, pues mi país cuenta con una cultura musical muy variada. 

Estoy ansioso por ver resultados de esta carrera que haré paso a paso con tu ayuda, para seguir creando, componiendo, interpretando mi música para sentir la adrenalina que da la emoción de escuchar los aplausos del público y en cada escenario dar un Gran Paso gracias a ti.


Riesgos y desafíos

  Después de este primer año podré trabajar y buscar más oportunidades para seguir pagando dichos gastos durante los siguientes años de la carrera.  De todos modos, al finalizar esta primera etapa de la campaña  con Indiegogo, ellos proporcionan la opción de continuar recaudando fondos a través de su página asociada, InDemand.  

Aunque no logre recaudar todo el dinero, este de todas formas cubrirá los gastos generales, pues es una GRAN ayuda! Tu puedes ayudar a hacer una GRAN diferencia!

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Puedes colaborar compartiendo el link de mi campaña "One Step For Angel" de Indiegogo y de los conciertos que estaré presentando, entra a mis páginas en estas redes sociales, dale me "Me gusta y compartir" y usa el Hashtag #onstepforangel            a través de  Facebook, Tweeter e Instagram.

Un pequeño aporte tuyo me ayudara a dar un gran paso en mi carrera.


INFORMACION DE MI BANDA

http://instagram.com/carijazzrd

https://twitter.com/CarijazzRD

https://www.facebook.com/carijazzrd123

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JSPgWyrlADM


DONDE PUEDES ENCONTRARME?

https://www.instagram.com/angel.irizarry

https://www.facebook.com/angel.irizarryalmonte

angelirizalm@gmail.com


Cartas Anexas

story:
Ghosts from Two Towns Over

My name is Kevin Michael Thompson and I am in the finishing stages of recording my newest record-Ghosts from Two Towns Over. This is a record that I am really proud of. I’ve been working on some of these songs for over ten years and some of them were finished during the recording process.

 

How You Can Help

In the past,  I have always self-released and self-funded my records. This meant that I had a whole bunch of creative freedom but it also was extremely limiting as I could not bring in outside musicians, engineers and production help.

I want to be able to represent these songs in the best way that I can which means I need to have other ears on the project to help me mix, master and finalize the record. 

Your help also enables me to hire a graphic artist and photographer for the record cover.

I also want to be able to do the things that a good release should have such as videos, promotional materials, tee-shirts, stickers and all of that good stuff! 

And while having a digital record is important-I really need to create physical CDs and that is the bulk of the expense. The recording is almost done and I am almost ready to send the record to be mix, mastered and into production.

 

The Impact

I invited a bunch of great musicians to play on the record. Players from all over the country as well from Europe, Canada and even Israel. I’ve also been able to place a few of these songs on television and hope to do even more of that

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some folks can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please share this campaign in your social network. You can share easily with the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Danny Wright, I'm a singer songwriter from Reading in the UK, currently living in London. I've been writing songs since I picked up the guitar at 14 years old and have ever since loved music. My passion for writing and performing has grown over the years and has led to some amazing experiences from touring in bands, sharing the stage with my favourite bands and even performing at Wembley arena!!. Over the years I have always self funded my career while balancing jobs and bills, as an independent musician it at times can be very difficult and can leave you feeling jaded and down. A few times I have wanted to stop doing music all together. After a horrible yet eye opening incident last year I ended up in therapy sessions, my passion for music was cemented and I have written some of the best songs of my life.



This campaign will allow me to release these songs that are so important to me in their best format and will allow for a great music video that showcases the songs in their best light.



With your help I can continue what feels like the beginning of a magical, exciting, new chapter of my musical journey.
 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The funded will go towards a music video which will be shoot with an awesome production company who have worked with many of todays top UK artists. The funds will also go towards Marketing and PR, making sure the EP is in the right places and getting heard by the right people

Im really excited about these perks, I love writing, I love performing, I love creating and I love talking to you and getting to know you

 

All these perks will involve you in this journey, I document almost everything I am doing from recording to filming to writing. And with the power of live streaming you guys can watch this campaign grow with me.

If the target is not met the funds will go towards maintenance of music equipment, guitars, amps, recording set up and rehearsal sessions.

 

The Impact

My journey has been amazing so far and I am so grateful for the support and experiences, I really believe that if this target is met then it will take me to the next level and really help me bring these visions to life and create some amazing art    

Risks & Challenges

The music industry can be a costly and very risky challenge to make a sustainable career out of. (trust me, Im broke!) BUT I dont believe that should stop anyone chasing their dreams. There is strength and power in support!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute than a share, like, comment goes a long way and would mean a lot to me.

 

Thankyou so much for you time

Danny x

Im really excited about these perks, I love writing, I love performing, I love creating and I love talking to you and getting to know you
 
All these perks will involve you in this journey, I document almost everything I am doing from recording to filming to writing. And with the power of live streaming you guys can watch this campaign grow with me.
If the target is not met the funds will go towards maintenance of music equipment, guitars, amps, recording set up and rehearsal sessions.
 

The Impact
My journey has been amazing so far and I am so grateful for the support and experiences, I really believe that if this target is met then it will take me to the next level and really help me bring these visions to life and create some amazing art    

Risks & Challenges
The music industry can be a costly and very risky challenge to make a sustainable career out of. (trust me, Im broke!) BUT I dont believe that should stop anyone chasing their dreams. There is strength and power in support!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can not contribute than a share, like, comment goes a long way and would mean a lot to me.
 
Thankyou so much for you time
Danny x

story:
Bonjour, I am Benoit Viellefon, French Swing musician and singer based in London. I suspect that if you are reading this, you are already a member on my mailing list or a dedicated fan of the Orchestra or Hot Club. If not, please go to http://www.benoitandhisorchestra.com, you are definitely in for a treat.

First of all I would like to thank you for taking the time to read my campaign and hope that you will contribute to keeping that wonderful music alive. I need some help raising funds to release my next album:

BENOIT VIELLEFON HOT CLUB: “PARIS 1936 - LONDON 2016”

We are proud to announce that this CD has been completely self-produced, from the musician’s performance to recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, photos, and videos. But we still have to pay for the factory, pressing, PR, Marketing and licensing. The repertoire comprises of tunes from the 1920’s, 1930's, and 1940's, with some massive hits and some more obscure material, from Django Reinhardt to Kurt Weil, Nat King Cole to Fats Waller and some rarities to please the specialists as well.

- - Listen to a track from the albumin sound cloud: HCQ STRUT (exclusive to this campaign). - - 

 

The entire project cost approximately £ 10 000 (a lot to cough up on my own). Despite having done most of the production already (recording, videos & artwork), this process has come at a large cost. We are aiming to raise at least £ 4 000 to pay for the factory, copyrights licensing and PR/marketing. it would be a true miracle if we could get up to £10 000 and pay all the bills, but miracles so rarely happen, or do they?

I have been performing at least 1 200 concerts over the last 8 years with my two bands: The Orchestra and The Hot Club. In that time the Orchestra has release two albums and the Hot club none since I promised myself that I would never record an album again without a record deal. But year after year my fans kept on attending my live shows, asking for a CD. We were very apprehensive since people simply don't buy CDs anymore and the music industry has very little interest in music, but THEY WON! We had to accommodate these lovely people, and we are now proud to present to you with the first official release of Benoit Viellefon Hot Club, a Hot Jazz & Gypsy Swing album packed with the sounds of the small bands of the 1930’s and 1940’s.

Here is the ne album! We have tried to replicate that raw energy of the live shows in the studio. Without alcohol and women, it was bound to be a real challenge but somehow it happened. Only traditional recording techniques were used, with all the musicians recording live in the same room through a couple of Neuman condenser microphones. We recorded a total 22 songs over 3 days, with most of the band’s regular musicians, so it reflects the ever flexible line up, with sometimes piano or guitar, and violin or trumpet plus inevitably double bass, and myself on guitar and vocals. There are also couple of guest singers too, you will be surprised!

I had to wait one year to finish the production due to lack of funds and time. It was a very difficult birth but the baby is cute and we think that this recording is what people have been waiting for: happy uplifting elegant music with a touch of nostalgia and that French je ne sais quoi. We just hope now that people will not want another one straightaway…

The Crowd-funding should allow the next step: to pay for the factory pressing, send it to the press and the music industry, and spend a few months contacting people to promote the album.

If you like it, or you have enough of the garbage played on radio and TV, support us, support musicians that can play in instrument and are dedicated to keeping good music alive.  You'll do great and we'll be forever thankful.

This recording was made for you! Please get one or spread the word or ideally both (and we'll love and appreciate you for that!).

Merci Beaucoup.

Benoit

 

PS, there is a little more info below...

--------------------------------------------------------------

THE PEOPLE:
Nick Taylor – Sound engineer / producer
Benoit Viellefon – Guitar & Vocals / producer
Harry Diplock – Lead guitar
Martin Wheatley – Lead Guitar
Louis Thomas – Doublebass
Eleazar Spreafico Ruiz – Doublebass
Andrew Oliver – Piano
Dave Shulman - Clarinet
Duncan Hemstock – Clarinet & Vocals
Thomas Denis – Trumpet
Dan Oates – Violin & Vocals
Gbrielle Ducomble - Vocals

--------------------------------------------------------------

THE NUMBERS:
Songs - 22 recorded, 17 on the CD
Musicians - 10 musicians
Recorded - 3 days in may 2016
Produced - May 2016 to April 2017
CD - limited edition 1000 copies
Digital distribution - none
Streaming - none

Recording costs - £3000
Musicians - £1500
Artwork - £800
Photos - £700
Video - £1500
Factory - £1000
Rights clearance - £500
PR / promotion -  £3000

--------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT YOU CAN DO:

There are many ways you can help, ideally fund is priority but support on the web and the word of mouth that keep things alive is also highly appreciated.

1 - Buy a CD or many, or some merchandise, from Indiegogo or my website.
https://www.musicglue.com/benoitviellefon/buy-music

2 - Join the mailing list
http://www.benoitandhisorchestra.com/uk/mailinglist.html

3 - Come to see some live shows
http://www.benoitandhisorchestra.com/uk/gigs-public.html

4 - Share this campaign on social medias
http://www.benoitandhisorchestra.com/uk/follow-us.html

story:
About me

I am a musician, composer and percussion tutor based in London with more than ten years of experience. I am specialised multi-percussionist; some of the percussions I am playing are the Drum kit, Darbuka, Daouli, Djembe, etc. I hold a BA (Hons) Music degree from Middlesex University of London and Certificates from Trinity College London with excellent grades. I work as a member of music bands as a percussionist, I accompany various dance companies and I am the exclusive composer and music consultant for imprint dancES Dance Company. My debut album was released in March 2015 under the name T.I.M.E. and in September of 2016 I released three EPs online (Trio., Sahara ) including the second release of T.I.M.E.

The Book Project

In 2015 I decided to collect all the information and knowledge I've gained along my journey in Darbuka playing.

My idea was to create a syllabus for those who want to learn to play this amazing instrument. The reason is that is very hard to find a book based on Darbuka. Alongside my teaching career I've met students who are fascinated by Darbuka, even though they are not coming from Middle East.

So, after one year of working on this project, I am happy to announce that I'm holding my final draft in my hands!

My book is written in English so that anyone around the world can read it as there is limited access to books about Darbuka worldwide. 'Darbuka in Middle East' is written in plain language and everyone can have access to it, whatever his age or gender is. By reading the book, the reader can easily learn how to play the Darbuka by himself or even if he knows the right way, he can improve his skills and broaden his knowledge. 

The publishing of this book is very important to me because in this way I can transfer my knowledge on the Darbuka to those who want to learn how to play this particular instrument and make them learn about Middle East music. 

What We Need & What You Get

However the publishing company cannot cover all the costs for publishing and marketing the book.

As I am a new author they ask me to share with them the costs of the book.

So to publish my book on a paperback of 2000 copies & E- book Edition I need to cover the amount of £1900.

The Production Programme and the Marketing Plan of the book publishing are available to anyone who wants to have a look and contribute. 

The publisher will deliver a copy of my book to the British Library and include it in the British National Bibliography. They will also deliver a copy of the book to the University Libraries at Oxford, Cambridge, Edinburgh, Aberystwyth and Dublin. 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE my campaign on your SOCIAL MEDIA to attract more people to see my campaign!

story:
The funds from this campaign will be used to pay for:

  • Professional remixing and remastering of each track
  • Vinyl record pressing
  • Gatefold cover printing
  • Indiegogo fees

The records will be manufactured in France by MPO, who have a reputation for pressing the world’s best sounding and most collectable vinyl records.

Thanks to our cousins Alberto and Rafael for their help designing the covers.

Here's how it will look:

Andreas loved collecting vinyl records and hearing his music through a record player would have made him smile. We believe it is a fitting tribute to Andreas' music, and a lasting memento for his fans, family and friends.

To pre-order your copy, please claim a 12" Vinyl Record PERK.  Don't click on "Back It".

If you live in Melbourne and would rather pick up the record from Strathmore, please let us know when ordering. Your shipping charge will be refunded as "local pick-up" wasn't an available option for us to choose.

 

Thank you

 

https://www.facebook.com/andreasflorezmusic/

 

https://youtu.be/FJZE0k7kWmI
