story:
My Beautiful Friends,

                                                     I'm Sioux Robbins, a singer songwriter and piano player. I grew up listening to so many styles of music and it all just stayed in my ears. The first song I taught myself on piano when I was about 5 years old was the intro to My Girl, it runs straight across the black keys, and it was all uphill from there. My mother put me and my older sister, who was also musical, in the Performing Arts School of the Philadelphia Dance Academy where I met Mrs. Mary Hardy. She was a piano teacher and ethnomusicologist who also taught at Juliard. She would show me a few tricks, help me work through an obstacle and then back out of the way. I was so headstrong about what I wanted to play. It was there where I wrote my first serious composition at age twelve, and it was also there where I first studied classical voice and learned about the great jazz vocalists. As an adult I went on to perform in clubs and lounges singing jazz standards for a while. But I reached a point where I just wanted play my originals. My influences range from Debussey to B.B. King via Miles Davis. From Nina Simone to Joni Mitchell. With the Beatles, Paul Simon, Antonio Carlos Jobim, and Lionel Ritchie thrown in for good measure. As a young woman I hung out with Gil Scott-Heron on numerous occasions and often played my songs for him. He taught me some very important things about lyric writing that I've kept as my foundation when I approach writing a song. These days I'm studying with renowned vocal coach Owen Brown Jr. who has coached Mary J. Blige, Jill Scott, Wyclef Jean, Teddy Pendergrass, and numerous other successful recording artists and stage performers.

                                                        Call me a late bloomer. Getting this album made has been a long time coming. The late, wonderful Wayne Dyer said: "Don't die with your music still in you." I know for a fact he was talking directly to me. And this project is just the beginning of me not dying with my music still in me. Here's the link to listen to the demo tracks of half the album.

https://siouxrobbins.com/home

I'm asking for $11,000

Now remember, I'm on the piano and synth and Derek is on the guitar so we only need to pay for Bass and Drums and Studio. We're not paying ourselves on this one. We haven't quit our day gigs yet.

150 hours Studio time including mixing, overdubs, mastering etc. + $7500.00

Bass and Drums - $1500.00 per player                                                      +$3000.00

Petty cash, cushion for incidentals and cost overruns                             +$500.00      

Perks for Contributors:

$10-$75 - free download of the album when finished

$76-$249 - free download of Album when finished and Relax Girl T-shirt 

$250-$499 - Free download of Album when finished, Relax Girl T-shirt and 1hr Live stream of our recording session At The Barn Studio in Newtown Square PA. Date and Time TBD.

$500+ All of the Above plus a VIP Pre-Release performance, Place Date and Time TBD.

(if you're out of the Philadelphia area you'll get the show live streamed)

If we don't make the goal...

This album will still get made it will just take a bit longer. This project is going to happen either way. But I'm really hoping for your support.

If you can't contribute money I fully understand. We all have our responsibilities and priorities.

What you can do to help is share with your friends!

You can share the link from this page.

You can share clips of the songs and the link from the website:

And you can talk about it on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

And I will love you for it.

Now remember, I'm on the piano and synth and Derek is on the guitar so we only need to pay for Bass and Drums and Studio. We're not paying ourselves on this one. We haven't quit our day gigs yet.
150 hours Studio time including mixing, overdubs, mastering etc. + $7500.00
Bass and Drums - $1500.00 per player                                                      +$3000.00
Petty cash, cushion for incidentals and cost overruns                             +$500.00      
Perks for Contributors:
$10-$75 - free download of the album when finished
$76-$249 - free download of Album when finished and Relax Girl T-shirt 
$250-$499 - Free download of Album when finished, Relax Girl T-shirt and 1hr Live stream of our recording session At The Barn Studio in Newtown Square PA. Date and Time TBD. 
$500+ All of the Above plus a VIP Pre-Release performance, Place Date and Time TBD.
(if you're out of the Philadelphia area you'll get the show live streamed)

If we don't make the goal...
This album will still get made it will just take a bit longer. This project is going to happen either way. But I'm really hoping for your support.
If you can't contribute money I fully understand. We all have our responsibilities and priorities.
What you can do to help is share with your friends!
You can share the link from this page.
You can share clips of the songs and the link from the website:
And you can talk about it on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
And I will love you for it.

story:
Who is Lew Sid?

From the 757, the soul of Virginia, I am a super creative Hip-Hop artist/songwriter. Born on my parents last hope after failing twice, I believe my life's purpose is to deliver my story through music. This past year I've become so much more, a Father myself, life has tested me in many ways and I spill out all my experiences in my music. Saga One was released in the winter of 2016. 100% independent, we conquered so much with that project. I was blessed to have my singles "Whole Squad" and "How You Feelin' ?"featured on worldwide radio like Shade45, played at NBA games, countless clubs and gained so many listeners and supporters. My music saw amazing numbers on streaming sites like Spotify and Apple Music. I've performed some amazing shows and opened for artists like Rick Ross and T.I.. Music is my life and I work as hard as possible to keep my product building and still get chills at the chance to share it with the world.

Your contribution and support here will play a huge role in helping me to do it all again, but on a bigger scale, with more capabilities. These songs not only share my story, they inspire my listeners, paint different perspectives. So much of me is in this music, and to get this project to it's peak potential, I certainly need the help of not just supporters of Lew, but fans of the art of music as well!

What do you gain by supporting?

Everyone who supports this campaign will be given reward options depending on how much you chose to contribute. That ranges from invites to the private listening/release party, to merchandise, to exclusive complete packages! The decision on how much to contribute and what Perk you would like in return is completely your choice.

Not reaching my goals would hinder my process some, but all money gained will still be put towards the effort. I've learned so much on my quest and the financial side was so key that I know how important this is, and don't want to fall short of the capabilities I can reach that I know the art can attain. 

The Impact

Lacking the financial backing of a label, as a indie Artist, working a 9-5 with my first born daughter, getting the craft to its full ability and in the markets in needs to be in becomes expensive. This sometimes requires a call for help from supporters, believers, to aid in this process while at this level so the work reaches the pinnacle its capable of. As i've said, music is my life, this isn't a hobbie and I invest all I can and all of myself into it. My goal as an artist is to stay true to myself and those around me as we build, something rare in todays industry due to what most will do for money, or support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still show your support by SHARING THIS CAMPAIGN any and everywhere possible. Regardless of who it is, I urge your support anyone you like in the arts, hopefully this time or one day it will be me! It isn't easy being a creative and definitely isn't cheap. Spread love!

Lew

story:
ABOUT US!! \m/

 Hello there everyone,

We are Odds Against Tomorrow, a rock band from Akron, Ohio. We just finished up recording some songs in the studio and currently have TWO songs out for the world to hear! CLICK ON THE GALLARY UP TOP TO LISTEN TO OUR TWO SINGLES WE HAVE OUT! Our main goal for this campaign is in NO WAY to gain or collect your money; the goal for this campaign is simply to get our merchandise and music to fans. Unfortunately after all the work and money put into recording, we currently do not have funds to make the CD's and make T-shirts. That is where you guys come in! This is the perfect way for our fans to buy our merchandise! All profits for this campaign will go INTO making CD's and SHIRTS! The best part is the more you help us, the more you get! 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this campaign is $1000 dollars! With this amount, we believe that we can get you everything you need and MORE . It will help support and help get our name, Odds Against Tomorrow, out in the music scene! Check out the perks packages to see all the goodies you can get! There are CD's, shirts, stickers, signed merchandise, used gear, and MORE. Remember like we said earlier, the more you help the more you get. If you want a CD, we have that; if you want a shirt, we have that! If you want BOTH, guess what?!?!?! WE HAVE THAT TOO!  Many perks to get you all the 'ODDS' gear you need.  

The Impact

With each contribution you make, it WILL NOT make us richer by any means; all it does is get us that much closer to making our fans happy, which is what we all care about! All we care about is getting our fans the merchandise that they kindly ask for at every show, and with this campaign we will make all our fans wishes come true.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please check us out, Odds Against Tomorrow, on Facebook.com, YouTube.com, and Reverbnation.com. Please share and spread the word about our campaign so they can join in on all the exciting things that is Odds Against Tomorrow.

story:
Dear friends, family, and fans,

The vision of turning our original songs into a recorded album is finally becoming a reality.

Its been almost exactly a year since HO∆X was formed from the hallways of Hofstra. This year has been a roller coaster trying balance out college life, working full-time jobs, and letting the music evolve naturally and organically. After months of perfecting and deliberating, we finally feel like we are at the point where timing, music, and our overall goals all align so that we can make this album happen. And that is where you all come in!

For months you have blessed us with feedback and genuine support and now we are asking for financial support. 

We are looking to raise $10,000 by February in order to fully fund our Debut Album! 

Being an indie band doesn’t only mean that we make music of a certain style, but instead also means that we hold all the financial burdens of being a band and making music. Of course this independence comes with creative freedom and the ability for us to make an album that is truly representative of us as individuals, and also as a band. We really care about the music we make, in honesty we live the music we make, and it just a sonic extension of our beings. Obviously there is a financial breakdown of what we need in order to record this album, but we believe you should really know what you are buying into: 

The Album

The band and this album is made to impact people. Our name HOAX means a lot to us as a band, because we realized that there is an ever increasing trend for people to deny themselves their own genuine personalities and adopt ones that they believe will make them look more favorable by societies standards. That is a HOAX! We hope that this album will help people understand they don’t need to find happiness or joy in anything other than themselves. Because our mission is impact we are pledging that 10% of our album sales will go to Shatterproof.org an organization that is dedicated to combating drug abuse.
 

Now lets get to the number stuff:

Financial Breakdown

We are hoping to raise $10,000. This will cover all the costs of the recording, production and distribution of our debut album.

The breakdown of these costs are as follows:

Recording & Mixing - $2,250 - This will cover the cost for us to rent recording space, buy studio time, and mix all the songs, skits, etc. before they get sent out to the Master house to get finalized.

Engineer Fees - $1,250 - for years we have been working with Thomas DiRocco, a super talented engineer/producer who has been helping us shape our sound through his technical know-how and suggestions. We take care of our own and want to make sure that Tommy is able to spend the great deal of time it is going to take to come on this journey with us musically. 

Mastering - $1,500 - In order for us to get the top quality sound all our songs need to be mastered. The deal we have worked out puts us at about $215 per song and for 7 songs that puts us at about $1,500.

Artwork and Legal Fees - $1,000 - We need to pay copyright fees, registration fees, and licensing fees to get our album on Streaming Services like iTunes and Spotify. On top of that we really want to create artwork for the album that is iconic, recognizable, and beautiful. We are currently brainstorming with a couple of local artists, and we want to make sure they are compensated for their creations.

Distribution - $3,000 - After the album is complete. We want it to be heard. Heard by as many people who we can possibly reach. That is where impact is made. Because of this we have allotted the greatest portion of our budget to marketing and distribution. We will be promoting heavily through social media and other various websites, as long as local and national ads to get the word out about our first debut album. Music, like the human soul, needs to be heard.

Indigogo fees - $1,000 - Fees associated with running this campaign

***

If you would like to listen to some raw recordings of some of our music as well as covers you are welcome to visit our SoundCloud page https://soundcloud.com/hoax_band and also check out our YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCObDMXUVb0Rk6Zwf-TznfWg for more videos and sounds.

***

How you can help us?

-  Pre-order my album now for however much you wish to contribute by selecting one of the perks listed to the right | or donate anything you can!

-  Share this campaign with friends and family by word of mouth as well as through social media.

We are hoping to have the album and the additional perks ready and delivered by early 2016.

We re deeply grateful for your generosity and any donations you are able to contribute. A sincere thank you comes from the core of our hearts.

Best As Always,

HO∆X

Mike | Frantz | Jacob | Kevin

story:
The Rockstar without The Record

¿Cuán lejos irías para alcanzar tus sueños?

¿Alguna vez te sentiste fuera de lugar?

¿Alguna vez sentiste que estabas viviendo una vida que no era la tuya?

¿Cuántas veces te llamaron soñador?


Mi madre cuenta que cuando mi hermano era tan solo un bebe y se acercaba a un enchufe, ella  a fin de protegerlo le decía “No”. Entonces, le golpeaba suavemente su mano y mi hermano se retiraba.


En mi caso, cuenta mi mamá que cuando yo me acercaba gateando al enchufe, ella también me  decía “No” en un tono fuerte y autoritario y me golpeaba suavemente la mano. Sin embargo, a diferencia de mi hermano, yo volvía una y otra vez hacia el enchufe desoyendo la orden de mi madre y soportando el golpe. Finalmente, mi madre me tomaba en sus brazos y me llevaba a otra habitación para alejarme del enchufe ya que yo no dejaba de intentarlo.


Algunas personas han dicho que nací sin instinto de conservación. Esta afirmación suele ser la preferida de las personas que tratan de entender como soy capaz de abandonarlo todo para ir detrás de mi sueño.



¿Cómo ha sido mi vida en los últimos años?


En esencia, he tratado de luchar por mis sueños:


Le envié mi disco al CEO de Warner Music Group - Edgar Bronfman Junior




Vendí todo lo que poseía, excepto mi guitarra y mi computador y me mude a Irlanda para intentar conseguir un record deal.


Estando en Irlanda le pedí trabajo a U2 para aprender todo sobre el negocio de la música


36 Days To Work For U2 - My Story


36 Days To Work For U2 - 1era. Parte





36 Days To Work For U2 - 2da. Parte




36 Days To Work For U2 - 3era. Parte





Sin embargo, a pesar de todo, NO LO LOGRÉ.


Volví a mi país, Uruguay, con mis sueños rotos y absolutamente quebrado tanto emocional como económicamente.


Me tomo 4 años recuperarme, y de hecho, siendo sincero aún trabajo en ello.


Muy probablemente muchas personas pensarían que después de todo lo que pase, ya tendría que haber aprendido mi lección, y ya en este punto, lo más probable es que hubiera aceptado mi realidad, abandonado mis sueños, y simplemente hecho lo que la mayoría hace: buscar un trabajo de 8 horas.


Pero resulta que nunca fui como la mayoría.


Seis años después de mi primer intento, volví a pedirle trabajo a U2; y  esta vez me dirigí a  Bono:


OneWishForChristmasBONO.com

Aún no he tenido respuesta.


Los que realmente me conocen a fondo, saben que jamás voy a parar hasta alcanzar mi sueño. Que jamás voy a desistir y que después de todo lo que he vivido, estoy más decido que nunca a grabar mi disco “Day 36”.


Es cierto…

Aun no soy conocido.

Aun no estoy en la radio.

Aun no toco en estadios.


Por lo cual he decidido comenzar con lo más importante con lo que cuenta un músico:


Con mi público.


Ustedes son mi primer público.

Ustedes son mis primeras raíces.

Ustedes son las primeras plumas.


Los necesito a USTEDES, mi público, para hacer cada vez más fuerte mi voz.


Hoy… ahora… en este mismo momento, ustedes pueden contribuir y ser parte de esta historia única en el mundo.


Hoy te pido a ti que me ayudes a grabar mi primer disco: Day 36. Te invito y te pido que seas parte de mi primer público.


¿Para qué necesito tu contribución?


Con tu contribución estarás apoyando la creación, grabación, filmación y publicación de mi Disco Day 36


Day 36 - Mi Disco


Day 36 es un disco, es una forma de vida y una forma de sentir.

Day 36 es una utopía y una realidad.

Day 36 es esa línea en el horizonte que nunca se alcanza pero que nos mantiene caminando.

Day 36 es mi disco, mi mujer, mis hijos mis amigos y mi música.

Day 36 es la última pieza de mi primer puzle.



Músicos:


Voz Principal: Federico Revello (Uruguay)

Piano: Kostas (Grecia)

Cello: BlackyBass (Singapur)


Estudio de Grabación: Stone Cave Studio Montevideo

Estudio de Edición y Mezcla: Stone Cave Studio Madrid


Lista de Canciones:


1 - Two Steps Behind - Def Leppard

2 - Song For Someone - U2

3 - Happines - Grant Lee Buffalo

4 - Afterglow - INXS

5 - Into Dust - Mazzy Star

6 - Promise - Ben Howard

7 - Everything - Lifehouse

8 - Day 36 - Federico Revello

9 - Bonus Track - Can You Hear Me BONO - Federico Revello




Costos:


Costos Disco Day 36


Costos Creación y Grabación


Composición Pianos: 330

Composición Cellos: 280

Percusión: 160

Grabación Voz Estudio: 225

Edición y Mezcla: 280


Licencia y Publicación:


Licencias mecánicas: 250

Publishing: 120


Arte del Disco:

Diseño Disco: 70


Producción:


20 Cds: 40

20 Dvds: 50

100 Posters: 60

20 Remeras: 85


Riesgos y Desafíos:


“No tienes que ser grande para empezar, pero debes empezar para ser GRANDE”.


El riesgo más grande sería no ser quien soy…

Vivir una vida que no es la mía…

¡Y eso no va a pasar!


Soy músico y emprendedor y estoy determinado a que mi disco DAY 36 este a la venta en Amazon para Mayo de 2016, y esto será posible si también puedo contar con tu ayuda.



Desde ya agradezco que me quieras ayudar y que creas en mi proyecto!

Contribuye ahora!

Day 36 es mi disco, mi mujer, mis hijos mis amigos y mi música.
Day 36 es la última pieza de mi primer puzle.
Músicos:
Voz Principal: Federico Revello (Uruguay)
Piano: Kostas (Grecia)
Cello: BlackyBass (Singapur)
Estudio de Grabación: Stone Cave Studio Montevideo
Estudio de Edición y Mezcla: Stone Cave Studio Madrid
Lista de Canciones:
1 - Two Steps Behind - Def Leppard
2 - Song For Someone - U2
3 - Happines - Grant Lee Buffalo
4 - Afterglow - INXS
5 - Into Dust - Mazzy Star
6 - Promise - Ben Howard
7 - Everything - Lifehouse
8 - Day 36 - Federico Revello
9 - Bonus Track - Can You Hear Me BONO - Federico Revello
Costos:
Costos Disco Day 36
Costos Creación y Grabación
Composición Pianos: 330
Composición Cellos: 280
Percusión: 160
Grabación Voz Estudio: 225
Edición y Mezcla: 280
Licencia y Publicación:
Licencias mecánicas: 250
Publishing: 120
Arte del Disco:
Diseño Disco: 70
Producción:
20 Cds: 40
20 Dvds: 50
100 Posters: 60
20 Remeras: 85
Riesgos y Desafíos:
“No tienes que ser grande para empezar, pero debes empezar para ser GRANDE”.
El riesgo más grande sería no ser quien soy…
Vivir una vida que no es la mía…
¡Y eso no va a pasar!
Soy músico y emprendedor y estoy determinado a que mi disco DAY 36 este a la venta en Amazon para Mayo de 2016, y esto será posible si también puedo contar con tu ayuda.
Desde ya agradezco que me quieras ayudar y que creas en mi proyecto!
Contribuye ahora!

story:
Short Summary

This has been an amazing journey from the Grammy’s, to the Stellars, to the Doves, to the foreverJONES reality TV show. We couldn’t have done it without you.So many new and life-changing songs have been birthed through this journey.That being said, it's time for us to record our next project. While we are excited about this new season, we also know it takes finances. We are inviting our close friends, fans and family because we need your help. Starting in November, we will be launching a campaign to allow you all to support and help finance this next album. Altogether, our goal is $80,000. We want you to know that every little bit counts including your prayers. We can’t wait to embark upon this journey with you!

What We Need & What You Get

Each gift is important to us. We want each person to know that whatever they are able to contribute is meaningful and greatly appreciated. Please check out our perks to see what we have to offer our partners. 

The Impact

It's been three and a half years since our last major album and our hope is that our music will inspire people around the world to fall in love with music and its Creator all over again.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please tell everyone you know about this campaign.
  • You can also share our link on your social media pages, by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

In consideration of helping Beauregard & the Down Right fund and properly promote a masterpiece sophomore record, here are a few key things:

  • Beauregard & the Down Right is a four-piece rock/reggae band fronted by songwriter Beauregard Higgins. Beauregard and the band have been working tirelessly for five years touring the United States. Beauregard and the Down Right's proverbial mission is to foster a musical brand that identifies with the current state of social climate while encouraging listeners to be compassionate, altruistic and empathetic human beings. Beauregard Higgins is an aspiring international songwriting who in the past year has performed and written music in Ireland, Scotland, England and in many other parts of the United Kingdom. 

  • For samples of previous work by the project please visit this link. https://www.reverbnation.com/beauregardmusic

  • download the new single from the record "The Truth" here http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/beauregardandthedownrigh

  • The purpose of this funding campaign is to empower Beauregard & the Down Right with the monetary means to release to the public, potential peers and current affiliates a radio worthy, expertly produced sophomore record. A quality record of this scope will globally enable Beauregard & the Downright to be placed in far-reaching independent and mainstream media, international festivals and industry standard, top-tier markets. The quality production of a sophomore record will be the next step for the band to excel to new heights in their endeavors.

  • Being a completely self-funded, grassroots, blue-collar band can be a tough position.  Being able to put out the best quality of music and promote an album where it will be seen and heard by the appropriate people is difficult if not impossible without resources to reach the next level. With contributions to this campaign from investors like you, Beauregard & the Down Right could present proposals and secure contracts for international tours, record deals, public relations campaigns, and finally break through to the next level of a professional artist career.


What We Need & What You Get

The Run Down:

  • The main goal of this funding venture is to bring to market a fully produced radio worthy sophomore record and begin a public relations campaign to promote it properly in the industry.

  • No contribution is too small, and the campaign has perks and incentive packages that work for any budget. $10 contributions will get a signed copy of the new album before it is available for commercial purchase. More generous contributions will be awarded  private event performances from the band in any private venue of your choosing including your home. The band even has perks where they will come out to  prepare a gourmet meal for you of your choosing (steak, lobster, vegan lobster...etc.) with masterful culinary skills!

  • In the event that the campaign does not reach the entire goal and does not secure the funds to begin a PR campaign, all contributed funds will still be used to finish the album and any perks ascertained by your contribution will still be honored regardless of the final amount.



The Impact

We feel this record could have a positive impact on music fans for generations to come and could align the project with key players in the industry to propel the band into an international market:

  • The band feels that these songs need to be heard around the world.  The quality of the band's new material has matured in lyrical content and heart grasping melodies. The music has already received a variety of professional exposure,  and the amounting fans around the world have expressed how touched they are by the message of the music.  We feel passionately about the impact this material could have on generations of music fans. It will inspire fans to show a simple kindness to one another and build a brighter future for the next to come.

  • Beauregard and the Down Right have never once solicited for help of this nature. The band has always been determined to do things independently since day one, building an extremely passionate and supportive fan base one town at a time by actually going out into the world and performing and sharing their ideas with people intimately.  The band has had rapid success in building a brand and being offered some amazing opportunities to support, on stage, some legendary international artists right out of the gate.

  • With that said, the time has come to really make these next steps as strategically as possible starting with the quality of every single musical release we put into the world. With the help of people like you on this funding campaign we believe we can really make a difference on this path we have chosen.


Risks & Challenges

There will always be risks and hurdles to overcome with an artistic project, but we are confident that the project is prepared to excel:

  • With any artistic endeavor there are obstacles to overcome. For example, finding the right company to work with to promote this album will be a challenge, as the band has no intentions of working with anyone that doesn’t wholeheartedly believe in the project, but we will find our team.

  • The album that we will produce, with your help, will be a gateway for introduction to major international artist agencies such as William Morris Endeavor Agency, Free Trade Agency (London), and Red Ryder Entertainment to name a few.  Being able to start a relationship with agencies like these, we could most definitely embark on international tours with the proper support and press coverage needed to flourish in the industry. Without these kinds of connections in the industry we will certainly still be building one brick at a time, and now is the moment to take some big steps towards the future.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We understand that not everyone will be in a position to contribute to this campaign, but there are other ways to help the band make it happen.  We ask that if you have read this far and are not able to donate that you help us get the word out by sharing the campaign link with your friends on social media, by word of mouth or any other way you can think of to help make a ripple in the world and get the attention of the right people that could or would be interested in donating to our campaign.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and help us make a buzz!

story:
Second Music Video Campaign

Short Summary

If you were impressed with the first video from my debut album, just wait until you see the second one.  If you are passionate about music, jazz, and the arts as much as I am this is a worthwhile campaign to contribute to.  As an independent artist there are many times where we have to reach out to the community to make our dreams come true as well as to continue provide you with a quality product. 

About Me

I am a lawyer turned entertainer, was born and raised outside of Chicago in Gary, Indiana. Although raised in the foster care system, I managed to escape the merry-go-round of foster homes that some children endure. As one of the lucky ones, I thrived in a loving family environment, surrounded by music, theater, and the arts.

I attended Indiana University in Bloomington where I began to develop my artistic abilities. Subsequently, I went on to earn a Juris Doctorate from the John Marshall Law School in Chicago and spent several years working for the Baltimore City States Attorney’s office where I prosecuted child abuse and domestic violence cases. Later, I joined the Law firm of Semmes Bowen & Semmes, before starting my own firm of Collins & Harris, and being called to the Ontario Bar.

As my passion for the arts grew, I put his legal career on hold, debuting in the Orpheus production of “Rent” in 2011 as a member of the ensemble and understudy for the role of Tom Collins. After moving to Tel Aviv, I burst into Israel’s English Language Theater as Seaweed J. Stubbs in “Hairspray,” followed by Audrey II in “Little Shop of Horrors,” and as Richie Walters in “A Chorus Line.”

In the spring of 2015 I appeared as Benjamin Coffin III in a concert version of Rent at the renowned Habima 4 stage in Tel Aviv, I reprised the role of Benny in Starcatcher’s production of “RENT” in Jerusalem. With your help I am sure to become a multi-faceted performer in the entertainment industry: theater, television, motion pictures, and music!!

What We Need & What You Get

Shooting a video can range in price, I am trying to produce a quality clip that will reach the masses on a very meek budget of $6,000.00.  The video is scheduled to shoot on January 9, 2016 in LA.  I had the great pleasure of meeting the very talented film marker Matthew Mishory while living in Tel Aviv and very blessed that he took a liking to my music project and offered to work with me on a music video.  But in order to get this done I need the help of all of you.  

As a unique perk I am offering the following:

  • donations $50.00 or over will receive an autographed copy of Somewhere Along The Way with extra download cards to give to family or friends
  • donations $500.00 or over will receive one of my famous Sweet Baby desserts (limited to the Ottawa and Gatineau area)

About the music

A modern-day crooner with a baritone register Antoine draws inspiration from many jazz, blues and soul greats: Nat King Cole, Frank Sinatra, Sam Cooke, Chet Baker, Joe Cocker, Tony Bennett, Ray Charles, Sammy Davis Jr., Count Basie, Bing Crosby, Louis Armstrong, Mel Tormé, Van Morrison, Michael Bublé, Harry Connick Jr., Steve Tyrell – the list goes on and on.
Many people don’t realize that the Jazz music genre originated in the African-American communities of the late 19th and early 20thcenturies. The genre ranges from ragtime to present day jazz stylings with its heavy use of improvisation, polyrhythms, syncopation, swing note, blue notes, brass, European harmony and American popular music, and continues to develop a sound and feel all of its own.
Antoine’s distinctive vocal style is perfectly complemented by a very talented group of musicians: double bassist Guy Levi, Saxophone player Kobi Salomon, drummer Roi Oliel and jazz pianist Asaf Finkelstein. The group’s tremendous creativity, interaction and collaboration really brings to life Antoine’s debut album “Somewhere Along The Way.” 
“Somewhere Along The Way has been a fascinating journey. Not only did I record my favourite jazz songs, but to have done so in such magical and spiritual places as Tel Aviv and Jerusalem was simply amazing!

I have listened to and loved many wonderful songs throughout my life. Yet, when I sat down with my music producer Asaf Finkelstein to choose songs for this project, I wanted to pick those which I felt most deeply connected to and truly passionate about. It has been incredible to see my dream come true. 

For me, jazz is more than just a musical genre. It’s also an intimate and articulate way of telling stories - stories of love, loss, hope and life, stories that everyone can relate to somewhere along the way. The songs I chose for my debut album are imbued with such intense emotion and spiritual feeling that I am certain that the stories they tell will also resonate deeply within each of you.I truly hope that you’ll love this album as much as I loved recording it for you!”

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, post on all your social media sites and tell your family and friends.
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it, thanks in advance and let's make a hell of a music video!!!!

story:
DIANA FERIA EP FUND

Hello,  I’m Diana Feria, and I'm happy to say that I finally got to a place in life/career in which I can work 120% in my music. I've been working professionally in many projects in the past, helping people make music and now It’s my time, and I owe this to the support of my followers, fans, friends and family. I have finally conceived the type of sound and music I have always ambition to make. That's why this campaign it's going to be the fuel to launch this musical rocket.

Until now, everything I’ve done for this EP has been made from ground up. All DIY, and in order to take my music to the next level, I'm asking you to help me raise the funds to complete this EP.


All money raise will be used exclusively for complete production of the album.

  • Studio Time
  • Studio Engineers
  • Musicians
  • Mixing and Mastering Engineers
  • Album Artworks
  • CD Manufacturing and distribution

if I’m able to raise more that what I need to cover the album expenses, I will invest the rest of the money in:

Music Videos

Promotions (flyers, launch party, merchandising)

Music Equipment.

FOR YOU DONATION OF COURSE YOU WILL BE GRANTED ACCESS TO MY MUSIC, INCLUDING MY NEW SINGLE .

FOR MORE OPTIONS IN PACKAGES PLEASE CHECK THE MENU ON THE RIGHT -->

Once again Thank you so much  for your support and I hope you get to enjoy the final product as much as I am enjoying the making of it.

                                    Website    Facebook   Youtube  Instagram  SoundCloud

ESPAÑOL

Hola! soy Diana Feria y me complace comunicar que por fin he llegado a un lugar en mi vida y mi carrera en el cual puedo trabajar en mi música y darle 120% de energía. En el pasado he trabajado y he ayudado en muchos proyectos en un ámbito profesional y ahora es mi momento. Todo esto se lo debo al apoyo que he recibido de mis seguidores, fans, amigos y familia. Finalmente he concretado el tipo de sonido y estilo musical que llevo buscando por mucho tiempo.

El propósito de esta campaña es alcanzar los fondos que cubran los gastos de este EP.  Hasta ahora todo lo he hecho por mi misma, pero para llevar mi música al siguiente nivel necesito ayuda para alcanzar mi meta.

Todo el dinero recaudado será utilizado exclusivamente para financiar la producción del EP. Estoy incluye:

  • Horas de estudio
  • Ingeniero de sonido
  • Musicos
  • Mezcla y masterización
  • Diseño del album
  • Manufactura y distribución del CD


Si logro recaudar mas de lo necesario para cubrir los gastos de producción, pienso invertir el resto del dinero en lo siguiente:

Videos musicales

Promoción (flyers, concierto de lanzamiento, creación y venta de productos, etc..)

Materiales de producción musical.

Por tu donación, vas a tener accesso a mi música, incluyendo mi nuevo sencillo.

Para más información y opciones de paquetes por favor mirar  la lista a la derecha de la página. -->

Una vez más gracias por tu apoyo, espero que puedas disfrutar dell producto final tanto o mas de lo que yo estoy disfrutando el proceso.

                                   Website   Facebook   Youtube Instagram SoundCloud

El propósito de esta campaña es alcanzar los fondos que cubran los gastos de este EP.  Hasta ahora todo lo he hecho por mi misma, pero para llevar mi música al siguiente nivel necesito ayuda para alcanzar mi meta.Todo el dinero recaudado será utilizado exclusivamente para financiar la producción del EP. Estoy incluye:

Horas de estudio


Ingeniero de sonido


Musicos


Mezcla y masterización


Diseño del album


Manufactura y distribución del CD

Si logro recaudar mas de lo necesario para cubrir los gastos de producción, pienso invertir el resto del dinero en lo siguiente:Videos musicalesPromoción (flyers, concierto de lanzamiento, creación y venta de productos, etc..)Materiales de producción musical.Por tu donación, vas a tener accesso a mi música, incluyendo mi nuevo sencillo.Para más información y opciones de paquetes por favor mirar  la lista a la derecha de la página. -->Una vez más gracias por tu apoyo, espero que puedas disfrutar dell producto final tanto o mas de lo que yo estoy disfrutando el proceso.                                   Website   Facebook   Youtube Instagram SoundCloud

story:
Soul On Ice (1996) is a hip hop classic.  Soul On Ice 2 promises to be just as dope! SOI 2 will provide the enitre story behind Ras Kass' first album including songs and tracks that did not make the original album.   Your contribution will help make hip hop history.


Soul On Ice 2 Project Summary

To celebrate the 20th anniversary (1996) of the critically acclaimed album Soul on Ice, Ras Kass is currently completing an ambitious Trilogy with two new releases planned in 2016. The prequel, Intellectual Property (IP) will be released June, 2016.

Intellectual Property (IP) is nearly completed (tracklist forthcoming soon) with features & production including KRS1, Bun B, Statik Selektah, Apollo Brown, OC, AFRO, Kurupt, Snow Goons, Killa Priest, Apathy, and others.


Soul On Ice 2 is slated for release in December 2016.  Partly consisting of previously unreleased vintage 1995 recordings and audio, rare remixes,  some remixes from legendary hip hop producers, and brand new tracks inspired by SOI;  already completed tracks include features & production from artists such as Diamond D, Immortal Technique, V. Bozeman, K-Rino, Apollo Brown, Alchemist, Vinnie Paz, Styles P, MOP, Faith Evans, and more. We are fundraising with the goal of adding other stellar artists such as:  DJ Premier,The Rza, Anderson Paak, Justice League, Mos Def, L’Orange, and Thundercat.

In addition to dropping two new albums, Ras Kass will shoot several videos. One video is planned for his new song, "White Power" featuring Immortal Technique.  He will also shoot a retro video for the hip hop classic "Nature of the Threat."

What We Need & What You Get

To put out this epic project, we need $35,000. This would cover the following costs:

  • Artist & Producer Feature fees
  • Mixing and Mastering 
  • Shoot 3 videos (including "Nature of the Threat" retro) 
  • Manufacturing 
  • Online Promotions
When you support this project, you get the satisfaction of knowing that you helped keep real hip hop alive! With a soul clap and thanks, we offer you:  digital downloads of Intellectual Property and Soul on Ice 2, Collector's Edition cd, possible vinyl, Ras Kass apparel (Soul On Ice shirt, socks, sneakers), Class of 96 hoodie, Demar Douglas poster, invite to listening party, and more!







If we are unable to reach our goal, we will scale down the scope of the project-some of the aforementioned artists may not be featured. However, we are confident that true hip hop heads and independent artist supporters will help this project manifest.

Spread the word!  FB, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, all that!

story:
!!Voor Nederlandse crowdfunding versie ga naar https://www.voordekunst.nl/projecten/4563-the-light-has-come-1 !!

Two years ago, I felt myself being pulled to my piano, where somehow a Course in Miracles was lying open on one of the workbook lessons. I started playing and singing and all of the sudden, within 30 minutes or so, I had a complete and beautiful song with lyrics all coming from that workbook lesson. I didn't quite know what happened, but the next day, the same thing happened, with a different workbook lesson. This continued for about two weeks, sometimes even twice a day, and before I knew it I had 16 songs, with lyrics all coming from a Course in Miracles. For a long time I didn't really do anything with the songs (except for performing them by lectures from Course teachers David Hoffmeister and Willem Glaudemans), but I really feel the inspiration now to record them and share them with the rest of the world. The songs are so incredibly powerful and I always feel so much love after singing them. 
I really feel that it is time to record and share this music, not only for course students and teachers, but for everybody who needs it. 
The CD will be called "The Light Has Come", similar to one of the songs that will be on de album as well. 

Help me realizing this project by donating anything you can!

Much Love,

Neda

story:
WHO ARE WE?

Can you imagine a project of Traditional Peruvian Music merged with Pop, Rock, and Indie?

Fusiorama is a project created by Lucho Benzaquen (producer) and Julio Zavala (composer). Our chief desire is to do everything in our power to make Peruvian music to be heard around the world.

That is why we need your support to achieve our goals; that is to say, shooting our first music video and the project’s official launching live.

WHAT DO WE NEED AND WHAT DO YOU GET IN RETURN?

We are fortunate in having very talented people who want to contribute in taking our music much further for it to be heard around the world. One of them is Alberto Fernández, leading AV producer, who has offered to direct the music video for free. Consequently, we only need to cover the production’s costs.

We need the money for two specific activities:

Music video:

- Rental facility for the music video’s shooting.

- Rental of cameras, lights, and generator.

- Transportation fees.

- Actors.

- Extras.

- Set design.

Album’s launching live:

- Equipment rental.

- Technical staff’s fees.

- Flyers and posters’ design and printing.

We offer you the band’s musical material including: virtual downloads, physical CD albums, t-shirts, transcriptions, live streaming, pictures, and the album’s artwork in exchange for your support.

ALTERNATIVE STRATEGIES

If we do not achieve our goal, we will use the funds raised to involve the media in the live concert so as to raise the lacking funds. If we succeed, we will be able to bring an important part of our Peruvian culture merged with other cultural features around the world. And it would be amazing to achieve this together.

If you cannot provide financial support, you can help us by spreading the word, which is just as valuable. Help us by spreading this message to the largest possible number of people you know!!!

story:
Hi, my name is Hero! 




Basics!


I love creating music. I've been singing for most of my life, and almost a year ago realized my intense passion for songwriting. I play several different instruments and my own kind of indie music, drawing influences from an eclectic set of musicians including Zee Avi, Regina Spektor, Joni Mitchell, and Norah Jones, among many others. 


That was long! Let's get to the point: 

POINT 1:

I'm working on releasing my first EP*, entitled Certain Contradiction. It is only original work, produced, written, and performed by yours truly! 

POINT 2: 

I received a partial merit scholarship** to Berklee Five-Week Performance Program in Boston.  It's an intensive summer music education, and I am so excited and lucky to be attending! 

IN CONCLUSION: 

I decided to use this platform to sell my music, and all the proceeds will go towards my contribution to attending Berklee!  



To contribute, head over to the Perks section. There, you'll find many different ways to get my music and support this campaign! 


If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact me. Go up to the top and hit Contact to send me a short message, or email heromagnus18@gmail.com for any longer questions! 


*EP means Extended Play. It is about the size of half of an album. 
**The scholarships are very difficult to get, so I was happy I did!

More Information


My Music

You can subscribe to my YouTube channel right here (lots of new videos coming soon!): https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRaidgjByV80fac58JkHTBg

Last summer I embarked on a project called Thirty Seconds or Less, where I created thirty-second snapshots of music to learn the basics of recording and filmmaking. You can check it out here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOzvB68kIowEUa9lfDYBROQ/videos 
Here's one of my favorite silly music videos from the series: 



Here is a link to my personal Facebook for any and all backers who wish to stay updated on my life and music: https://www.facebook.com/hero.magnus.7

And here is a link to my Instagram, for photographic evidence of these updates: https://www.instagram.com/thesuperhero_1/

Berklee College of Music

I won the Berklee scholarship with one of my own songs, called Pocket:
 


Another video I submitted was a cover of the song Ghost:



There were also other videos and essays involved in achieving the scholarship; if you're a backer and you want to see them, just let me know! Here is a link to the curriculum of the program: https://www.berklee.edu/five-week-summer-program/curriculum-0

(As noted above, my EP is in the process of production. If you donate, you won't receive your perks for a little while - but don't worry, they're on the way!)  

If you are a backer, thank you! Whether you are buying one single or an entire private concert, your support is so important to me. Also, please include your email when donating so I can contact you about when your perks are coming.

story:
Thank you for taking time to watch our video! 

We are raising funds for the cost of our new music project.  

We are Maka MaMas – Leraine & Shen – and we met three years ago at a Shaman’s reunion, where we both knew that the universe had definitely brought us together. It was cosmic and divine timing! Over the course of this event, we stepped into a deeper re-member-ing of our connection to ancient and sacred sounds and to that of the ceremony of life. It was a coming home for us and we got to chant, sing, drum, and dance with the cosmos. Our amazing musical journey together began, blessing us with invitations from beautiful communities to share and co-create our love of music to honor our sacred Earth Mother.

We believe music is a vehicle to promote well-being. We currently work with an organization called Heart and Soul that gives us the opportunity to go into facilities that would not normally get to experience our music. Our dream is to take it on the road to all communities, prisons, women's shelters etc… in hopes that we can inspire and help others on the journey of life; teaching others to find their voice and be empowered. 

When folks come to our Kirtan/Concerts they tell us that they feel inspired, vibrant and alive. The community energy uplifts hearts and a deep sense of well-being naturally arises. First timers say, "Wow! I never knew I could experience such fun and joy by singing in community. I feel and hear your spirits in your voices and it makes me feel free." What an amazing transformation! 

Remember to check out our perks section, as there are some awesome, one-of-a-kind items available for larger contributions!
Without a record label behind us, making this all manifest is a challenging undertaking in terms of time and money. Even to get the project to this point has required a great deal of time and generous contributions by many people in our lives who's talents and skills are of great value. All of the assistance we've gotten so far has and will come from reputable professionals. 
The amount we're asking for will cover (full breakdown listed below):
  • Recording, arranging, mixing, mastering, artwork, manufacturing, and distribution of the project CD
  • 2 professional videos and photography 
  • Basic PR and marketing, including a new website
  • Credit Card and Indiegogo's fees, and creating and posting your gifts.
  • Winter Tour 
Many of you have seen us grow as a duo and supported us along the journey. We are truly grateful, as we could not have done it without your love and support. We invite each one of you to be a part of this creation and dream. By simply pre-ordering our album and sharing this campaign with your friends and family (via FaceBook, email, or word of mouth), together we can manifest this collection of magical songs. 
Thank you for supporting us in the Co-Creation of our Maka MaMas music project. We love community and could not do what we do without you! 
Pilamaya Yelo!

With Love & Gratitude

Leraine & Shen

story:
A little about me

Hi everyone, I am Lyrix & I’m a singer song writer. Here’s a little bit about myself. I started singing when I was six years old. As a kid, I used music as a tool; it helped me focus and navigate my thoughts & feelings. I started writing songs when I was nine. I learned how to write by listening to artists I looked up to, I wasn't just a listener... they were my teachers.  I would take a song break down the lyrics, study the structure and this is how I learned how to write.
Music has gotten me through some of the hardest times in my life and helped me overcome great challenges. When I felt lost and alone and had no one to turn to, music was there for me. A big reason of why I became a singer/songwriter is to try and help others with my music by sharing my experiences and hopefully help others the way music helped me.

Music is power. And as a musician, I want to empower my fans to follow their dreams and know they can make a change. Anything is possible! It is my goal to make music that people can connect to. I want to help you get through those hard times and be there for your happiest moments as well.

I am at a point in my career where I am ready to launch my first full-length album - "Believe This!" - and start touring.

I want to have the freedom to create my own music and write from my heart without any fears or limitations, I want to share my experiences and deepest thoughts with you…and hopefully inspire you.

I can’t do this without your support. I need your help to keep creating more music and getting it out there.
 

 

Budget

 

Studio time $5,000

Producer fees $20,000

Engineer fees $2,500

Vocal training $1,000 (per month)

Band salary $3,600 (per month)

Management fees $2,450 (per month)

Music video $6,000-7,000 (per video)

Web site maintenance, marketing & art work $3,500 (per month)

Licensing $700

CD Manufacturing and Distribution: $2,400

Indie gogo fees -5%

Credit card fees -3%

Cost of goods & perks TBD

Grand total $53,730

I need YOUR help to get to the NEXT level.

I know that this is not a simple dream I have, but dreams DO come true for those who follow them and I definitely haven't come this far to stop now!

No matter whether I reach my full goal or not, your perks will be rewarded as promised.

 

The Impact

 

Every little bit counts. Here's more of how you can help:

 

  • Direct people to my Indiegogo page.
  • Share the campaign video on your Facebook page.
  • Email or tell your friends and family.

Together we can make this happen!

 

Risks & Challenges

I've been through so much to get to this point. Ive worked really hard to better myself as a person, grow as a singer and as an artist. At times I've had to work two jobs just to keep on going and do whatever it takes just not to give up. I've had to deal with self doubts and a lot of disbelievers. After all that, I didn't break; I've decided to turn any negativity to creativity which is why I'm calling my first album "Believe This!" My experiences motivate me, it has made me stronger and more determined to make it.

After all that, I didn't break; I've decided to turn any negativity to creativity which is why I'm calling my first album "Believe This!" My experiences motivate me, it has made me stronger and more determined to make it.

story:
NOTE: the video on this page is a live solo performance of the very new song "shake my head like a rattle" and i look forward to expanding this song into something really spectacular. :D

every year since 2012 i have written and recorded and released a new solo album. 2016 is no different! in fact, i've already got 17 songs recorded in demo form and soon i'll start tracking the songs for the finished album (the title as of right now is "Spelunking") - this is the free part!

later on, the costly things will pop up: mixing, mastering, artwork, manufacturing, distribution and promotion. these are all necessities but they can also put a little one-man-show like myself into serious financial quagmires. but you can help! if enough of you just contribute what you can, all the costly things will be taken care of and i won't have to sell any instruments. well, except that bass that i'll give away to the first $500 contributor!

for this year's album, i thought i'd just run free without any restrictions on what i do. the last few albums i kinda had ideas in my head that i didn't want to deviate from, but this time you'll hear: ROCK. A Capella. Brit Pop. A Folk song complete with singalong chorus of "La"s. Atmospheric Pop. Some keyboards. Vocal harmonies. at least one song that Tom Waits would love. a song in 7/4 time. and assorted other musical experiments that amuse me.

take a listen to last year's album sampler and then imagine it a lot more diverse with more different sounds and unexpected musical twists: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sB78PVgTFU0

as far as a timeframe, i'm estimating a May 2016 release, though it could be sooner depending on many factors. the advance digital version of the album should be available sometime in April.

so if you can, chip in a little something, spread the word and let's do this. i can promise that this album will be a doozy! :D

story:
Hey everybody!

My name is Alexis Taylor and I'm a singer/songwriter from Canada.  Growing up in the small town of Huntsville, Ontario, I spent most of my childhood and teenage years both singing and songwriting. Two years ago when I decided  to move to Nashville, Tennessee to pursue my dream of becoming a musician, I didn't know anybody.  I had to overcome the fear of moving to a city a thousand miles from my friends and family, with hopes of one day making it big in the music industry.

Since I've moved to Nashville, I've been writing more than ever and am finally ready to record my first album!  I'm excited to be recording my album with record producer and engineer, Matt Gordon.  Like myself, Matt is also a Canadian who moved to Nashville to pursue his dreams in music, and now owns and operates 1092 Studios. Matt is a graduate of the Music Production & Engineering program at Berklee College of Music and is nothing short of extremely talented. 

However, without a major label funding me, I won't be able to make this record without your help.  My project cost itself will be roughly $10,000.00 USD. My goal amount not only includes the cost to record, mix, and master the album but also distribute the album, promote it and market it. I am determined to make this the best album I possibly can and promise not to let you down. 

I cannot tell you how much your support and donations mean to me - I truly appreciate it and sincerely am so grateful. Any size donation helps and means the world to me, and I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for allowing me to continue to do what I have always dreamed of doing. 

Thank you,

Alexis Taylor

www.alexistaylormusic.com

story: I have been a musician all my life. In April I am 37 and will have been playing guitar for 31 years. I have been writing for almost 21 years. The opening track on my 1st album was written back when I was 18. I need to raise the funds to get into a professional studio to record all of my music and put it all out to the world. I already have 2 radio stations in the USA playing 2 songs off my album as well as several stations in the UK waiting for the full polished sound (including the BBC). My music is real, written by me and the lyrics have significance. You can listen for free at www.pspmm.bandcamp.com to my first album and to hear more of my collection go to www.youtube.com/+moonlitmelodies where, although they are all done with a mobile phone, you'll have an idea of what I am aiming to achieve. With studio time I will give the full band sound and not just my voice and a guitar. I hope you all see the potential as much as the majority of the young people who hear me do. Thank you for your help with this!

story:
About Switchboard

Since 2008, Switchboard has been presenting annual, eight-hour Festivals bringing together musicians and audiences from a wide variety of musical communities. 

Gamelan funk? Check. 

Heavy metal bass clarinets? Did it. And then did it again. 

World famous new music icons Kronos Quartet? Headlined in 2014. BOOM. 

Hip-hop, free improv, Filipino bamboo ensemble, amplified bramble dragged across the floor...so much great music, including a creative re-composing of Terry Riley's seminal In C by 51 of our closest friends. 

Now, on June 18, we're presenting our NINTH Festival and need some help from you to help make it another wonderfully eclectic feast for musical omnivores. 

Where does the money go?

Our single biggest expense is paying our incredible musicians—they are also the most rewarding checks we write all year. 

We've already raised about 60% of funds for the Festival, but really need that other 40% to get these folks what they deserve. 

We pride ourselves on supporting live music, and over 95% of the 150+ sets (that's almost 1,000 musicians) we have presented hail from the Bay Area. Supporting artists financially is as important as providing creative outlets, and we've spent nearly 10 years doing both. 

This year we're very proud to present the following lineup: 

1:00—Stay On It by Julius Eastman, performed by Switchboard alums
1:45—Majel Connery and Ken Ueno with The Living Earth Show
2:30—ZOFO
3:00—Dominique Leone's San Francisco
3:45—Tonal Masher
4:15—Religious Girls
5:00—Alisa Rose
5:30—Del Sol String Quartet
6:15—Grab It by Jacob TV, performed by The Living Earth Show and Ryan Brown
6:45—O+O+
7:30—San Francisco Girls Chorus
8:15—Tyondai Braxton (formerly of Battles)

No Shillings to Spare? 

Talk us up to your friends, family, dry goods grocer, medical caretakers...anyone! Even that person on BART you see regularly but never talk to. We're sure they would be a Switchboard fan. Indiegogo has lots of Share Tools to help make it easy. 

And, of course... 

Come to the Ninth Annual Switchboard Music Festival on June 18, 1-9pm, at Brava Theater!
(video by Taylor Joshua Rankin)
